column2: >""The film is a tribute to the visionary who redefined climbing style, the engineer who helped revolutionize climbing equipment, the artist whose iconic photography documented the most celebrated first ascents on Yosemite's big walls, and the conservationist who lead the international effort to save historic Camp 4, the traditional home and meeting place for Yosemite climbers.""  Steve Grossman

>The cleanest line to the top is to try to have this film 100% community funded. This is the one and only shot we have to tell this story correctly because we have access to Tom Frost and his legacy of friends. The generous brands associated with the film to date have donated product only, zero cash. This is why it's so important to spread the word.

column2: >Every single climber we have interviewed has taken time away from family, friends &amp
column3: climbing to help us achieve our goal.  They gave to us regardless of whom they are sponsored by. This is extremely rare... and in such ""good style"".  This is a reflection on how Tom Frost has lived his life. We feel that profiting from another person's “Life Story” or “Brand” goes against Flatlander Film’s core values. We have been given a “gift” to tell a life story and we will not profit from it.  Any and all profits will be donated to a charity of Tom Frost's choosing.

<b style=""letter-spacing: 0px
<div>
<span style=""font-style: normal

Independent Filmmakers aren’t unlike dirtbag climbers, we find a way to work on our passion with very little funding. But some things simply can’t get done on cat food. There are Tom Frost fans far and wide, and some of the most famous climbers in the world are, well, all around the world. We need to go to them to get their stories.
<div>
Funding will go towards travel expenses such as hotel accommodations and airfare, and will also allow Tom and Jeff the time to focus on this project uninterrupted.
The importance of this project is to recognize Tom Frost for all his contributions
<ul>
• Revolutionizing the climbing world - not only focusing on better products, which led to improved safety, but also leading in the ""clean"" climbing movement.
• Being an amazing photographer and capturing some of the most recognizable images of the golden age of climbing.
• Personally funding a campaign to save Camp 4 at Yosemite.
<li><b>Being a great American hero &amp

Every athlete we have interviewed put themselves above their sponsors to give us their time. Why would a bunch of flatlanders (non climbers) be so inspired to do this? This story goes way beyond climbing. This film, if done correctly and with your help, has the ability to inspire people to get outside, be safe, and courteous to Mother Earth.

column2: >Filmmakers Tom Seawell and Jeff Wiant are both Santa Barbara Brooks Institute graduates. Seawell, based in San Francisco, is an award winning photographer who expanded into film and motion in the past decade. Wiant is an award winning portrait photographer whose video production company in San Diego is a go to shop when a project needs some sizzle. Together, they thought they had a neat little project on their hands when they approached Tom Frost, founder of Chimera Lighting Equipment, a man that they worked with in the world of photography. Chimera is an industry leader and a brand that changed the movie and photography landscape.

>Seawell was lucky enough to have worked with Tom Frost in the past, and this working relationship lead to this project being born.  The goal: to create a film about the legendary climber, photographer, &amp
>Frost immediately started calling Seawell and Wiant (who had never been out of the housekeeping cabins in Yosemite) “flatlanders” and the production company name was born: Flatlander Films.
>To be able to tell this story is a gift to Tom and Jeff. Please help them in completing their goal.

column1: ","Campaign has ended...Thank you!
Number of friends have asked if they can still donate. Youbetcha! http://flatlanderfilms.com/donate/
Need a tax deduction by the end of the year? You can donate now through our non profit affiliate. Email tom@flatlanderfilms.com for more information.
PERKS!
Why we need your help!

The film is a tribute to the visionary who redefined climbing style, the engineer who helped revolutionize climbing equipment, the artist whose iconic photography documented the most celebrated first ascents on Yosemite's big walls, and the conservationist who lead the international effort to save historic Camp 4, the traditional home and meeting place for Yosemite climbers.""  Steve Grossman
Learn About Tom Frost: http://flatlanderfilms.com/tomfrost/
Check out the perks: http://flatlanderfilms.com/perks/
Our Philosophy:

The cleanest line to the top is to try to have this film 100% community funded. This is the one and only shot we have to tell this story correctly because we have access to Tom Frost and his legacy of friends. The generous brands associated with the film to date have donated product only, zero cash. This is why it's so important to spread the word.

Every single climber we have interviewed has taken time away from family, friends & climbing to help us achieve our goal.  They gave to us regardless of whom they are sponsored by. This is extremely rare... and in such ""good style"".  This is a reflection on how Tom Frost has lived his life. We feel that profiting from another person's “Life Story” or “Brand” goes against Flatlander Film’s core values. We have been given a “gift” to tell a life story and we will not profit from it.  Any and all profits will be donated to a charity of Tom Frost's choosing.
What’s the money for?

Independent Filmmakers aren’t unlike dirtbag climbers, we find a way to work on our passion with very little funding. But some things simply can’t get done on cat food. There are Tom Frost fans far and wide, and some of the most famous climbers in the world are, well, all around the world. We need to go to them to get their stories.
Funding will go towards travel expenses such as hotel accommodations and airfare, and will also allow Tom and Jeff the time to focus on this project uninterrupted.
The importance of this project is to recognize Tom Frost for all his contributions
Revolutionizing the climbing world - not only focusing on better products, which led to improved safety, but also leading in the ""clean"" climbing movement.
Being an amazing photographer and capturing some of the most recognizable images of the golden age of climbing.
Personally funding a campaign to save Camp 4 at Yosemite.
Being a great American hero & climbing legend
Who are these guys?

This project has been 100% funded by Tom Seawell & Jeff Wiant for the past 4 years. A true grass roots passion project. The only money received prior to the Indiegogo campaign was from a private donation of $5000 to hire a lawyer to make sure we do this adventure correctly and in ""good style"". Jeff and Tom both have our own production companies.  www.seawellproductions.com & www.solidproductions.com.

This is what they do on a daily basis. They own all their own gear and both love to be behind the camera. Tom loves to interview, produce and direct. Jeff loves to edit, art direct & write.  We are very fortunate to be frugal, small and capable of creating the illusion of great production value. Jeff's & his sister designed the patch and sticker. Seawell's mother has transcribed 40 hours of interviews and is our bookkeeper. Everyone on our team has been a volunteer to date. Every athlete we have interviewed put themselves above their sponsors to give us their time. Why would a bunch of flatlanders (non climbers) be so inspired to do this? This story goes way beyond climbing. This film, if done correctly and with your help, has the ability to inspire people to get outside, be safe, and courteous to Mother Earth.

Filmmakers Tom Seawell and Jeff Wiant are both Santa Barbara Brooks Institute graduates. Seawell, based in San Francisco, is an award winning photographer who expanded into film and motion in the past decade. Wiant is an award winning portrait photographer whose video production company in San Diego is a go to shop when a project needs some sizzle. Together, they thought they had a neat little project on their hands when they approached Tom Frost, founder of Chimera Lighting Equipment, a man that they worked with in the world of photography. Chimera is an industry leader and a brand that changed the movie and photography landscape.

Seawell was lucky enough to have worked with Tom Frost in the past, and this working relationship lead to this project being born.  The goal: to create a film about the legendary climber, photographer, & engineer Tom Frost.
Frost immediately started calling Seawell and Wiant (who had never been out of the housekeeping cabins in Yosemite) “flatlanders” and the production company name was born: Flatlander Films.
To be able to tell this story is a gift to Tom and Jeff. Please help them in completing their goal.
Why does this movie NEED to be made?
Since beginning production, not one person approached has declined an interview"" - Tom Seawell

Flatlander Films has been self-funded and already completed over 40 interviews, and through this funding effort, they will be able to reach their goal: to focus on this project full time. To do that, they need to hit their goal financially, allowing them to complete this project within a year. Time is of the essence as, unfortunately, nobody is getting any younger!
Since Tom and Jeff own their production companies, they have the knowledge and experience required to get this production completed.
What’s the money for?

Independent Filmmakers aren’t unlike dirtbag climbers, we find a way to work on our passion with very little funding. But some things simply can’t get done on cat food. There are Tom Frost fans far and wide, and some of the most famous climbers in the world are, well, all around the world. We need to go to them to get their stories.
Funding will go towards travel expenses such as hotel accommodations and airfare, and will also allow Tom and Jeff the time to focus on this project uninterrupted.
The importance of this project is to recognize Tom Frost for all his contributions
Revolutionizing the climbing world - not only focusing on better products, which led to improved safety, but also leading in the ""clean"" climbing movement.
Being an amazing photographer and capturing some of the most recognizable images of the golden age of climbing.
Personally funding a campaign to save Camp 4 at Yosemite.
Being a great American hero & climbing legend.

This is such an important project to Tom and Jeff and your help with this campaign is essential. But they're not just after your money. Any help you can provide by spreading the word of this project would be greatly appreciated. The more people that know about this legend, and all he has done for the climbing community and environment, the better!
Thank you!",1.0,1,"1 Campaign

Our Film

Animus is a psychological thriller based around Carl Gustav Jung’s theory of collective unconscious. The story starts with Jane, a professional woman who finds her life falling apart when she keeps her newfound pregnancy a secret. Through a surreal twist, Jane steps into her past wounds to reconcile her estranged complexes.
<div>

Our Passion

This film explores a viewpoint that Carl Gustav Jung spent limited time writing about: the female perspective. CG Jung and his wife, Emma, have made great claims that, mentally, women are mirror opposites of men, therefore unequal to the latter. Many of the conclusions the Jungs came to about women psyche were based on mens works. This is an unfair representation of a woman’s mind and I was propelled to use my own creative outlet to showcase an atypical female protagonist through the lens of this theory.
<div>

Our Audience

Animus appeals to anyone interested in investigating the human mind. You do not have to be familiar with Jung to enjoy Jane’s story
column2: this is a raw exploration of a woman’s perspective. Although Jungian fans will be rewarded: the psyche is explored through Jungian symbolism and archetypes. All movie-lovers welcome.

column1: Our Goal
<div>

So much talent and passion has already gone into Animus, yet we need money if we are going to bring it to life. This story needs $5,000 to achieve the visual aesthetic it deserves. Your support will be going to:
-Locations
-Craft Servies for Cast/Crew
-Transportation
-Detailed Art/Costume Department
-Special Effects Make-Up
-Post Production
All camera and lighting equipment generously provided by Columbia College Chicago.

Our perks include original posters, t-shirts, paintings and sculptures, all tied into Carl Jung's theories- including the perks named after his archetypal theory! 

If we exceed our $5,000 goal, all additional proceeds will go to festival fees.
Our Team

Shannon Callsen - Writer/Director/Producer

Shannon Callsen is an award-winning author of several writing competitions, including the Upstate Eight Literary Festival. It was her teenage years when she recognized her passion for directing, and now pursues a Bachelors Degree in Cinema Arts &
column2: Science at Columbia College Chicago. After several directing courses and freelancing as a script supervisor for the past two years, Shannon feels ready and confident that she can run a set, bring forth worthy performances, and fully realize her vision for Animus.

column1: Shannon's Reel: https://vimeo.com/122669737

Gerardo Duran - Assistant Director/Producer

Born and raised in the south side of Chicago, Gerardo has had to face an upward battle. Driven solely by his passion for cinema, Gerardo founded his past high-school’s first film club. He now returns to teach the class. He has also worked closely with the Art Institute of Chicago for three years where he was hired to create various short films. He is an actor, writer, producer and assistant director. He is thorough, extremely organized, and is excited to collaborate with the Animus team!
Alex Halstead - Director of Photography

Alex has been telling stories through video for the past 6 years. He enjoys the unique challenges of expressing story and emotion visually, whether it's capturing a rare moment in documentary or finessing the lighting in narrative. Since attending Columbia he has won the Dues Ex Machina award for his short film in addition to shooting 5 graduate level projects. In his spare time Alex has held production roles at my50 TV show, Crime Stoppers: Case Files as well as assisted professors on their own projects.
Alex's Website: http://halsteadvisuals.com/home
Mitch Ransdell - Production Designer

Mitchell Ransdell is a Chicago-based artist and filmmaker. A graduate of Columbia College Chicago, he finds his home and happiness in whichever alleyway, cornfield, or sound stage his crew is filming in!
Assata Terrell - Costume Designer

column5: >I am a fashion student at Columbia College Chicago. I am interested in how fashion and personal style collide with the rest of the world. My favorite part about working in film is that I get to create styles and life stories behind the characters. I hope to create and work on projects that combine all my fascinations and connect with others on a personal level.

column1: Assata's website: Assataterrell.virb.com
Josh Gaetz - SFX Make-Up

column5: >Throughout my life I have dabbled with almost every known medium of art, including things like traditional painting, pottery, sewing, crochet, weaving, graphic arts, web design, 3d model design, etc. You name it and I've probably done it, and if I haven't, I would like to some day. I've been experimenting with special effects makeup for around 6 years. I have been constantly inspired by artists behind the camera, and always imagined what it would be like to work in film. My goal is to bring as much of my talent and knowledge to this film as I can possibly offer, so you can expect some pretty realistic and awesome looking end results!

column1:
Dennis Preston - Artist

When I finished high school I set out to the American Academy of Art, where I majored in illustration. Knowing that the art world is tough and very competitive, I decided to widen my expertise and become a jack of all trades, so to speak. But the one thing that I have always loved the most is horror films and special effects, so I decided that make up effects and filming would be my main focus. Now I freelance creating props and special effects makeup work for independent filmmakers in and around the Chicago area.
Dennis' website: prestonperspectives.com

Piper Johnson - Concept Artist

More work displayed on https://instagram.com/piperrepip/
<h3>Risks &amp

This is quite an ambitious pursuit: raise $5,000 in two weeks, do Carl Jung justice, secure stunning locations, find the right talent, not to mention the constant rotation of various obstacles that come with the making of any film. But that’s why we love our craft: to problem solve, to create large out of few supplies, and to gain experience and become better filmmakers every step of the way. This industry is about taking risks, and we hope that you’ll take the leap with us. Feel free to comment with any questions below.
Other Ways You Can Help
Spreading our social media and campaign is a great way to help if you cannot donate! Every share, every tweet- it all helps.
Thank you.

Who We Are

What We Need

Our campaign is set up as Flexible Funding.  Even if we don't reach our ultimate goal, we'll still get the funds that were donated.  This doesn't mean we'll send ourselves on a weekend break to the coast as consolation. We'll still be able to achieve other goals that could lead to our bigger goals over time.

$5,000 will help us get the licensing and inventory we need to sell some of our goods through third parties.  Selling our goods to local shops requires longer times in a commercial kitchen, a larger supply of ingredients and packaging, extra transport expenses, and different licensing.  What we can earn with all of that will help us move on to our next goal.

$10,000 will help us get a better delivery vehicle with the Plum logo, thermal bags to keep hot food hot and cold food cold, and marketing materials to get more business for our meal delivery service.

$30,000 will help us set up a Plum a food truck.

$50,000 will get us started on a small brick-and-mortar location so our customers can walk in, sit down, and not have to wait for delivery.

If we pass one goal, but don't quite reach the next, the extra funding will go into a bank account, to be put toward future investment in our business.
Extra Rewards for Goals Achieved
Everyone who helps fund our campaign will get the incentive they chose. Of course!
In addition, we will send extra recipes to everyone who donates, as higher goals are achieved:
$10,000: lavender sugar.
$20,000: French Tart jam, plus the above.
$30,000: caper sea salt, plus the above.
$40,000: Asian pear shrub, plus the above.
$50,000: pickled black cherries, plus the above.
What We Do

We work markets and fairs, and cater parties and events, but mostly we design custom meal plans for weekly deliveries. Some of our customers are retired folks who just want to relax after a lifetime of hard work.  Some have very specialized diets due to medical issues.  Some are new parents, who want to focus on their littlest family member and not on shopping and cooking.  Some are busy building their own careers, and don't have the time or desire to cook a meal at the end of the day.  Some work full-time jobs and have small children to look after in the evenings.  Some just want to eat good food.

Whatever reason a customer has, we design meal plans that suit what they want and need, use local, organic produce and meat wherever possible, and make sure we never use an ingredient that could cause an allergic reaction.  We make nearly everything from scratch, including breads and salad dressings.  If we do need to use a prepared item, such as soy sauce or miso, we buy organic.
What We've Achieved

We've spent more than a year getting to grips with our new business, honing our skills, becoming more efficient with our time, and finding out what our customers really want.  With each new thing we try, we take note of what works, what doesn't, and why.  Changes that need to be made, get made, and we adapt quickly.  We know that new businesses often fail, and food businesses are at the top of that list.  That's why we've taken the time and made the effort to find out what works best for us.
Please Share!
Even if you can't contribute financially, you can still help us out by sharing links to our IndieGogo campaign.  Who knows?  Maybe your contacts will be inspired by your faith in us!

We've spent more than a year getting to grips with our new business, honing our skills, becoming more efficient with our time, and finding out what our customers really want.  With each new thing we try, we take note of what works, what doesn't, and why.  Changes that need to be made, get made, and we adapt quickly.  We know that new businesses often fail, and food businesses are at the top of that list.  That's why we've taken the time and made the effort to find out what works best for us.
Please Share!

Even if you can't contribute financially, you can still help us out by sharing links to our IndieGogo campaign.  Who knows?  Maybe your contacts will be inspired by your faith in us!",6.0,0,"1 Campaign
|","Portland, United States",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/plum-portland/pica

When your family, your friends, the people you know don't like your style, but you have deep inside of you the feeling that this is what you have to do. This is your future, and you don't understand why but slowly you go towards it.

If you are one of the few people that are lucky to do the work that they'd dreamed of, But slowly the commercial of the society in a way or an other makes your dream job becoming a nightmare, because you're forced to do everytime what people likes. And everytime i do something my style, my way, is rejected! And slowly my vision becomes the same of everyone's else.

Afterwards you do what you know they will like, then they will treat you like an incredible artist. But you look in the mirror and you notice is not you and also notice the real you that you let slowly to die.

Is amazing the sensation when someone understands the message you want to send, to transmit the feeling that you felt, to connect for that moments two different persons in a magical moment.

That's why I am curious to see if other people around the world connect with what i am feeling. And if they respect it to make me continue to do what I am feeling to do.

Personal freedom is a videopoetry of 1 minute and 47 seconds that reflects Personal feelings. All is personalized from the background music, voice, words and video. Is a time consuming process to make and connect them to have the meaning that i want.

The videopoetry ""Personal Freedom"" has a way to look at it, to really connect with the message. If you have headphones and a comfortable place to sit, it will be perfect. First of starting to view it is better to close the eyes for 7 seconds, take 4 big breaths and relax the shoulders and after push play.

I try to make ""Personal Freedom"" to have a different view of the present. To feel an experience when you watch it, to leave some questions in the mind of the viewer.

In case you look at it and you feel, it was interesting please share. If some people see it and donate enough it will motivate me to create more.

Please help me achieve the freedom to do more.

About me!


  • Hi everyone! My name is Kara Ferwerda and I am a photographer! I have always loved taking photos and share my talents with others. I have lived all over but I just got married and now live in Taylorsville Utah.
  • I am doing this campaign to help me raise the funds to get studio equipment that I need. Getting the funds to get the equipment is really important for me because I will be able to produce high quality photos and create the images that tell stories.
  • You as a contributor will be helping me achieve one of my many goals as a photographer! Getting the equipment I need is just the first step in the right direction!


What We Need &
column2:
What You Get


  • I am wanting to raise $6,000 dollars which will all be going to get studio equipment such as lights, backdrops,stands, reflectors, props and ect. The bigger picture to where all the funds will be going is to help to create a successful photography studio! 
  • My perks are all for YOU!! For thanking you for contributing!! Depending on the perk you choose you either get a HUGE thank you or some of your personal photos edited my me! 
  • If I do not reach my funded amount the remaining funds will be used to get the equipment for my studio. 

Making a difference 

  • Like I have said earlier as well as in my video I want to create, inspire, and tell stories with my photos. This will give the opportunity for others to do the same as well.  With your help I will be able to make a difference in the world with pictures of people's lives.  I want to make a difference in people's lives with my photography and help them feel important!!

SHORT SUMMARY

Long Island Lights is a half-hour comedic TV show about a group of misfits who come together to chase after celebrity in hopes of conquering Hollywood. They do so in the age of frenzied social media and viral videos where success seems one click away. They are dead set on making it big BUT they have no idea what they are doing.
It's about family and giving crazy a chance (both often go hand-in-hand).

The show follows a ‘stuck in the system’ office worker, who after a quarter life crisis, has an embarrassing video (involving his balls) that goes viral and turns him into a reluctant internet star. He then returns to his family home
in Long Island where he joins an amateur production company who believe they
are bound for Hollywood, but in reality couldn’t be further from it.

column5: >CHECK OUT SOME OF OUR COOL VIDEOS

column1: LIL Video Gallery

We have an incredible cast and crew that's been working on this project for close to three years now. We have filmed a lot of promotional footage and even filmed about 40% of our pilot episode. But we need IndieGoGo and your help to finish the rest of our Pilot episode!
Living just below
the shallow surface of social media is a strong undercurrent of relationships
and familial bonds forged through the wild and often crazy schemes cooked up
regularly by these misfits. Although they stumble every step of the way, the
important part is that they are living life, together as friends and family.
On a weekly basis, Long Island Lights messes up the most
routine productions. At one point, a commercial turns into a puppy mill operation
while in the next episode a frustrated Rick creates his own gay film festival
featuring his gay zombie apocalypse movie, ‘EAT’ only to place 8<sup>th</sup>
at his own festival. The crew finds themselves pitching MTV ½ to MTV, an idea
that all popular shows would be reenacted using midgets.
As
the series develops we find that sometimes a little crazy can lead to unexpected
success in the best of ways.
PERKS
Mention on Nationally-syndicated radio show hosted by actor Kevin Barbaro.
Long Island Lights Official Poster (Signed)
Limited Edition ""Octopus Playing the Drum"" T-shirt
Signed copy of the Pilot Script
Official Signed Cast Photo
THE TEAM
Producers: AJ Scordio &
Production &
column2: AD team: Tullia Zanfini, Russell Jonas, Caleb Larson

column1: Camera Department: Philipp Pchelin, Vladimir Timchuck, Christian Caicedo
Lighting &
column2: Grip department:  Alexander Aguirre, Elias Morales

column1: Hair and Makeup: Leilani Sunglao /// Costume designer: Ornella Chiossone
Art Department: /// Kory Diskin  Social Media Coordinator: Jillian Weston
LEAD ACTORS
KEVIN BARBARO as RICK SELLERS
KRISTINA CLOETINGH as VICKY SELLERS
AJ SCORDIO as JAMES AGNELLI
NIKO PAPASTEFANOU as MARCO AGNELLI
MARTIN YURKOVIC as DONNY MARTIN
<h3>JOIN US!
To turn our pilot screenplay into a full-length television episode,
we’re going to need some help. Your contribution will not only get us
one step closer to production - it gives us the momentum necessary to
show television networks, investors and production houses that there is
an audience for Long Island Lights.
Your contribution will make the difference between this project
remaining a dream and becoming a hit television show that will receive
national attention.
Here’s how we’ll use the funds raised:
<h3>Risks &amp
You're a part of
this now, and it's important to us to respect that by keeping the lines
of communication open and honest along the way.Our greatest challenge is to achieve the highest quality of production
possible even with the limited resources we have available for this
project. To do justice to this story, we want to tell it in the most
creative, innovative way possible. Producing a film is difficult, however, we have spent the last three years working on
this project and we are determined to see it through to the end.

Short Summary

The CQ Mariners FC was formed in 2014 being based at Brian Niven Park in Gladstone Central Queensland.  The club is a Not-For-Profit organisation and relies on community assistance to provide this opportunity to young players in the Gladstone and Rockhampton areas.

This campaign has been commenced to raise much needed funds to maintain current facilities at the club such as the grounds and buildings.  To date, much of the equipment used by the club is in excess of 20 years old and requires continual maintenance.  The funds raised will be for the sole purpose of ensuring the club can continue to operate for the development of football in the region.
What We Need &
column2:
What You Get

Contributions to the club will be spent on the following:

  • Automated watering system for the field

column1:
• Dressing rooms for the junior players with toilets and showers
  • A ride on mower

Our committee is aiming at raising $50,000 which will cover some of the costs to purchase this much needed equipment.  Failing to raise these funds is not an option for our children and fundraising continues at the club on a daily basis.
We wish to provide this opportunity for our children today and for future members of our club in the years to come.

The Impact

Every Not For Profit Organisation struggles to raise funds for their members.  The funds raised will have a significant impact on the services that the club can offer to its junior members.  :

  • The future of Central Queensland Football is with the CQ Mariners Football Club.  We are the only avenue in this region for junior footballers to be selected for State teams.
  • In 2015 the club has nominated a new executive committee and a key focus has been directed towards raising funds to ensure the programs sustainability .
  • Our membership is open to all members of the football community in the Central Queensland region.

Risks &
column2:
Challenges

The CQ Mariners FC is still in its infancy stage as an organisation.  The club itself faces many obstacles, however, our 6 person executive committee is working tirelessly to ensure that the club remains viable.

column1: Donations in the past have included fence panels where families have been formerly acknowledged for their contributions to the club.

Many volunteer hours are completed at the club via the golf driving range and the children picking up golf balls from the fields on weekends.  This practice assists in weekly costs at the club, however are not sufficient to sustain long term viability of the club.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't assist with the club financially, the club is always seeking hands on volunteers to cut the grass, operate the canteen and conduct maintenance on the grounds.  The tasks are endless.
Not everyone has the ability to donate, and we as a committee can appreciate this.  Don't forget that just spreading the word and using the Indiegogo share tools helps a lot too!!

Short Summary
CHNGNF8.org is a 501(c)(3) non-profit.
The Kiss: A Musical is a story about a man at the end of his rope, and a women that won't let go.

By contributing to our second film you will be part of a production that seeks to ease the drama of living with cancer. We are here and thriving, we just feel a little isolated at times. Other times we feel as if marked by the scarlet letter ""C"". And still other times it is like it never happened at all. Help us provide content that may help chip away at the emotional wall that we survivors sometimes find our selves on the other side of. No pity necessary, we'll show you what we need. Help us make the film so we can move forward with this important mission.
My name is Tracy E. Thomas. I was visited by metastatic kidney cancer for a second time in 2012. I am currently undergoing treatment at M.D. Anderson in Houston, TX.

I am also a writer, musician and a stuntman. In my last 8 feature films I have been on Votrient (Pazopanib) and I am currently in remission.

Regarding cancer, it seems our culture is ""cure"" focused. That is great because many are alive as a result of those efforts. However, as a survivor, I found that after the cancer was contained I found it difficult to relate to the world I once so eagerly occupied. I had undergone change. These changes were not only physical ones, but mental and emotional ones too. 

As an artist, I recoiled to my creative self and healed. My journey now illuminated in the art I help create. This is most cathartic for the survivor artist and empowering for other survivors, because they too can see their journey in the traces of my own. 
At CHNGNF8.org it is our mission to create short-form content that resonates with the survivor/caregiver. We seek to make our own films, and offer scholarships for other  survivor artists to do the same. 

What We Need
We are asking for $11,383.00 for production, post production and promotion.
<div><ul><li>
<b style=""text-align: center

Other Ways You Can Help

Some just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
  • Make sure and use the Indiegogo share tools!

ABOUT
What is Wallabout?

Named after the historic area of Brooklyn once known as Wallabout Bay, the Wallabout Film Festival is a student film festival produced and curated by an interdisciplinary team of students from Pratt Institute. Showcasing films by innovative student filmmakers from around the world, Wallabout is a platform for students to screen their work to a diverse community of peers as well as industry professionals, initiating conversation and collaboration. Set in Brooklyn, the annual event contributes to the vibrant creative culture of NYC.
When and where does Wallabout take place?
Wallabout 2015, our 7th annual festival, will take place on April 23! For more information, check back here and stay connected with us via the social media links at the top of the site.
Will filmmakers attend?
Yes! Wallabout is not only a film festival, but also a way to network with other creative students, and an opportunity to meet industry professionals at our party! We would love to see you there!
Who will be judging the films at Wallabout?

A panel of industry professionals typically make up Wallabout’s jury – a cross-section of filmmakers, programmers, journalists, academics, and other industry. In addition, attendees get to have their say as well through Wallabout’s Audience Award.

What We Need &
column2:
What You Get
  • We have been allotted a very small budget from Pratt Institute to organize the festival and everything associated with it – from the venue rental to the afterparty - but it doesn't cover all of our expenses. Combined with ticket sales, we hope this campaign will help us make up the rest of the budget we need to ensure the smooth operation of the event. Backers' generous contributions will help cover the cost of our venue rental, promotional materials, programs, and posters.

column1:
• We're looking to raise at least $1,000 to put towards the above-mentioned costs. We'd like to make Wallabout an experience to remember for both those who attend and those who showcase their work. 
  • Contributions will go towards things such as food/drinks, promotional material, venue rental, awards for winning filmmakers, and swag bags for all filmmakers/jury in attendance.

• For donating, please see our perks for each amount contributed!

    • The Impact

    Why donate to Wallabout?

    • This is one of the few platforms in the country and world that allows students to not only curate and operate their own film festival but also include the work of fellow students from all over the world!
    • This is the 7th Annual Wallabout Film Festival, meaning we have successfully completed six previous festivals with the same goal in mind: to support the art of filmmaking and event planning for student artists around the world
    • We need your help. Putting this show together is exciting and rewarding, but most of all it costs money. We need generous sponsors like you to believe in our goals and aspirations in order to provide this opportunity for students.

    Risks &

Backing a project of any kind financially is more than just pledging funds to a creator or group. It's pledging your support to a creative idea you want to see really exist in the world. Launching an Indiegogo campaign is a very public task, and doing so puts our reputation as students, filmmakers and artists at risk.

It's our job to to complete this goal given the circumstances and support that lies ahead. As a backer, we hope that you'll hold us accountable to this. If you can't contribute financially, we appreciate your time spent reading about this project. We hope that you'll share it with family and friends through social media and spread the word. You are just as vital as the funding itself!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to let others know about our cause! The shortlink to this campaign is:
• Follow us on social media to reblog or retweet our progress!

• Just give us your positive vibes and prayers in order to get this show on the road!

    • And that's all there is to it.

We'd like to make Wallabout an experience to remember for both those who attend and those who showcase their work.  Contributions will go towards things such as food/drinks, promotional material, venue rental, awards for winning filmmakers, and swag bags for all filmmakers/jury in attendance.

For donating, please see our perks for each amount contributed!    The Impact Why donate to Wallabout?  This is one of the few platforms in the country and world that allows students to not only curate and operate their own film festival but also include the work of fellow students from all over the world! This is the 7th Annual Wallabout Film Festival, meaning we have successfully completed six previous festivals with the same goal in mind: to support the art of filmmaking and event planning for student artists around the world We need your help. Putting this show together is exciting and rewarding, but most of all it costs money. We need generous sponsors like you to believe in our goals and aspirations in order to provide this opportunity for students.    Risks & Challenges

Backing a project of any kind financially is more than just pledging funds to a creator or group. It's pledging your support to a creative idea you want to see really exist in the world. Launching an Indiegogo campaign is a very public task, and doing so puts our reputation as students, filmmakers and artists at risk.

It's our job to to complete this goal given the circumstances and support that lies ahead. As a backer, we hope that you'll hold us accountable to this. If you can't contribute financially, we appreciate your time spent reading about this project. We hope that you'll share it with family and friends through social media and spread the word. You are just as vital as the funding itself!

Other Ways You Can Help Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:  Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign! Use the Indiegogo share tools to let others know about our cause! The shortlink to this campaign is: http://igg.me/at/wallaboutff
Follow us on social media to reblog or retweet our progress!
Just give us your positive vibes and prayers in order to get this show on the road!   And that's all there is to it.",0.0,0,"1 Campaign
|","Brooklyn, United States",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/7th-annual-wallabout-film-festival/pica

0,"


///////////// ENGLISH
Dear donators,

The Cinedia team wants to thank you for supporting the crowdfunding campaign : Vitamin C, the Unsung Molecule (http://igg.me/at/vitaminc).

The budget will allow us to produce a short documentary that will present the author's story, how he found out about Vitamin C and how he managed to cure his fiance from tuberculosis with high doses intravenous Vitamin C. We will also interview doctors involved and show other experiences from around the world.

We will keep you informed through this newsletter and the website : Vitamin C, The Unsung Molecule.

This documentary movie will be ready by the first semester of 2016, and will be broadcasted for free on youtube. This is the first step for us before a longer movie, that we will to produce with broadcasting networks or foundations.

Your comments and ideas are welcome, feel free to contact us for any question that might arise.

Best regards,

Cinedia

//// FRANCAIS >
column3:
Chers donateurs

L'équipe de Cinedia tient à vous exprimer toute sa gratitude pour avoir
soutenu la campagne de financement participatif du film : Vitamine C, la
molécule oubliée (http://igg.me/at/vitaminc).

Le budget obtenu grâce à cette campagne nous permettra de réaliser un film
de 15 à 20 minutes qui présentera l'enquête de l'auteur et l'histoire de la
guérison du cas de tuberculose grâce à l'injection de vitamine C, ainsi que
des entrevues avec les médecins impliqués dans cette guérison et des aperçus
des expériences liées à la vitamine C à travers le monde.

Vous serez tenu au courant de nos avancées grâce à cette newsletter et le
site internet: Vitamine C, la molécule oubliée.

Ce film documentaire sera prêt au premier semestre 2016, diffusé
gratuitement sur youtube, et sera la  première pierre  pour approcher des
financeurs institutionnels (télévisions, fondations, etc.) afin de réaliser
une version longue de ce documentaire.

Vos réactions et idées sont les bienvenues, nous restons à votre entière
disposition pour toute suggestion et/ou tout complément d'information.

cordialement, bonnes vacances

L'équipe de Cinedia

====================================

column1: This
film constitutes a unique opportunity to deal with the Vitamin C topic in an in-depth
manner and to provide a real

audio-visual reference to the widest audience possible across the world.

A UNIQUE INVESTIGATION
SHOT AROUND THE WORLD :

JAPAN / USA / ARGENTINA / FRANCE / SPAIN AUSTRIA / ALGERIA / BELGIUM / TUNISIA
MOROCCO / GERMANY / CANADA
...
Now is the opportunity to benefit from the making of a quality movie
that will be released for FREE on Youtube in 2016. Thanks to YOUR

support.

To date, there is no satisfying documentary
that can provide a clear and detailed picture of the situation to the general

public.


WARNING

The film in no way replaces a medical consultation or advice of health care professionals. Only your doctor or specialist is authorized to establish a medical diagnosis and the appropriate treatment.

We recall that this film is not intended to create a controversy over conventional medicine. Instead, the film will present tangible facts, experiences and discoveries.
On February the 9th, 2014, the BBC published an article on a team of American
scientists who obtained surprising results in the treatment of cancer by
massive intravenous injections of vitamin C.
In Japan, following the Fukushima disaster, Professor Atsuo
Yanagisawa successfully treated Japanese soldiers using the same method.

So why isn’t this research pushed further and the results obtained with the use of Vitamin C made public?
Check this video :
Orthomolecular medicine draws its origins from a revolutionary discovery

made in the thirties by American biochemist and chemical engineer Irwin Stone.

This finding represents a huge shift
in the understanding we have of human health: ascorbic acid, better known under
the name of vitamin C, appears to be at the heart of the biochemical processes

that condition life.

Taken in high doses, it proves to be more powerful than

antibiotics and kills most viruses.

Double Nobel Prize
Linus Pauling devoted 40 years of his life to studying and working on vitamin

C.

He became the precursor of “orthomolecular medicine”, a name he coined in
1968 to refer to a form of medicine able to cure people thanks to natural
molecules that are known by the organism.
Eminent doctors and scientists from the whole world built on the work of
LINUS PAULING. <b>To them, there is not the shred of a doubt: Vitamin C

should be at the heart of public health systems.

Unfortunately, health
organisations don't seem to be very interested in the preventive and curative
potential of vitamin C.
A great section of the medical profession always tends to refute these
studies, most of the time out of ignorance about the real properties of this
molecule. It is true that pharmacy and medicine faculties do not offer any
specific tuition on this subject.
So what should we think of the silence that reins around some truly

spectacular results?



The film will be shot in Japan, USA, France, Algeria, Tunisia, Spain, Argentina, Austria, Belgium, Morocco, Germany and Canada depending on the funds collected.

column2:
/>


Several international specialists in orthomolecular medicine and researchers will be

column1:
interviewed from their workplace.

Their discourses will crosscut each other to draw up an overview of the global situation. Their input will widen the field
of the possible applications of this molecule in our daily lives. They
will reveal cases of conclusive experiments but also of known healings

and explain to us why their research is trapped in silence.

They will discuss amongst other the following : poliomyelitis
&amp
column2: pneumonia, cot death, nuclear radiation, hepatitises primary

column1:
infection, multi drug and ultra resistant tuberculosis, cancer…


- Dr Ilyes BAGHLI, ALGERIA : President of the Algerian Society for Nutrition and Orthomolecular Medecine (SANMO),
- Pr. Thomas Edward LEVY, USA :
American doctor specialized in cardiology (1981) and Doctor of Law and

lawyer (1998).
- Pr. William JACOBS, USA :
Professor of immunology, biology, and genetics at the Albert Einstein

College of Medicine of the Yeshiva University (New York – USA).
- Pr. Atsuo YANAGISAWA, JAPAN : Japanese professor and doctor. President of the International Society for Orthomolecular Medicine (ISOM).
- Dr Monique BEJAT, FRANCE : Doctor, Nutrition and Micronutrition therapist. President of Kousmine France.
-  Dr Julien DROUIN, FRANCE :
Vice President of the Global Alliance for

Improved Health ( APAGS ).
- Pr. Gilbert Henri CRUSSOL, SPAIN : French professor, Ex-Intern at the Harvard Forsyth institute in Boston (USA).
- Michel DUMESTRE, FRANCE : Nutrionist and Naturopath

More specialists to come, depending on the funds collected.



Monaam Kraïem, a young French Filmmaker, is the author of
the film.
<b>He would have never known
about the Tuberculosis intravenous Vitamin C protocol, had Sourour, his fiancée, not almost lost her life to this disease.
On the basis of his experience,
he decided to share the fruits of his investigation on the matter in

this documentary movie.

Find out about his story here :

This film originates from a personal
initiative that is supported by a
team of professionals with demonstrated quality technical skills. <b>Its

“ free ” nature is the pledge of its integrity. It is not a documentary movie produced by a TV channel for a TV channel.

It is about an intention
that is based on a citizen spirit and motivation, on a real-life story with a
desire to convey what has happened in a sincere manner. <b>We are not after
sensational news or controversy, but we rather seek enlightened objectivity.

This movie will be shot from September 2015 to April 2016.

We will have amazing interviews and experiences from all around the world to share that will have huge impact in helping people understand Vitamin C properties.
The movie will be released for FREE on Youtube by the end of 2016 so that everybody will be able to access this medical revolution and spread the word.

This movie will also be submitted to national TVs around the world.



Every single contribution means a great deal to us.
We are asking for your support in helping raise <b>at least $125,000 to make this film a reality.
This will allow us to keep
our editorial line intact and to shield ourselves from various influences

dictated by an institutional hierarchy.

Your involvement is a critical success factor.

Reaching $250,000 will allow us to expand the film even further and also enhance the films quality, content and impact. It will allow us to spend more time in each country with the experts.

Reaching $350,000 will allow us to produce a longer movie and talk about more experiences. Moreover, we will be able to go to New Zealand and South America where other experiences can be gathered.

Over $350,000, all funds will be dedicated to clinical research.

Quality content is critical if we want to reach people, research, and authorities, and to change people's mind about these discoveries.

Every single dollar counts, and assists in making this film possible.

Other Ways You Can Help

SHARE, SHARE, SHARE : Join our Facebook page, or subscribe to our youtube channel and our newsletter : http://vitaminc-movie.org

We thank you from the bottom of our hearts

How will the money be spent ?


- Will the movie be available for free ?
Yes, we will release the movie on Youtube.

- Are you going to release a DVD ?
No, but you can get a digital download with the perks.

- Will it be broadcasted on TV ?
It will be submitted to national TVs around the world to get maximum exposure.
THE FILM CREW

Dr. Ilyes Baghli will be the main consultant.

Monaam Kraïem, the author, and Denis Ramos, Award winning Director, will be assisted by Sandro Lucerna, sound engineer, Sophie Loridon, editor, and Thomas Groc, producer.

column1: Ce film propose un état des lieux à travers le monde et constitue une occasion unique de traiter du sujet de la vitamine C
de manière approfondie et de fournir une référence audiovisuelle au

public le plus large possible.

AVERTISSEMENT

Le film ne remplacera en aucune façon une
consultation médicale ou les conseils de tout autre professionnel de
santé. Seul votre médecin généraliste ou spécialiste est habilité à
l’établissement d’un diagnostic médical et à l’établissement du

traitement adapté qui en découle.

Nous
rappelons que ce film n’a pas pour vocation de créer une polémique
autour de la médecine conventionnelle. Au contraire, ce film exposera
des faits tangibles, des expériences et des découvertes avérées.
column2:
/>


A ce jour, aucun documentaire satisfaisant n'offre une vue claire et précise de la situation pour le public.

C'est l'opportunité de bénéficier d'un film de qualité accessible à tout le monde, le film sera diffusé gratuitement sur youtube.

column1: La BBC publie le 9
février 2014 un article sur une équipe de chercheurs américains ayant obtenus
des résultats surprenants sur des cas de cancer en administrant des doses
massives de vitamine C par voie intraveineuse.
Au Japon, après
la catastrophe de Fukushima le professeur Atsuo Yanagisawa soigne avec succès des

soldats japonais irradiés selon la même méthode.

Pourquoi alors ne pas pousser les recherches et rendre

publiques les résultats obtenus autour de la vitamine C?

Regardez cette vidéo...

La médecine orthomoléculaire puise ses origines dans une découverte révolutionnaire réalisée dans les années 30 par le biochimiste et ingénieur chimiste américain Irwin Stone.

Cette découverte bouleverse la compréhension de la santé humaine : l’acide ascorbique, plus connu sous le nom de vitamine C, serait au cœur des processus biochimiques qui conditionnent la vie. A haute dose, elle est plus puissante que les antibiotiques et tue la plupart des virus.

Le double prix Nobel Linus Pauling consacre 40 années d’études et de travaux sur la vitamine C. Il donnera naissance à la « médecine orthomoléculaire », un nom inventé par lui en 1968 pour désigner une médecine capable de soigner l’individu par un apport de molécules naturelles et connues de l’organisme.

Les travaux de LINUS PAULING sont repris par d’éminents médecins et scientifiques du monde entier. Pour eux, cela ne fait aucun doute : la Vitamine C devrait être au cœur des dispositifs de santé publique. Malheureusement, les organismes de santé semblent peu intéressés par le potentiel préventif et curatif de la vitamine C. Une grande partie du corps médical a toujours tendance à réfuter ces études, la plupart du temps par méconnaissance des propriétés réelles de cette molécule. Il est vrai que les facultés de médecine et de pharmacie ne délivrent aucun enseignement spécifique à ce sujet.

Pourtant des Prix Nobel, des professeurs, des scientifiques, des médecins du monde entier ont produits depuis longtemps des études qui démontrent l’efficacité de la molécule.

Que penser alors du silence fait autour de certains résultats spectaculaires ?




Le film sera tourné au Japon, aux Etats-Unis, en Argentine, en France, en Espagne, en Autriche, en Algérie, en Belgique, en Tunisie, au Maroc, en Allemagne et au Canada...

column2:
/>


Plusieurs spécialistes internationaux de la médecine ortho moléculaire interviennent respectivement sur leurs lieux d’exercices. Les discours se croisent pour nous dresser un tableau de la situation globale. Ils complètent les propos de l’entourage de l'auteur et élargissent le champ des possibilités d’application de cette molécule dans notre quotidien.

Ils nous révèlent des cas d’expériences concluantes mais aussi des guérisons reconnues et nous explique les raisons du silence qui entoure leurs recherches.

Il sera question ente autre de : poliomyélite &
column7: tuberculoses primo-infection, multi et ultra résistante
column9:
…



- Dr Ilyes BAGHLI, ALGERIA : Président de la Société Algérienne de Nutrition et Médecine Orthomoléculaire.
- Pr. Thomas Edward LEVY, USA :

column1:
Médecin américain spécialisé en cardiologie (1981) et docteur en droit et avocat (1998).
- Pr. William JACOBS, USA :

Professeur d’immunologie, de biologie, et de génétique de l’Albert Einstein College of Medicine de l’Université Yeshiva (New York – USA).
- Pr. Atsuo YANAGISAWA, JAPON : Professeur et médecin japonais. Il exerce à Tokyo. Président de la Société Internationale de Médecine Ortho moléculaire (ISOM).
- Dr Monique BEJAT, FRANCE : Thérapeute en Nutrition et Micronutrition. Présidente de l’association Kousmine France
- Dr Julien DROUIN, FRANCE :

Vice-président de l’Alliance Globale pour l’Amélioration de la Santé (APAGS).
- Michel DUMESTRE, FRANCE : Nutrioniste et naturopathe

D'autres spécialistes seront interviewés à travers le monde en fonction du budget atteint.
Monaam Kraïem, un jeune réalisateur français, est l'auteur de ce film.
<b>Il n’aurait jamais connu la tuberculose ni le protocole d'injection
de vitamine C par intraveineuse si Sourour, sa fiancée n’avait pas

failli en mourir. 

Sur la base de son expérience, il décide de partager les fruits de son enquête dans ce film documentaire.

Découvrez son histoire :
column6:
schema=youtube"" width=""580"">

Ce film est une initiative personnelle soutenue

column1: par une que équipe de professionnels de l'audiovisuel ainsi que par

l'ISOM, la Société Internationale de médecine Orthomoléculaire.

Diffusé
gratuitement une fois réalisé, c'est la preuve de son intégrité : il ne

s'agit pas d'un film produit par la télé pour la télé.

L'intention
est citoyenne, basée sur une une histoire vécue personnellement avec le
désir de présenter les faits de manière sincère. Il ne s'agit pas d'un

film de controverse, mais plutôt un film qui vise l'objectivité.



Ce film sera tourné de septembre 2015 à avril 2016, dans de nombreux pays en fonction du budget atteint.

Nous découvrirons des expériences menées aux quatre coins du monde qui permettront de mieux comprendre et partager les propriétés méconnues de la vitamine C.

Ce film sera distribué gratuitement sur youtube à la fin de 2016 afin que chacun puisse accéder à ces découvertes.


Chaque donation et contribution est importante pour nous. Nous vous demandons votre soutien pour atteindre au moins 125 000 € pour réaliser ce film.

Cela nous permettra de préserver notre indépendance et de nous protéger des influences qui pourraient exister au sein des télévisions.

Votre soutien est crucial.

Si nous atteignons 250 000 €, cela nous permettra d'améliorer la qualité et le contenu du film, ainsi que son impact, et nous permettra de passer davantage de temps dans chaque pays avec les experts.

Si nous atteignons 350 000 €, nous pourrons réaliser un film plus long et de parler de davantage d'expériences. De plus, nous pourrons aller dans d'autres pays où d'autres expériences sont en cours.

Au-dessus de 350 000 €, tous les fonds seront dédiés à la recherche médicale.

Un contenu de qualité est requis si nous souhaitons atteindre nos objectifs et convaincre le plus grand nombre.

C'est pour cela que chaque participation compte.

D'autres moyens d'aider

PARTAGEZ, PARTAGEZ, PARTAGEZ : Rejoignez notre page Facebook, ou abonnez-vous à notre chaîne Youtube.

MERCI !

Comment sera alloué le budget ?



- Le film sera-t-il disponible gratuitement ?
Oui, le film sera disponible sur youtube, en Français et en Anglais.

- Allez-vous éditer un DVD ?
Non, mais vous pouvez obtenir une version à télécharger dans les contreparties.

- Sera-t-il diffusé à la télévision ?
Il sera proposé aux télévisions nationales à travers le monde pour un maximum d'exposition.
L'EQUIPE DU FILM

Le Dr. Ilyes Baghli sera le consultant principal.

Monaam Kraïem, l'auteur, et Denis Ramos, réalisateur, seront  assistés par Sandro Lucerna, ingénieur du son, Sophie Loridon, monteuse, et Thomas Groc, producteur.

A PROPOS DE CINEDIA

CINEDIA imagine, écrit, produit et réalise des films documentaires
“utiles”. Naviguant entre la culture, le social, l’environnement, la
santé et l’économie, nous plaçons nos caméras aux marges de la norme

pour témoigner des transitions sociétales.

SHARE, SHARE, SHARE : Join our Facebook page, or subscribe to our youtube channel and our newsletter : http://vitaminc-movie.orgWe thank you from the bottom of our hearts

How will the money be spent ?- Will the movie be available for free ?Yes, we will release the movie on Youtube.- Are you going to release a DVD ?No, but you can get a digital download with the perks.- Will it be broadcasted on TV ?It will be submitted to national TVs around the world to get maximum exposure.
THE FILM CREW

Dr. Ilyes Baghli will be the main consultant.Monaam Kraïem, the author, and Denis Ramos, Award winning  Director, will be assisted by Sandro Lucerna, sound engineer, Sophie Loridon, editor, and Thomas Groc, producer.
//// VERSION FRANCAISE ///
Et si la Vitamine C était la molécule oubliée ?
Ce film documentaire est une enquête inédite qui sera menée dans les pays suivants :JAPON / USA / ARGENTINE / FRANCE / ESPAGNE AUTRICHE / ALGERIE / BELGIQUE / TUNISIE MAROC / ALLEMAGNE / CANADA...
Ce film propose un état des lieux à travers le monde et constitue une occasion unique de traiter du sujet de la vitamine C
de manière approfondie et de fournir une référence audiovisuelle au
public le plus large possible.AVERTISSEMENTLe film ne remplacera en aucune façon une
consultation médicale ou les conseils de tout autre professionnel de
santé. Seul votre médecin généraliste ou spécialiste est habilité à
l’établissement d’un diagnostic médical et à l’établissement du
traitement adapté qui en découle. Nous
rappelons que ce film n’a pas pour vocation de créer une polémique
autour de la médecine conventionnelle. Au contraire, ce film exposera

des faits tangibles, des expériences et des découvertes avérées.A ce jour, aucun documentaire satisfaisant n'offre une vue claire et précise de la situation pour le public.C'est l'opportunité de bénéficier d'un film de qualité accessible à tout le monde, le film sera diffusé gratuitement sur youtube.
La BBC publie le 9
février 2014 un article sur une équipe de chercheurs américains ayant obtenus
des résultats surprenants sur des cas de cancer en administrant des doses
massives de vitamine C par voie intraveineuse.
Au Japon, après
la catastrophe de Fukushima le professeur Atsuo Yanagisawa soigne avec succès des
soldats japonais irradiés selon la même méthode.Pourquoi alors ne pas pousser les recherches et rendre
publiques les résultats obtenus autour de la vitamine C? Regardez cette vidéo...

La médecine orthomoléculaire puise ses origines dans une découverte révolutionnaire réalisée dans les années 30 par le biochimiste et ingénieur chimiste américain Irwin Stone. Cette découverte bouleverse la compréhension de la santé humaine : l’acide ascorbique, plus connu sous le nom de vitamine C, serait au cœur des processus biochimiques qui conditionnent la vie. A haute dose, elle est plus puissante que les antibiotiques et tue la plupart des virus.Le double prix Nobel Linus Pauling consacre 40 années d’études et de travaux sur la vitamine C. Il donnera naissance à la « médecine orthomoléculaire », un nom inventé par lui en 1968 pour désigner une médecine capable de soigner l’individu par un apport de molécules naturelles et connues de l’organisme.Les travaux de LINUS PAULING sont repris par d’éminents médecins et scientifiques du monde entier. Pour eux, cela ne fait aucun doute : la Vitamine C devrait être au cœur des dispositifs de santé publique. Malheureusement, les organismes de santé semblent peu intéressés par le potentiel préventif et curatif de la vitamine C. Une grande partie du corps médical a toujours tendance à réfuter ces études, la plupart du temps par méconnaissance des propriétés réelles de cette molécule. Il est vrai que les facultés de médecine et de pharmacie ne délivrent aucun enseignement spécifique à ce sujet. Pourtant des Prix Nobel, des professeurs, des scientifiques, des médecins du monde entier ont produits depuis longtemps des études qui démontrent l’efficacité de la molécule.Que penser alors du silence fait autour de certains résultats spectaculaires ? Le film sera tourné au Japon, aux Etats-Unis, en Argentine, en France, en Espagne, en Autriche, en Algérie, en Belgique, en Tunisie, au Maroc, en Allemagne et au Canada...

Plusieurs spécialistes internationaux de la médecine ortho moléculaire interviennent respectivement sur leurs lieux d’exercices. Les discours se croisent pour nous dresser un tableau de la situation globale. Ils complètent les propos de l’entourage de l'auteur et élargissent le champ des possibilités d’application de cette molécule dans notre quotidien. Ils nous révèlent des cas d’expériences concluantes mais aussi des guérisons reconnues et nous explique les raisons du silence qui entoure leurs recherches.Il sera question ente autre de : poliomyélite & pneumonie
column5: tuberculoses primo-infection, multi et ultra résistante
column7: … - Dr Ilyes BAGHLI, ALGERIA : Président de la Société Algérienne de Nutrition et Médecine Orthomoléculaire. - Pr. Thomas Edward LEVY, USA :

column1: Médecin américain spécialisé en cardiologie (1981) et docteur en droit et avocat (1998). - Pr. William JACOBS, USA :

Professeur d’immunologie, de biologie, et de génétique de l’Albert Einstein College of Medicine de l’Université Yeshiva (New York – USA).- Pr. Atsuo YANAGISAWA, JAPON : Professeur et médecin japonais. Il exerce à Tokyo. Président de la Société Internationale de Médecine Ortho moléculaire (ISOM).- Dr Monique BEJAT, FRANCE : Thérapeute en Nutrition et Micronutrition. Présidente de l’association Kousmine France-  Dr Julien DROUIN, FRANCE :

Vice-président de l’Alliance Globale pour l’Amélioration de la Santé (APAGS).- Michel DUMESTRE, FRANCE : Nutrioniste et naturopatheD'autres spécialistes seront interviewés à travers le monde en fonction du budget atteint.
Monaam Kraïem, un jeune réalisateur français, est l'auteur de ce film.
Il n’aurait jamais connu la tuberculose ni le protocole d'injection
de vitamine C par intraveineuse si Sourour, sa fiancée n’avait pas
failli en mourir. Sur la base de son expérience, il décide de partager les fruits de son enquête dans ce film documentaire.Découvrez son histoire :Ce film est une initiative personnelle soutenue
par une que équipe de professionnels de l'audiovisuel ainsi que par
l'ISOM, la Société Internationale de médecine Orthomoléculaire.Diffusé
gratuitement une fois réalisé, c'est la preuve de son intégrité : il ne
s'agit pas d'un film produit par la télé pour la télé.L'intention
est citoyenne, basée sur une une histoire vécue personnellement avec le
désir de présenter les faits de manière sincère. Il ne s'agit pas d'un

film de controverse, mais plutôt un film qui vise l'objectivité.Ce film sera tourné de septembre 2015 à avril 2016, dans de nombreux pays en fonction du budget atteint.Nous découvrirons des expériences menées aux quatre coins du monde qui permettront de mieux comprendre et partager les propriétés méconnues de la vitamine C.Ce film sera distribué gratuitement sur youtube à la fin de 2016 afin que chacun puisse accéder à ces découvertes.Chaque donation et contribution est importante pour nous. Nous vous demandons votre soutien pour atteindre au moins 125 000 € pour réaliser ce film.Cela nous permettra de préserver notre indépendance et de nous protéger des influences qui pourraient exister au sein des télévisions.Votre soutien est crucial.Si nous atteignons 250 000 €, cela nous permettra d'améliorer la qualité et le contenu du film, ainsi que son impact, et nous permettra de passer davantage de temps dans chaque pays avec les experts.Si nous atteignons 350 000 €, nous pourrons réaliser un film plus long et de parler de davantage d'expériences. De plus, nous pourrons aller dans d'autres pays où d'autres expériences sont en cours.Au-dessus de 350 000 €, tous les fonds seront dédiés à la recherche médicale.Un contenu de qualité est requis si nous souhaitons atteindre nos objectifs et convaincre le plus grand nombre. C'est pour cela que chaque participation compte.D'autres moyens d'aider
PARTAGEZ, PARTAGEZ, PARTAGEZ : Rejoignez notre page Facebook, ou abonnez-vous à notre chaîne Youtube.MERCI !

Comment sera alloué le budget ?- Le film sera-t-il disponible gratuitement ?Oui, le film sera disponible sur youtube, en Français et en Anglais.- Allez-vous éditer un DVD ?Non, mais vous pouvez obtenir une version à télécharger dans les contreparties.- Sera-t-il diffusé à la télévision ?Il sera proposé aux télévisions nationales à travers le monde pour un maximum d'exposition.
L'EQUIPE DU FILM

Le Dr. Ilyes Baghli sera le consultant principal.Monaam Kraïem, l'auteur, et Denis Ramos, réalisateur, seront  assistés par Sandro Lucerna, ingénieur du son, Sophie Loridon, monteuse, et Thomas Groc, producteur.A PROPOS DE CINEDIACINEDIA imagine, écrit, produit et réalise des films documentaires
“utiles”. Naviguant entre la culture, le social, l’environnement, la
santé et l’économie, nous plaçons nos caméras aux marges de la norme
pour témoigner des transitions sociétales.",34.0,6,"1 Campaign

Short Summary
Changing the Pecking Order is the first
installment in the Victims of Misfortune feature-length documentary series.  Changing the Pecking Order will boldly
confront the problems of America’s criminal justice system and the devastating
impact it has left on poor communities, mostly people of African and Latino descent. We
went around the country interviewing leading scholars, activists,
reentry/criminal justice policy reform experts and historians discussing topics
such as:
• Racism in the Criminal Justice System
• Police Brutality
• Indentured Servitude and Chattel Slavery
• Unfair Public Policies/Legal Discrimination
• School to Prison Pipeline
• Incarceration as a Business/Prison Profiteers
• Solutions for people post conviction
And so much more.
What We Need &
We passionately
want to make this unfiltered, social documentary with the criminal justice
system as a backdrop.  This is where we need your help!  Our
overall goal is to raise $20,000.00 to complete the project (Post
Production).
So far we’ve invested a lot of money,
countless hours researching, investigating, planning and filming.  Now we
need your help to finish the post- production phase.  The challenge with this project
or with any project that involves history is archival materials are needed.
Most of these materials are very pricey ($100.00 per photo and up with some video
clips being even more expensive). This is why our campaign must be a success in order
to get usage of these materials.
Pledge any amount from $10 to $1,000
and receive rewards for your support.
The money raised through indiegogo will be used for:
• Licensing archival video/photo/audio content
<ul><li>Creating animated special effects &amp
<ul><li>Combining all of these elements: rendering,
compositing, sound design and editing.
<ul><li>Editing hardware and software to create
everything at high resolution to screen theatrically.
<ul><li>
Media promotions for the release of the
film. (In Select Theaters)
• Film Rewards
<ul><li>Professional Mixing/Mastering of
Audio
• Replication of Final Product
• Marketing Materials
<ul><li>Creation of the Victims of
Misfortune Official Movie Trailer
So let us make history together! Don't forget to help spread the word and share
this project on social media (Facebook, Twitter etc) with all your friends.
REWARDS:
By supporting this film you’re helping restore hope in others, you’re taking
a stand against the school to prison pipeline, police brutality, discrimination and most importantly you’re restoring people’s belief in
humanity.  We hope you join in support of our filmmaking team and we have some
great rewards to encourage you, including:
• Shout-out on our Facebook page and Twitter
page
• Victims of Misfortune Solidarity Tags
• Digital Download
• Be the FIRST to receive a DVD of the finished film!
• Posters and Art Prints
• Victims of Misfortune T-Shirt
• A Special Thank you in the film credits
• Associate Producer Credit on the film
Our Cast
Manhattan, New York City – Glenn E. Martin is the
former Vice President of Public Affairs and Director of the David Rothenberg
Center for Public Policy at The Fortune Society. Mr. Martin is the founder of
JustLeadershipUSA, and co-founder of the Education Inside Out Coalition (EIO
Coalition).  Mr. Martin has often served as a reentry/criminal justice
policy reform expert on MSNBC, Fox News, CNN and a number of local media
outlets.
Rock Hill, South Carolina - Dr. Adolphus Belk, Jr. is a political analyst
and professor of political science and African American studies. He currently
teaches at Winthrop University with a focus on issues of race and politics. He
also specializes in the prison-industrial complex.
Philadelphia, PA – Dr. Umar Abdullah-Johnson is a
Certified School Psychologist who practices privately in Pennsylvania and
lectures throughout the country. He is also the author of the book entitled:
“Psycho – Academic Holocaust: The Special Education and ADHD Wars Against Black
Boys”.
Dr. Umar Johnson is also a blood relative of Frederick Douglas the great Black
abolitionist and orator.
Brooklyn, New York – Dr. Divine Pryor is the executive director of
the Center for NuLeadership on Urban Solutions, an independent, activist, human
justice think tank and training center.  Dr. Pryor is a social scientist
with extensive knowledge and expertise in the criminal justice, health and
social service fields, having spent over half his career administering
HIV/AIDS, domestic violence, substance abuse and other social service
non-profits.
Memphis, Tennessee - Lorenzo Kom’boa Ervin, a former political prisoner and
political refugee, is the founding member and community organizer at the Black
Autonomy Federation located in Memphis, Tn.
He is the author of the underground classic, ""Anarchism and the Black
Revolution"" as well as many other essays and articles about fighting capitalism
and white supremacy.
<h3>Risks &amp
After this crowd funding campaign has
been completed, please be sure to give all of your correct information so that
we can quickly send your rewards to you in a timely manner.
Levon Hinton
Director of Victims of Misfortune
Help Us Spread the Word
If you are unable to support financially, you still can play a key role by
sharing this page on your social media networks, and blogs. We also
have “Support Victims of Misfortune” badges(under the Gallery Tab) that you can download and upload to
social media (Twitter, Instagram, Facebook etc).  With all of us working together, we can make
this campaign successful.
We trust you will join us.
OUR
TEAM:
Levon Hinton: Executive
Producer, Director, Writer, Producer
Levon Hinton is a filmmaker that has
written, produced, directed and contributed content to several short films,
original web series, television shows, music videos and documentaries.
Mr. Hinton co-produced his first
film project in 2008. That project sold thousands of units nationally in DTLR
retail stores. (Buffie Carruth’s “Still Larger Than Life” Documentary)
In 2011 Mr. Hinton contributed
content to the documentary “Koch Brothers Exposed” (2012), directed by Robert
Greenwald.
He has also produced and directed
several television commercials that aired on Fox50 television networks in 2012.
Mr. Hinton also created the online media outlet. (Carolina Exposed DVD/TV)
In his spare time he volunteers as a
Head Football Coach.<span>  He mentor boys ages
5-7 years old through the sport of football.
Ablaze Jackson: Music
Supervisor, Producer
Ablaze Jackson is a music producer and
writer located in Greenville, South Carolina.<span>
He has been producing music 10+ years and has worked on several
successful projects.
He produced music for VH1’s TV Show
Chrissy &amp
'Get That Cake' featuring T.W.O.) He also produced a track for a commercial for
Pepsi Max.
Along with producing for various artists such
as K. Mitchell, Jim Jones, Mullage, Hell Rell, and Do Or Die, just to
name a few. His music even made it to Broadway with the Les Twins.
Act Web Solutions: Website
Developer, Web Tech Support
ACT Web Solutions is a web design company based in Atlanta, GA.  ACT Web Solutions exists to creatively
develop simple but effective websites for small and medium sized companies as
well as for individuals who realize the necessity of web presentation. This
company has been in business nearly 10 years providing services in web design
and internet marketing.  For more info,
check out: http://actwebs.net/
Vandem Productions Films: VideoProduction Company
Vandem Productions Films is a video
production company based in Raleigh, North Carolina. This company has been in
business for over 7 years providing high definition, digital media
production, for their clients.
VP Films take pride in their videos, and they stand behind each production
by hiring only well experienced cameramen, editors, writers, and crew to
maintain professional production quality.
For more info, check out: http://vandemproductionsfilms.com

A Thousand Reasons is a
modern, faith-based romantic comedy. It's unlike anything that has ever been

written, let alone turned into a movie. It's what happens when you take a film like American Pie, The Hangover or Old School and toss a little faith into it! It's an interesting mix, but it's highly entertaining and has a great message, for believers and non-believers.
It's the story of four best friends and their journey that's full love, loss, faith and what happens when those three
aspects come together and where life takes you. Sometimes life takes us down a
road we didn't expect to travel. But everything has a purpose. Everything
happens for a reason. Or so that is what we would like to think.
Making a ""Faith-Based Feature
Film for those who do not believe.
Here's
the big difference between the feature film I am trying to create and the
countless Christian or faith-based films already on the market. I am attempting
to make a film that can be enjoyed by both audiences, the audience that
believes and the audience that does not.
The main character of the story, Lucas, believes in God. His faith is tested,
and its a difficult road for him to travel. But his former best friend, Mason,
who Lucas has not seen since their college years, is determined to not let him
travel that road alone. His best friend does not believe in God, however. So
how can someone who does not believe help someone who does not lose their
faith? It's an interesting dilemma, that's for sure.
Unlike other ""faith-based"" films, I do not see the non-believer as
the bad guy of the movie. Contrary to that belief, he is actually one of the
most crucial parts of Lucas' story. But he does not and will not change his
viewpoint on God. Is it possible for two people, who have two completely
difference stances on God, to travel down the  road of faith together? And
if so, what does that road look like?
Why Crowdfunding? That's a good
question!
How we create this movie is as important as what we are creating. Crowdfunding
offers an opportunity to consciously create the world around us - to support
projects that matter to us. If you feel that it's important for
faith-based"" films like this one to be made, and you want to help me get
the message delivered in this film, then I invite you to co-create this project
with me! Share this with your friends, your networks and communities - and if
you feel compelled to jump in as one of the financial co-creators, please check
out all the amazing rewards offered on the sidebar, and find the level that
feels right for you.
The more support we receive from you, the more effectively we can co-create
this movie in a way that holds true to it's values and core messages.  Our
goal is to raise $40,000. If we can surpass this goal, we can increase
production value and attention to detail. In other words it will look better,
sound better, and most importantly, the message and the film will reach more
people and screens.
With your help, my team and I are going to make the best
faith-based"" feature film ever produced. That's a bold statement for
me to make, I know. But it is a bold statement that I definitely plan to back
up.
You have A THOUSAND REASONS to not donate to this feature film. But I am hoping
you will look inside your heart and find the one reason you should. Whatever
that reason may be, I'm sure it is different for everyone. But if you feel like
this is something you would like to support, we would love it if you would join
us in supporting us bring this unique feature film and it's message to the film
industry and audiences world wide!
Thank you.
The Cast Of A Thousand Reasons
