It's the story of four best friends and their journey that's full love, loss, faith and what happens when those three
aspects come together and where life takes you. Sometimes life takes us down a
road we didn't expect to travel. But everything has a purpose. Everything
happens for a reason. Or so that is what we would like to think.
Making a ""Faith-Based Feature
Film for those who do not believe.
Here's
the big difference between the feature film I am trying to create and the
countless Christian or faith-based films already on the market. I am attempting
to make a film that can be enjoyed by both audiences, the audience that
believes and the audience that does not.
The main character of the story, Lucas, believes in God. His faith is tested,
and its a difficult road for him to travel. But his former best friend, Mason,
who Lucas has not seen since their college years, is determined to not let him
travel that road alone. His best friend does not believe in God, however. So
how can someone who does not believe help someone who does not lose their
faith? It's an interesting dilemma, that's for sure.
Unlike other ""faith-based"" films, I do not see the non-believer as
the bad guy of the movie. Contrary to that belief, he is actually one of the
most crucial parts of Lucas' story. But he does not and will not change his
viewpoint on God. Is it possible for two people, who have two completely
difference stances on God, to travel down the  road of faith together? And
if so, what does that road look like?
Why Crowdfunding? That's a good
question!
How we create this movie is as important as what we are creating. Crowdfunding
offers an opportunity to consciously create the world around us - to support
projects that matter to us. If you feel that it's important for
faith-based"" films like this one to be made, and you want to help me get
the message delivered in this film, then I invite you to co-create this project
with me! Share this with your friends, your networks and communities - and if
you feel compelled to jump in as one of the financial co-creators, please check
out all the amazing rewards offered on the sidebar, and find the level that
feels right for you.
The more support we receive from you, the more effectively we can co-create
this movie in a way that holds true to it's values and core messages.  Our
goal is to raise $40,000. If we can surpass this goal, we can increase
production value and attention to detail. In other words it will look better,
sound better, and most importantly, the message and the film will reach more
people and screens.
With your help, my team and I are going to make the best
faith-based"" feature film ever produced. That's a bold statement for
me to make, I know. But it is a bold statement that I definitely plan to back
up.
You have A THOUSAND REASONS to not donate to this feature film. But I am hoping
you will look inside your heart and find the one reason you should. Whatever
that reason may be, I'm sure it is different for everyone. But if you feel like
this is something you would like to support, we would love it if you would join
us in supporting us bring this unique feature film and it's message to the film
industry and audiences world wide!
Thank you.
The Cast Of A Thousand Reasons

El pasado 8 de febrero el escritor venezolano Leonardo Padrón publicó en el diario El Nacional la crónica “Cinco sótanos contra el sol”, donde narraba los pormenores de la tortura blanca a la que eran sometidos tres jóvenes venezolanos apresados en una cárcel llamada “La Tumba”, en Caracas. Leer esta crónica me conmovió tanto que  de inmediato me senté a escribir el guión de Sótano 5
column2: un cortometraje de ficción  que detalla el profundo daño físico y psicológico al que son sometidos algunos jóvenes apresados tras las manifestaciones estudiantiles de 2014 en Venezuela.
column6:
>

Como estaba inspirado en una crónica de Padrón, le envié el

column1: guión del corto y de inmediato se involucró con la causa prestando su imagen y
asesoría para el proyecto.
Es necesario que el mundo vea que hay tortura en Venezuela.
y Luis ya tienen muchos meses en  “La Tumba”, una prisión que está cinco
pisos <span>bajo tierra, donde son víctimas de
tortura blanca. Su rutina cambia cuando ingresan a otro chico en esas celdas de
2x3. Le explican al “nuevo” que aquí nunca ven la luz del sol,  la única forma de saber la
hora es cuando el Metro de Caracas deja de pasar sobre ellos después de las 11 de la
noche. Que debe tener cuidado con lo que dice porque todo lo escuchan. Los días
pasan con la temperatura a 15 grados centígrados y la única forma de comunicarse es gritando
de celda a celda, porque no se pueden ver.
La tortura se
hace cada vez más insoportable, la única forma de salir es confesando <span>crímenes no cometidos o inculpando a alguien más.
Pero una canción común, cantada de celda a celda, les recuerda que están presos por una
causa más grande que ellos y que tal vez algún día se hará justicia.
La filmación
de Sótano 5 se realizará en dos días de rodaje con un grupo de actores y <span>técnicos del mundo del cine y la publicidad
venezolanos que se encuentran a lo largo  de latinoamérica.  Con equipos
fílmicos profesionales.
El
cortometraje tendrá 3 locaciones: la celda, el baño, y un pequeño patio.
Para ello se
construirá en un estudio de grabación una réplica de “La Tumba” a partir de los <span>testimonios de los familiares y abogados de las
víctimas.  Sería la primera vez que se vean imágenes (al menos
similares) de este reclusorio.

La Historia detrás de la Historia
column6:
>

Mi nombre es Maru Morón, soy licenciada en Comunicación Social de la UCV. Magister en Dirección de Cine y Televisión de la Universitat Ramón Llull de Barcelona, España. 

Desde el 2011 he dedicado gran parte de mi trabajo a la política. Muchos de esos videos que el gobierno afirma son “financiados por Dios sabe quién"", fueron hechos por mí, sin más nada que mis ideas, mi computadora y mi cámara.

column1: <figure style=""margin: 0px
column2:
>


Video de Operación Soberania, movimiento que pedía elecciones justas en la contienda presidencial del 2013. El Gato (en la imagen) fue sentenciado recientemente a 8 años de cárcel. También hablando con ellos, escribí el guión y realicé el video.

Desde el año pasado me encuentro fuera del país preguntándome cómo hago para aportar algo estando tan lejos. Creo que es un sentimiento en común que compartimos los que hemos tenido que partir. 

No todos podemos ejercer la política, pero cada quien desde su trinchera puede aportar algo.  

Por eso decidí escribir, producir y dirigir este cortometraje. 

Presupuesto y difusión

El dinero recaudado se utilizará estrictamente para los costos de producción. Este cortometraje no tiene fines de lucro.

Todo lo recaudado por encima de nuestra meta será donado a ONG´s que luchen por los derechos de los presos en Venezuela y a algunos familiares de estos jóvenes.

Sótano 5 será difundido el mes de septiembre por internet para que llegue a la mayor cantidad de personas posibles en el mundo. Además será proyectado de manera gratuita en toda Venezuela en calles, plazas y otros lugares públicos.  

Puedes donar desde 1$ y hacerlo desde cualquier parte del mundo

Si te preguntas cómo puedes hacer algo por Venezuela, esta es una buena oportunidad. Por poco que puedas donar va a significar de gran ayuda para el proyecto. Y si no puedes donar por favor ayúdanos a difundirlo por tus redes sociales y amigos.

Creo que la suma de muchas voluntades puede generar un cambio importante. Cada uno de nosotros importa.

English version

On Febraury 8th, the Venezuelan writer Leonardo Padrón published an article called “Five basements against the sun” in the newspaper “El Nacional”. Where he described in detail the story of three young Venezuelan prisoners who underwent “white torture"" inside “La Tumba” prison, located in Caracas. The very first time I read the article I was so moved by it, I shortly sat down to write the script “Sótano 5”
column3:
a short film which describes the physical and psychological damage induced to some of the students arrested after the Venezuelan protests of 2014.

We’ve seen the footage. We've seen all the extraordinary difficulties those protesters faced, the repression, the kids getting arrested
column4:
but we’ve never seen what happens to them behind bars. The world must see that torture exists in Venezuela nowadays. 

Since my short film was inspired by Padrón’s article, I sent him the script and he immediately got involved with the project as a consultant and spokesman. For me, It is mandatory to humanize torture in Venezuela. It should not be considered a distant and abstract concept. 

The Short film

Ricardo and Luis have been imprisoned for several months now inside “La Tumba”, 5
column8: >floors of underground jail, where they receive “white torture”. When a new kid arrives to
column12: >the 2x3meters cells their daily routine changes. They explain to “the new guy” that he will
column16: >not see the sunlight for days, that the only way of knowing the exact time is when the
column20: >subway, running just above them, stops at 11pm. He must be careful of every word he says,
column24: >because everything is heard. The days go by inside these freezing cold cells and the only
column28: >way of communicating with each other is to shout out from cell to cell, because they are
column32:
>isolated from one another.

The torture becomes unbearable. The only way of getting out is to confess to crimes they
column36: >did not commit or to incriminate someone else. The only thing holding them together is a
column40: >song by a Venezuelan band, that they sing along from cell to cell. This song is a constant
column44: >reminder that the reason they’re in jail is bigger than themselves and that maybe one day
column48:

“Sótano 5” will be shot in two days with a group of venezuelan actors and technicians
column52: >that work as professionals in the film and advertising world. We will use professional
column56:
>equipment to shot it.

The short film will take place in 3 locations: a cell, a restroom, and a small yard.

column64: >families and lawyers of the victims. It will be the first time that we ever see images
column68:
>(recreated as similar as possible to the real ones) of this prison.

 The story behind the story 

My name is Maru Morón, I have a Bachelor’s Degree in Social Communications from “Universidad Central de Venezuela”, a Master’s Degree in Film and Television Direction from “Universitat Ramón Llull de Barcelona”, Spain. 

I have dedicated my work to the political cause in Venezuela. Most of the videos condemn by the Venezuelan government were made by me, with my ideas, my camera and my computer. 

I moved out of my country last year, wondering what I could do for Venezuela, living so far from it. I believe this is a common feeling amongst everyone who had to move to a better place. 

Not everyone can be a politician, but we can all try to do something from our areas of expertise. 

This is why I decided to write, produce and direct this short film. 

Budget and Broadcasting 

The funds raised are intended exclusively for production costs. This is a nonprofit short film. The surplus of the money will be donated to NGO’s that fight for prisoners’ rights and to the families of some of the prisoners. 

“Sótano 5” will be broadcasted on September, exclusively over the internet, in order to reach as many people as we can around the world. 

There will be free projections on streets, parks and other public places in Venezuela.

If you are wondering, what you can do to help Venezuela? This is your opportunity. A small contribution may mean everything to the project. 

Nonetheless if you cannot make a contribution, please spread the word with your friends and in your social networks. 

 I believe that together we can make an important change. Every single one of us matter.

Short Summary

In 2013 we succeeded in making a dream come true, unfortunately the main part of our dream became non existent and our side part became front and center due to unforeseen circumstances. We opened The Rabbit Hole Video Games &
column3: a video gaming store and lounge in Thomasville, NC. We found a building big enough to do what we wanted and immediately went to work building our dreams.

column1: Our Original Plan
<div>
<ul>
• Host video game events in a large area with many TVs, and great seating.
• Also host bands, and other live events and support our local community.
• Create a video game store that was family friendly, and an alternative to the normal stereotypes.
What Happened
<div><ul>
• We succeeded in our video game store dream fairly well.
• We put what little bit of left over funding we had towards building a stage, and renovating our store to accommodate the other aspects we wished to create

<li>Shortly after one of our first larger events that included a live band, after being informed of issues regarding intended use of our building by the Fire Marshal that led to an exhausting long battle with our local planning and zoning
column2: and concluded with us closing the back section and losing all that we did put into it.

column1: What We Need Now &
column2:
What You Get

After looking at all we will have to accomplish we have decided minimally we would need to clear $15,000 so that we can ensure code compliance, and make the building comfortable as well as purchase TVs, Tables, PCs, Game Consoles and other fixtures that will help us exceed even our original ideas. Although bands and live events are still in the back of our mind, we will mainly be focusing on the lounge aspect.

column1: Risks &
column2:
Challenges

Renovation wise, we will face having to build up an entire room, our building is old and as such we want to make sure that comfort levels are enjoyable, and the look and feel reflects that of other modern gaming lounges in larger cities such as New York.

column1: Code compliance will be easily taken care of with only a few minor adjustments, we have faith that after we are done with renovations that we will not have any issues with the Fire Dpt, or the City regarding any code violations.

column1:
Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you cannot contribute to this plan, get the word out. Thomasville is located in the middle of all the major cities (High Point, Greensboro, Lexington, and Winston-Salem) and as such makes a great location to bring together a large community.
<h3>Trust &amp

We are not a passer by in the night, we are not a flea market, games and geek culture is our life, this includes everything from Retro to Current gaming, PC Gaming, card games, and much much more. We are committed to making our dream come true, and can do it sooner rather than later with the community's help. We are already one of the most established game stores in the area.

Risks & Challenges Renovation wise, we will face having to build up an entire room, our building is old and as such we want to make sure that comfort levels are enjoyable, and the look and feel reflects that of other modern gaming lounges in larger cities such as New York.

Code compliance will be easily taken care of with only a few minor adjustments, we have faith that after we are done with renovations that we will not have any issues with the Fire Dpt, or the City regarding any code violations.
The following a comprehensive list set forth by the Building Inspector of what needs to be done.
Have an engineer check to approve and provide recommendations for framing to current roof, so that we can install insulation, and drop ceiling.
Install drywall with insulation throughout middle and rear section of building
Have an electrician look over existing electrical as well as recommend any changes or requirements
Install panic hardware on all doors.
Install lighting outside of all exits
Fill in holes present in floor
Attach 42” tall guardrail around pit, and pickets spaced less than 4” apart on pit and existing deck
Install central heating and air throughout building
Have licensed electrician finish up any needed electrical work (outlets, indoor lighting)

Doula (/ˈduːlə/)
ROAD MAP TO PERKS  (On the right side of this page ->
column2: )                                       Everyone that supports this project gets EARLY ACCESS to the

column1: BEHIND-THE-SCENES footage and INTERVIEWS with the CAST and CREW. Once this EXCLUSIVE material is available you will receive a notification by email and information on how to access it.

FEATURED PERK: ATTEND ONE OF THE TEST SCREENINGS $75
This is definitely our favorite perk. We would like to invite you to attend one of the hosted test screenings. You will get the chance to hangout with the director and selected cast and crew members. We will be serving drinks and snacks AND you get to watch the movie before it is released. Afterwards, we would like permission to pick your brain. These are the cities in where there will be hosted screenings in:
LOS ANGELES (US)  | KOLDING (DK)  | COPENHAGEN (DK)
Dates and details will be sent out by email at least 6 weeks before the screening (Early 2016). Make this a #NewYear thing.

DOULA  
'Doula' is the directorial debut of Danish writer/director, Kenneth L.
Truelsen. Previous work of the Director of Photography, Milan Chadima,
includes Eli Roth's 'Hostel' and 'Hostel: Part II'. The producing team
has been behind 'Thale', 'Experimenter' and 'Manson Family Vacation'. Help us release the midwife ghost!
Genre: Horror (Grindhouse/Supernatural) | Estimated runtime: 90 min | Language: English | Release year: 2016 | Starring: Genre known cast (to be announced)
Doula on

November 5, 2014, we received our first press mentioning when Fangoria wrote:  Festival Report: Helsinki's Night Visions 2014

Still images from the production of the teaser trailer, filmed in the small village of Dolni Berkovice (CZ) on May 9, 2015 , with the production support from producer Vojtech Fric, FRAME100R (CZ) and extremely talented and efficient crew. Thank you guys!

The very talented Carry Mason and Alexandra Kissova will be playing  two lead roles.

With your help we can make this film into a reality... Well a fictional reality!

Any help to fund this project and help me would be greatly appreciated and will not go unnoticed!

What We Need &
• All of our Crew have agreed to work for less than their usual rate in order to shoot this project but we still need to raise enough to cover equipment for a four day shoot plus post.
• The location we are using is going to cost us very little however we still need to transport all equipment to and from set.

• The Perks of donating are first and foremost being a part of seeing this fiml get made. In addition to that you can choose a perk that gets you a copy of the film and a special thanks in the credits.
• Even if we don't reach our target goal we will still use any donations we have towards the film  so no contribution will go unnoticed.

Please share this campaign with anyone you think might be interested!
","I have been developing the script the past five months ... with out giving away too much it is a dark comedy set in a hospital that follows two individuals with a less than noble cause.
I am hoping to raise some funds to assist in the costs of equipment and post production.
I have developed the script  with Eric Deacon who will be directing.

Eric is currently Head of Acting at the London Academy of Media Film and Television. Lecturer of Screenwriting at Queen Mary’s University. Visting Lecturer of Acting at Redroofs Drama School and Central St. Martins, London.
For the last 11 years has worked extensively for all the major UK broadcasters as a scriptwriter.
John Raggett as DOP with 15 years lighting and camera experience.

Chris Nellthorpe as sound and editing  filmmaker and composer. An Adobe Certified Expert, Chris specialises in editing, onlining, motion graphics and sound design. Chris also works as a producer, cameraman and sound recordist, and has directed two of his own short films.

column1: From May 7 to 17, in Como, will be held Luxforia, an opportunity to showcase the graduation projects made ​​during the last year of three-year course, the aim is to create an opportunity for discussion between young designers and public.

The exhibition projects of students of the Polytechnic of Milan that affect the relationship between the light and the interaction, through issues related to sustainability and innovation in design and technology.
The aim of the exhibition is to give rise to reflections and cultural debates on the current and future design.

For this project funds are used, useful to face communication costs for the event, set-up, catering and much more. We want this event to be memorable, a chance meeting, an experience that is engaging and that leaves a mark is in the city, which in our lives.

Also, those who have the opportunity to be particularly generous to our initiative, will be invited to dinner by the two organizers Sarah and Denise! What better opportunity then to know each other, talk each of their interests and to thank you personally for your valuable contribution!!

so you'll always be up to date on our movements , and you can follow step by step the birth of this event!
Come donare!
<div>
Per donare è semplice:
1) scegli la cifra da donare

2) verrai reindirizzato al sito PayPal, dal quale, anche senza avere un account, potrai donare tramite carta di credito o prepagata (postepay o simili). Comparirà una donazione a favore di Ferdinando Esposito, uno degli organizzatori di Luxforia.
3) inserisci i tuoi dati e quelli della tua carta, prosegui anche senza loggarti a PayPal, e termina il pagamento.
4) Comparirà un'immagine ""Thank you"", il gioco è fatto e noi ti ringraziamo!
How to donate?
To donate is simple :
1 ) choose the amount to donate

2 ) you will be redirected to the PayPal site, from which, even without an account, you can donate by credit card or debit card (or similar). You will see a donation to Ferdinando Esposito, one of the organizers of Luxforia.
3 ) enter your details and those of your card, go without account, or PayPal, and end the payment.
4 ) You will see an image "" Thank you"", that's it, and we thank you!
","Cos'è?

Dal 7 al 17 Maggio, a Como, si terrà Luxforia, un’occasione per mettere in mostra i progetti di laurea realizzati durante l’ultimo anno di corso triennale, lo scopo è quello di creare una occasione di confronto fra i giovani progettisti ed il pubblico.

La mostra espone progetti di studenti del Politecnico di Milano che toccano il rapporto tra la luce e l'interazione, passando per temi legati alla sostenibilità e l'innovazione nel campo del design e della tecnologia.
Lo scopo della mostra è quello di dare origine a riflessioni e dibattiti culturali sull'andamento attuale ed il futuro del design.

Per realizzare questo progetto servono fondi, utili ad affrontare spese di comunicazione per l’evento, allestimento, catering e molto altro. Vogliamo che questo evento sia memorabile, un’occasione d’incontro, un’esperienza che sia coinvolgente e che lasci il segno sia nella città, che nelle nostre vite.
What is it?

From May 7 to 17, in Como, will be held Luxforia, an opportunity to showcase the graduation projects made ​​during the last year of three-year course, the aim is to create an opportunity for discussion between young designers and public.

The exhibition projects of students of the Polytechnic of Milan that affect the relationship between the light and the interaction, through issues related to sustainability and innovation in design and technology.
The aim of the exhibition is to give rise to reflections and cultural debates on the current and future design.

For this project funds are used, useful to face communication costs for the event, set-up, catering and much more. We want this event to be memorable, a chance meeting, an experience that is engaging and that leaves a mark is in the city, which in our lives.
Perché aiutarci?

Se contribuirai a questo progetto, non solo ci farai felici, ma potrai avere accesso ad alcuni premi che abbiamo scelto per te: da un’IMMENSO senso di gratitudine per il tuo preziosissimo aiuto, a l’inserzione della tua foto in un cartellone che esporremo all’evento, dove comparirai come sponsor, benefattore , magnate e promotore ufficiale del design italiano!

Inoltre, coloro che avranno la possibilità di essere particolarmente generosi verso la nostra iniziativa, saranno invitati a cena dalle due organizzatrici Sarah e Denise! Quale miglior occasione quindi per conoscerci, parlare ognuno dei propri interessi e ringraziarti di persona del tuo prezioso contributo!!
Ti inviteremo in un posto stupendo che affaccia sul lago di Como :)  (e se lo desideri, potrai portare anche una persona con te.)
Questa è la prima mostra in Italia organizzata tramite CrowdFounding, non perdere l’occasione di far parte di questa esperienza! Potresti fare davvero la differenza.
Why help us?

If you contribute to this project, not only will you make us happy, but you'll have access to some perks that we have chosen for you: by an immense sense of gratitude for your invaluable support to the insertion of your photo into a billboard that will be expose event, where you will appear as a sponsor, benefactor, tycoon and official promoter of Italian design!

Also, those who have the opportunity to be particularly generous to our initiative, will be invited to dinner by the two organizers Sarah and Denise! What better opportunity then to know each other, talk each of their interests and to thank you personally for your valuable contribution!!
We'll invite you in a beautiful place that overlooks Lake Como :) (and if desired, you can also bring someone with you)
This is the first exhibition in Italy organized by CrowdFounding, do not miss your chance to be part of this experience! You could make a real difference.
Seguici!

Per aiutarci puoi fare molto di più! per noi è anche molto importante la diffusione di questa campagna, per cui condividila! Spargi la voce, dillo a chi ti pare! Tutti insieme possiamo rendere questo evento memorabile!
E ricordati! Vieni a vederci, non mancare a questo appuntamento, inviaci la tua email, e noi provvederemo a inviarti una comunicazione che ti ricordi di venire,
oppure, clicca “mi piace” sulla nostra pagina Facebook
https://www.facebook.com/luxforiacomo
così sarai sempre aggiornato sui i nostri movimenti, e potrai seguire passo per passo la nascita di questo evento!
Follow us!
But you can do so much more to help! for us it is also very important to the spread of this campaign, so share! Spread the word, tell whoever you want! Together we can make this event memorable!
And remember! Come and see us, do not miss this event, please send us your email address, and we'll send you a notice that you remember to come, or, click ""Like"" on our Facebook page
https://www.facebook.com/luxforiacomo
so you'll always be up to date on our movements , and you can follow step by step the birth of this event!
Come donare!
Per donare è semplice:
1) scegli la cifra da donare

2) verrai reindirizzato al sito PayPal, dal quale, anche senza avere un account, potrai donare tramite carta di credito o prepagata (postepay o simili). Comparirà una donazione a favore di Ferdinando Esposito, uno degli organizzatori di Luxforia.
3) inserisci i tuoi dati e quelli della tua carta, prosegui anche senza loggarti a PayPal, e termina il pagamento.
4) Comparirà un'immagine ""Thank you"", il gioco è fatto e noi ti ringraziamo!
How to donate?
To donate is simple :
1 ) choose the amount to donate

2 ) you will be redirected to the PayPal site, from which, even without an account, you can donate by credit card or debit card (or similar). You will see a donation to Ferdinando Esposito, one of the organizers of Luxforia.
3 ) enter your details and those of your card, go without account, or PayPal, and end the payment.
4 ) You will see an image "" Thank you"", that's it, and we thank you!",0.0,0,"1 Campaign

ABOUT US

Hi, and thanks for checking out our page! My name is Daniel Florenzano and with my producing partner, Scott Oram, we have produced, directed, written and acted in many films and videos for more than 10 years.

I am the writer/director of The Evil Rises, and I am really excited to tell you all about this new project. This will be our second feature. We produced our first feature film, wich was directed by Eric Williford and his production company 95/Forty, entitled ""Bikini Mayhem"".

 ""The Evil Rises"" is our first feature length horror film that has been in development for several months, and it will be shot in San Diego, California. 

Below is a trailer of our great flick, ""Bikini Mayhem"".
column10:
>""The Evil Rises"" is about a group of friends who discover an ancient statue that unleashes an Evil Spirit who enslaves them so it can come back to life. 

As a film director and producer, I know that money has always been and will always be a key factor in making a great quality film.
column14:
>We have worked with very tight budgets before, and we know how to stretch a dollar and get the film done the best way possible. There are many challenges facing independent films, but the majority of them can be eliminated with proper management and funding.

The Evil Rises is a story that we are very excited to bring to life for your enjoyment. It is a tale filled with action, suspense, and hair-raising moments of uncertainty. We have every intention to make a film that will scare the living daylights out of you, and make you scared sick- in a good way ☺

We want to make you part of our experience joining us in the process of making the whole project from pre-production to post. By becoming part of our endeavor you will be creating a unique independent horror film. You'll also get an exclusive look into what it takes to make an independent horror film. Consider yourself part ofThe Evil Rises family!

Please look at the right hand corner of this page to see the donations breakdown where anyone can donate a specific amount to our campaign.

HOW FUNDS WILL BE USED
column18:
>As the writer, director and producer of the movie, I assure you that every cent that we raise will be used for our project in a responsible manner and with the goal to make The Evil Rises the most scary and fantastic movie possible. We are pushing our limits to be able to create this film with all means available to us and we really want to thank you for being part of our team!

All received funds from Indiegogo will be spread across all aspects of production covering essential costs such as:

Pre-Production, Equipment, Permits and Licenses, Cast and Crew Expenses, Food Services, and many more.

We will use the funds gathered with our campaign in order to make, perform and satisfy only the needs we cannot cover on our own. On the right hand corner of our page are the donations breakdown. Feel free to look over whatever donation you think you can contribute. Any donation is greatly appreciated.

IN CLOSING

This will be our first feature horror film together, and second one as a team. We want to be able to make a film that will entertain you. We chose horror as a genre, because we want to scare the living daylights out of you.

column5:
>This movie is a reflection of where we are in our careers and where we want to go.

Please support us in bringing our first feature horror film to life with any donation and word of mouth you can spread to your friends across the web on facebook, twitter, instagram, etc...
column9:
>Lets us explain to you a bit about our backgrounds.

DANIEL FLORENZANO:

Throughout my years as a student at San Diego State University and graduate, I was able to work with a great number of now industry professionals and to establish a network with a variety of people. My educational formation also includes classes tutored by filmmaking guru and expert Dov-Simens who has taught and helped “Quentin Tarantino” becoming who he is.

I have produced, directed and written a few short films and other projects. They are: Abducted Hearts, Last Chapter, Pedicab Killer, the Bridge of Time, Rolling Stones, Heart. As far as my first feature project entitled ""Bikini Mayhem"", i produced it with Eric Williford and Scott Oram, and I had a character role named ""Neon"", which i played wildly and crazily. It was a lot of fun! 

At this moment, I find myself now at a place in my career where it's time to move to the next level, and that means making a feature film with a modest budget. So… let’s make this happen!

SCOTT ORAM:

As a filmmaker, my experiences range from writing scripts to making a number of short films throughout the past 10 years with Daniel Florenzano and other film colleagues. Some of those films such as Killer Intelligence and Last Chapter have received quarter and semi-finalists positions from well-known film industry awards publications such as FADE-IN MAGAZINE. Other short films I have made are Abducted Hearts, Pedicab Killer, Bridge of Time, and Runner’s Hell. As a Feature i have Bikini Mayhem under my belt. My ability as a filmmaker gives me the opportunity to bring cutting edge movie concepts to audiences worldwide.

My educational background includes classes from San Diego State University and workshops at the New York Film Academy taught by industry heavyweights such as Kenneth C. Johnson who developed The Incredible Hulk, The Bionic Woman, The Six Million Dollar Man, “V” the T.V. series, and many others. I've dabbled with filmmaking since 1998.

Thank you!

","ABOUT USHi, and thanks for checking out our page! This will be our second feature. We produced our first feature film, wich was directed by Eric Williford and his production company 95/Forty, entitled ""Bikini Mayhem"". ""The Evil Rises"" is our first feature length horror film that has been in development for several months, and it will be shot in San Diego, California. Below is a trailer of our great flick, ""Bikini Mayhem"".""The Evil Rises"" is about a group of friends who discover an ancient statue that unleashes an Evil Spirit who enslaves them so it can come back to life. As a film director and producer, I know that money has always been and will always be a key factor in making a great quality film. We have worked with very tight budgets before, and we know how to stretch a dollar and get the film done the best way possible. There are many challenges facing independent films, but the majority of them can be eliminated with proper management and funding.The Evil Rises is a story that we are very excited to bring to life for your enjoyment. We have every intention to make a film that will scare the living daylights out of you, and make you scared sick- in a good way ☺We want to make you part of our experience joining us in the process of making the whole project from pre-production to post. By becoming part of our endeavor you will be creating a unique independent horror film. You'll also get an exclusive look into what it takes to make an independent horror film. Consider yourself part ofThe Evil Rises family! Please look at the right hand corner of this page to see the donations breakdown where anyone can donate a specific amount to our campaign.HOW FUNDS WILL BE USEDAs the writer, director and producer of the movie, I assure you that every cent that we raise will be used for our project in a responsible manner and with the goal to make The Evil Rises the most scary and fantastic movie possible. We are pushing our limits to be able to create this film with all means available to us and we really want to thank you for being part of our team!All received funds from Indiegogo will be spread across all aspects of production covering essential costs such as:Pre-Production, Equipment, Permits and Licenses, Cast and Crew Expenses, Food Services, and many more.We will use the funds gathered with our campaign in order to make, perform and satisfy only the needs we cannot cover on our own. On the right hand corner of our page are the donations breakdown. Feel free to look over whatever donation you think you can contribute. Any donation is greatly appreciated.IN CLOSINGThis will be our first feature horror film together, and second one as a team. We want to be able to make a film that will entertain you. We chose horror as a genre, because we want to scare the living daylights out of you.

column1: This movie is a reflection of where we are in our careers and where we want to go.Please support us in bringing our first feature horror film to life with any donation and word of mouth you can spread to your friends across the web on facebook, twitter, instagram, etc...Lets us explain to you a bit about our backgrounds.DANIEL FLORENZANO:Throughout my years as a student at San Diego State University and graduate, I was able to work with a great number of now industry professionals and to establish a network with a variety of people. My educational formation also includes classes tutored by filmmaking guru and expert Dov-Simens who has taught and helped “Quentin Tarantino” becoming who he is.I have produced, directed and written a few short films and other projects. They are: Abducted Hearts, Last Chapter, Pedicab Killer, the Bridge of Time, Rolling Stones, Heart. As far as my first feature project entitled ""Bikini Mayhem"", i produced it with Eric Williford and Scott Oram, and I had a character role named ""Neon"", which i played wildly and crazily. It was a lot of fun! At this moment, I find myself now at a place in my career where it's time to move to the next level, and that means making a feature film with a modest budget. So… let’s make this happen!SCOTT ORAM:As a filmmaker, my experiences range from writing scripts to making a number of short films throughout the past 10 years with Daniel Florenzano and other film colleagues. Some of those films such as Killer Intelligence and Last Chapter have received quarter and semi-finalists positions from well-known film industry awards publications such as FADE-IN MAGAZINE. Other short films I have made are Abducted Hearts, Pedicab Killer, Bridge of Time, and Runner’s Hell. As a Feature i have Bikini Mayhem under my belt. My ability as a filmmaker gives me the opportunity to bring cutting edge movie concepts to audiences worldwide.My educational background includes classes from San Diego State University and workshops at the New York Film Academy taught by industry heavyweights such as Kenneth C. Johnson who developed The Incredible Hulk, The Bionic Woman, The Six Million Dollar Man, “V” the T.V. series, and many others.  I've dabbled with filmmaking since 1998.Thank you!",4.0,1,"5 Campaigns

WHAT IS PRECIOUS CARGO?
The Basics:

Precious Cargo is a comedic web series exploring the world of tutoring in New York City. It is the ridiculous and, at times, poignant story of the tutors who tend to the Big Apple’s wealthiest and most elite youngsters. This series will take you through the trials and tribulations of a unique pair of sisters as they attempt to balance their own lives with the lives of the affluent yet dysfunctional families for whom they work.
The Plot:

Lisa and Sandy are sisters, but they couldn’t be more different. Lisa is a type A, super focused actor who takes her day job tutoring the children of Manhattan’s elite very seriously. Sandy is a dreamer, a wanderer, with her hands in a bit of everything: pottery, sitar lessons, capoeira...every day, one passion flames out and a new one replaces it. When Lisa hooks Sandy up with a job at Tomorrow's Child of the Future tutoring company, she expects her to crash and burn. But the tables turn when, all of the sudden, Sandy is in high demand for her playful teaching methods, and Lisa’s job is in jeopardy. When you’re dealing with New York’s persnickety rich and famous and their precious cargo, you never know how things will turn out.
WHO ARE THE PEOPLE BEHIND THIS INVALUABLE ADDITION TO THE CANNON OF WEB-BASED COMEDY?

Sasha Kaye-Walsh and Lauren Singerman grew up in - and have much affection for - the world of New York City private schools. Much to the dismay of of their families, they eschewed the typical career routes of their peers for a life in the THEATAH and, as a result, have spent many hours as tutors. Keeping up with the demands of well-to-do children’s guardians, counselors, therapists, nannies and, in some cases, armies of other educators, Sasha and Lauren love sharing their never-ending supply of incredible anecdotes from their work. It soon became clear that they had to pool their combined experience into something. Hence…Precious Cargo.

Sasha Kaye-Walsh (Sandy/producer): Sasha is a New York-based actor, comedy writer and producer. Her work has been seen at such venues as 13th Street Rep, the NYC International Fringe Festival, McCarter Theater Center, Mile Square Theater, Old Lyric Rep and on Spike TV. Sasha is co-creator, writer and star of the 2012 web series Waiting on Others. She is currently a producer on season 6 of the hit show Ink Master. She received her MFA in Acting from Rutgers University and has studied sketch comedy, stand up and improv at Upright Citizens Brigade and People's Improv Theater. sashakaye.com

Lauren Singerman (Lisa/producer): Lauren is an actor, a dialect coach, and an awesome tutor. As an actor, Lauren has worked with the Royal Shakespeare Company, Two River Theater Company, Epic Theatre Ensemble, Cider Mill Playhouse, The Artful Conspirators, Kitchen Theatre Company, Lark Play Development Center, id Theater, and Project Y, among others. She played super nerd Tori Atherton on All My Children. BA: Wesleyan University. MFA: Mason Gross School of the Arts at Rutgers University. Member of AEA and SAG-AFTRA. She's married to Dano. laurensingerman.com
THE REST OF THE GANG:

Dano Madden (writer/producer): Dano Madden is an award-winning writer and director. His plays have been produced and/or received development by Actors Theatre of Louisville, The Source Festival, The Artful Conspirators, World At Large Theatre, Seattle Repertory Theatre, The National New Play Network, Mile Square Theatre, Burnt Studio Productions, Northwest Playwrights Alliance, Idaho Theatre for Youth, Kitchen Theatre Company, The University of Tulsa, Bloomsburg University, The Lark, Elephant Room Productions and Seven Devils Playwrights Conference, among others. Dano’s plays have been published by Samuel French, Playscripts Inc., Best American Short Plays and Indie Theater Now. He received his BA from Boise State University and his MFA from Rutgers University. He teaches at NYU. He’s married to Lauren. www.danomadden.com

Ben Simington (director/producer): Ben Simington has taught video in New York City for over 9 years to students ranging in age from kindergarten to high school. Before teaching full-time, he wrote film criticism for Mubi.com, programmed the ""Bastards of Hitch"" series at 92YTribeca, screened film festival entries for South by Southwest, and worked in independent film distribution at Zeitgeist Films. He holds a BA and MA in Film Studies from Wesleyan University.

Siobhan Lockhart (producer): Siobhan has worked in broadcast media since 2000.  She is currently an associate producer at Optomen Productions, contributing to their various Travel Channel series.  Her previous experience has been at NBC News Peacock Productions, CBS News and Springshot Productions (Europe). She also had the opportunity to be part of an internship program that allowed her to work for two BBC commissioning offices in London. She graduated from Wesleyan University and holds an MA in Television Journalism at Goldsmiths, University of London.
HOW YOUR SUPPORT WILL HELP:
We are taking on the ambitious task of self-producing the first season of Precious Cargo, and it ain’t cheap! Your support will allow us to cover our expenses, including:
<ul>
• A director of photography
• A sound team
• Equipment purchase and rental
• Props
• Costumes
<li>Transportation for the cast &amp
<li>Catering for cast &amp
• Insurance

Have you ever wondered what it would be like to step away from your every day norm~ See the world and all the magic it has to offer? Maybe you have day-dreamed of the all the possibilities that life on the road has to offer and would like to experience them through others.

 Hello, and thank you for your interest in The Vagabond Chronicles. This epic adventure will portray the experiences of three professional performance artists throughout their travels across the Pacific West Coast and to various locations throughout North America. Documenting the experiences and extending them to audiences via Youtube and Vimeo mini series, these artists wish to share all the possibilities, opportunities, and beauty of life on the road.

These video series will be updated weekly to share such experiences as: Extreme Sports Activities, Travelers Discussions and Interviews, Fire Performances, Harmless Pranks, DJ and Music Performances, Transformational Music Festivals and Discoveries you could only make on the golden highways. Bringing audiences the whole story and full package of what it really means to live the life of a traveling artist. Passionate about living the taboo and being true to ones self no matter what. Pushing the limits, taking every chance, and living life without limitations. 

 The Artists: 

 Dee Nacey: Truly an individual with spark and flare matched by her positive attitude and out-of-the-box outlook on life, Dee is a traveling Musician and Performer with a background to impress. Known for her impressive DJ sets as the one and only Dee Nasty, fire performance, and previous traveling video series Journey Through The Iris
column2:
this artist is one piece of the traveling trio that will definitely be making epic waves in this adventure.

 Alayna Roach: A self-inspired performance artist with a knack for grammar and arsenal of knowledge in astrology, Alayna is co-founder and Resident Fire Artist for the Level Space Fire Collective based out of So. California. With so many attributes to support this clever crew in navigating these travels, her social presence and genuine character is a treat to viewing audiences. 

 Kreature (Benn) LeStrange: With a name like Kreature it is hard to believe this character wouldn't be interesting to meet. With over fifteen years as a traveling Circus Performer, five years as a DJ and Music Producer, and lifetime of supreme shenanigans
column3:
Kreature is a full time personality and element of surprise geared towards making the people think the unthinkable and push the buttons begging to be pushed. From setting world records to coaching XGAMES contestants, Kreature has left a lasting impression on the world in his surroundings. He is most well known for his work as Co-Founder/Resident Artist and coordinator of Level Space Fire Collective in Southern California, and his ability to wow a crowd with fire and sound wherever he goes.

 As our social networks attention grows exponentially we will then take this series to a larger network such as MTV or Discovery to extend our experiences even further and inspire those with similar interest. Our goal is to lead by example, experience challenges of all natures, pursue our dreams, and make fantasy a reality for ourselves and our audiences. 

 TEN THOUSAND TO SUPPORT

column1:
We are eager to give the opportunity to donate to this cause to anyone whose interest has been peaked by this venture. Whether it is ten thousand supporters with a dollar or ten thousand dollars given by one supporter~ this is our goal as to cover the basic apps and gear necessary for the entirety of this trip as to ensure our complete capability in presenting our audiences with all of the action of life on the road. All supporting proceeds will be used to equip ourselves with go-pros, updated performance gear, Insurance and some necessary equipment for traveling performances. Ensuring safety for all acts and audiences is our top priority as professional artists and by supporting this campaign you are also helping us to keep that promise and perform for audiences everywhere safely. 

 Expenses:

Go-Pros ($1,000) 

 Go Pro Mounts and Access.($150)

 Memory Cards($200). 

 External Hard Drive($100) 

 Final Cut Pro ($300) 

 Fire Insurance
column2:
Specialty Insurance ($2,500) 

 Mobile Hotspot($400) 

 AC Invert er($50)

 Mobile Generator($1,500) 

 Art Backing($1,300).

 Promotional Media ($2,500) 

 'The Whip'

column1: We will be traveling in style in a fully restored classic Chevy Van named Chitty Dos, equipped with all necessity for off road treks, over night camping, and storage. Built strong to crawl the roads of adventure and steer true to the horizons of dreamers
column2: this epic machine will be the magic carpet to everywhere for the traveling trio and all their quests.

column1:
We collectively are aware of just how possible and amazing this venture will be and are very thankful for your support and all contributions. We aim to present every thrill of the open road and all its treasures in the highest quality and raw delicious glory. For your entertainment we present 'The Vagabond Chronicles'.

column5: >askhlp.com is a platform where users can receive online video  consultations.

column1: Like a doctor you mean?
Well, some of our consultants will be doctors, but we hope to have a variety of professionals on-board.
What can your consultants do for me?

column2: >Our consultants will able to answer any question you may have, whether it be help on your next job application or the best way to treat an ongoing health condition. Consultants may be professionals or members of the public that are enthusiastic about certain subjects, who can sign up to share their expertise, either paid or unpaid.

column1: Ooh, so I can ask for advice on my college work?

column2: >You sure can! If you are fed up of running to the library or looking at dodgy websites, help is at hand. All of our consultations will be held by qualified people or people who are passionate about sharing their experience of a particular subject, who will quickly give you the answers that you need.

column1: Can anybody sign up to be a consultant, then?

column2: >Whether you are a novice or a professional, you can sign up to be a consultant. There is an opportunity to be paid to share your expertise or you can simply share your skills with others, to help somebody out. We will be looking for doctors, lawyers, tutors, financial experts and many more, as we build up our database of professionals.

That sounds really cool

column2: >Why, thank you! Our video consultations add a personal touch and are very clear and concise, so you will no longer be confused by much of the jargon you read when searching for the answers to your questions. We will offer a service in multiple languages, not just English meaning so many more of you can connect.

column1: You guys seem fun

column2: >We do want people to have fun with our consultation service. Gents, imagine that you finish work early and decide to surprise your wife with a romantic homemade meal
column3: you look in the fridge, scan the ingredients, check an old recipe book but still have no idea what to cook.
column5: >askhlp.com launches, you will be able to log on to our ‘Help Me Now’ section of the site, and chat away with a consultant who will share the perfect recipe to woo your wife! Easy!

column1: How do I go about a consultation?

column2: >All that you need to do is head to the site, search for a consultation, agree terms and off you go! If you want to, there is an option to register your details with us, if you think you will be using the site quite a lot.

column1: I think I may share my expertise!

column2: >Hop on-board! We want you to share your knowledge and skills with the rest of the world. We need you! If you are a tutor, doctor, professional or simply somebody who is passionate about a certain subject and want to help others, you can sign up to our database and, once we have checked your credentials, you can offer online video consultations to support our users.

How will you use my money?

column2: >Why do we need the money you may be asking? You are kickstarting development and server resources. We want to get to a position in which we have a solid community of people wanting to give online consultations, but we need extra programming power to do this. We want you to help us get online as fast as possible.

column1: I still have a few questions

column2: >We are guessing one of them is ‘Why us money?’ Well, because our team has the skill set and track record and just plain motivation to get this done. We are passionate about education and learning and are passionate about this project. There are, of course, other online consultation websites that you can search for, but there is no website where you can find information on a wide range of topics, all on the same platform. We are here to solve that!

column1: What risks are involved?

column2: >There will be skeptics out there, who may not put their trust in our online consultants. There really is no need to worry as we will fully vet all of our consultants and will ensure that all relevant paperwork and certificates are in place, before anyone begins working for us. Once we get <a href=""http://askhlp.com"" rel=""noopener nofollow"" style=""color: #B52C36
column3: >askhlp.com up and running we will endeavor to build our database of consultants as soon as possible, so there is no delay on supporting those who need our services.

FAQ
1. What is the point?

column3: >askhlp.com will provide a huge database of expert tutors and professionals, to help with your every need. You can sign up for a consolation at any time of the day and can tailor your consultation to your specific needs. No more expensive trips to specialists or for one-to-one tutorials, just a simple search for support from one of our professionals.

column1: 2. How do I know that the consultant  is qualified?

column2: >All of our consultants will have to submit relevant qualifications and certificates before beginning work with us.

column1: 3. How do I become a consultant?

column2: >Simply register your details, tell us your skills and off you go! It is up to the user to decide if the consultant has the right credentials required to resolve a particular problem.

column1: 4. How much do I pay for a consultation?

column2: >Our consultants will decide on the price that they charge or whether or not they will provide free consultations. It is up to the user.

column1: 5. How much will I earn as a consultant?

column2: >Consultants can charge as much or as little as they like and will take away 90% of their consultation fee.

column2:

Well, some of our consultants will be doctors, but we hope to have a variety of professionals on-board.
What can your consultants do for me?

Our consultants will able to answer any question you may have, whether it be help on your next job application or the best way to treat an ongoing health condition. Consultants may be professionals or members of the public that are enthusiastic about certain subjects, who can sign up to share their expertise, either paid or unpaid.
Ooh, so I can ask for advice on my college work?

You sure can! If you are fed up of running to the library or looking at dodgy websites, help is at hand. All of our consultations will be held by qualified people or people who are passionate about sharing their experience of a particular subject, who will quickly give you the answers that you need.
Can anybody sign up to be a consultant, then?

Whether you are a novice or a professional, you can sign up to be a consultant. There is an opportunity to be paid to share your expertise or you can simply share your skills with others, to help somebody out. We will be looking for doctors, lawyers, tutors, financial experts and many more, as we build up our database of professionals.
So, why should I choose askhlp.com?
Can’t get hold go of doctor
Fed up of bad advice
Stuck with a job application
Need legal advice fast
Need to write a letter
Looking for homemade cold remedies
Need tips of how to sell your car
Looking for makeover tips
And much more
No longer will you need to trawl the net or pay high prices for personal tutors, everything you need is in one place.
That sounds really cool

Why, thank you! Our video consultations add a personal touch and are very clear and concise, so you will no longer be confused by much of the jargon you read when searching for the answers to your questions. We will offer a service in multiple languages, not just English meaning so many more of you can connect.
You guys seem fun
We do want people to have fun with our consultation service. Gents, imagine that you finish work early and decide to surprise your wife with a romantic homemade meal
column2: you look in the fridge, scan the ingredients, check an old recipe book but still have no idea what to cook.When askhlp.com launches, you will be able to log on to our ‘Help Me Now’ section of the site, and chat away with a consultant who will share the perfect recipe to woo your wife! Easy!

column1: How do I go about a consultation?

All that you need to do is head to the site, search for a consultation, agree terms and off you go! If you want to, there is an option to register your details with us, if you think you will be using the site quite a lot.
I think I may share my expertise!

Hop on-board! We want you to share your knowledge and skills with the rest of the world. We need you! If you are a tutor, doctor, professional or simply somebody who is passionate about a certain subject and want to help others, you can sign up to our database and, once we have checked your credentials, you can offer online video consultations to support our users.
Meet the team
Maksim
Programme Developer, computer nerd and all round technology whizz
llya
Founder, entrepreneur and bike lover
Mark
Developer, marketing specialist and family man
How will you use my money?

Why do we need the money you may be asking? You are kickstarting development and server resources. We want to get to a position in which we have a solid community of people wanting to give online consultations, but we need extra programming power to do this. We want you to help us get online as fast as possible.
I still have a few questions

We are guessing one of them is ‘Why us money?’ Well, because our team has the skill set and track record and just plain motivation to get this done. We are passionate about education and learning and are passionate about this project. There are, of course, other online consultation websites that you can search for, but there is no website where you can find information on a wide range of topics, all on the same platform. We are here to solve that!
What risks are involved?

There will be skeptics out there, who may not put their trust in our online consultants. There really is no need to worry as we will fully vet all of our consultants and will ensure that all relevant paperwork and certificates are in place, before anyone begins working for us. Once we get askhlp.com up and running we will endeavor to build our database of consultants as soon as possible, so there is no delay on supporting those who need our services.
Our team will keep backers regularly updated so each of you are up-to-date on the status of the development of askhlp.com
Other Ways You Can Help
Can't donate money today? That's okay!
Here are a few ways you can help
Follow us on social media: Twitter  & Facebook
Once you follow us, mention us to your friends and share our campaign with them using the share tools on our Indiegogo site!
Share our website with your friends and family and read our blogs to stay in the loop askhlp.com
FAQ
1. What is the point?

askhlp.com will provide a huge database of expert tutors and professionals, to help with your every need. You can sign up for a consolation at any time of the day and can tailor your consultation to your specific needs. No more expensive trips to specialists or for one-to-one tutorials, just a simple search for support from one of our professionals.
2. How do I know that the consultant  is qualified?
All of our consultants will have to submit relevant qualifications and certificates before beginning work with us.
3. How do I become a consultant?
Simply register your details, tell us your skills and off you go! It is up to the user to decide if the consultant has the right credentials required to resolve a particular problem.
4. How much do I pay for a consultation?
Our consultants will decide on the price that they charge or whether or not they will provide free consultations. It is up to the user.
5. How much will I earn as a consultant?
Consultants can charge as much or as little as they like and will take away 90% of their consultation fee.
6. What if I am not happy with my consultation?

There will be an opportunity to speak with our support team and we will endeavor to come to a suitable resolution. Users have the option to leave a review and provide feedback to the consultant.",8.0,0,"1 Campaign
|","Riga, Latvia",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/askhlp-get-your-answers-fast/pica

What's the project about?
Most people are dreamers stuck in the rate race of life. But
there are some who refuse to be a part of it and do what they dream of. Their passion for their dream defines
their identity and gives them a sense of purpose in life.
'One Life, One Passion' is a photography project that aims at telling stories
of these individuals by combining rich visual imagery with written narratives.
Subjects include bikers, musicians, artists, social &amp
entrepreneurs and many others who are living their lives around their passion.

What prompted this project?

I
am an Engineer and an MBA from Mumbai, India and worked in corporate life for 7
years before realizing that the raison d’être of my life lies in my long time
hobby, photography. Thus more than a year ago I started on a journey of
creating a new identity for myself as a lifestyle photographer.
One fine day while sitting alone in my house, it occurred to me that there must
be scores of people like me who have refused to be drawn into the rat race and
instead have decided to follow their passion. I needed to find them, meet
them and tell their stories through my photography. The idea for 'One Life, One
Passion' was born.
Co-incidentally it was during this time that I learned that a lady called Steph Jeavons was arriving in Mumbai as a part of her solo trip around the globe on
her Honda CRF 250. She hoped to travel through at least 6 continents and 42
countries in one and an half years. I instantly knew that she was the kind of
person I was looking for to start my project. To be frank, I actually thought
she is God's way of saying, ""You should do this project"". I contacted
her on Facebook, briefed her on what I wanted to do and she obliged. So, in
June 2014 I began 'One Life, One Passion' with Steph Jeavons.
Steph with her Honda CRF 250 whom she lovingly calls Rhonda
Rhonda's portrait. All that Steph will need in her journey is packed in those bags.

How has the journey been so far?

It's
been a wonderful ride so far. The biggest advantage of this project has been
the opportunity to meet passionate and self-motivated individuals from
different walks of life and hear their respective experiences first-hand. I
find out about them from various sources- referrals, newspaper articles,
Interest groups on Facebook and other online media. Once I identify someone who
I think fits the bill, I initiate contact and meet him over a face to face
discussion. It's during this meeting that I understand the person, his
personality, his passion, how he does his passion and his vision for his
passion. Then at the end of this meeting I work out a schedule for the shoot
based on mutual convenience and brief him about how I want to move forward on
the project.

So far I have photographed about 10 passionate individuals-
2 bikers,
A luthier (guitar maker),
A classical Indian danseuse,
An independent electronic music producer,
A maker of Eco-friendly shoes,
A founder of social e-commerce start-up,
A product designer making sustainable home products,
and couple more

who are still being profiled.


Jayant Chitale a.k.a DJ heads a Mumbai-based biking club, Roadstallions and ridden almost all over the country



Darshan Lodaya, an indie electronic music producer makes all his music in his home studio

Megha Gupta is an urbanologist and the founder of a social e-commerce site

Arushi Agarwal, a product designer makes user-friendly handcrafted products by employing women from lower strata of the society


I write a narrative around my photo stories and some of them have been
published in online media:
http://rohanpotdar.com/commissioned-media/
From a purely photographic viewpoint, during the course of this project, I got
a few opportunities to shoot in challenging locations, photograph sustainable
products, how they are made and meet people at lower rungs of society who work

with passionate social entrepreneurs.

Cobblers hand-making eco friendly shoes in a slum

Paaduks shoes, made from upcycled rubber tyres


Arushi with her women team in slums in Mumbai

Artisans working on leather products at a workshop in Dharavi, Mumbai


I
always wanted my photography to be positive, real and meaningful while being
artistic at the same time. I am very happy I am doing this project and will

continue doing it.

What's the journey ahead?

I will feel a sense of immense satisfaction if the stories portrayed in my project serve as a source of motivation for the young to follow their passion. I believe that you can be truly happy and content in life only if you learn to make your dreams a reality.

Through this project, I also want to highlight and promote an upcoming breed of new age entrepreneurs who derive profit by producing value thru creative pursuits, or thru socially responsible &
column2:
environmentally sustainable products and by focusing on positively changing the world over corporate greed.

One Life,One Passion will be a marathon than just a short sprint. I want to create a handsome collection of visual stories and I have just begun on this quest (so far 10 stories). After creating 25 stories, I will publish a photo book containing lessons for someone looking to follow his passion.


Why I need to raise funds?

column1: Since June 2014 when I started 'One Life, One Passion', I
have been using my own savings to carry out this project. Although this has
given me the creative &amp
column2: administrative freedom to pursue it at my pace,

column1: given the absence of a sponsor, I genuinely feel my ability to create more
stories has been limited due to lack of funds.
Most importantly, I want to raise the creative bar of the project. I want to
now tell my visual stories through short and compelling videos that employ
powerful stills, motion clips and a positive message for people who want to
follow their heart.
<span>I plan to expand my project phase-wise before I reach my goal of 25 stories. My maiden campaign on Indiegogo aims at raising funds
for the next phase of my project wherein I intend to create visual stories of 5
passionate individuals by January 2016. My idea is to spend these funds on
this specific goal only. I am not aiming at commercially using the videos I make.
Also, an Indiegogo campaign goes beyond raising money for my project. Through
this exercise, I not only want to gain attention of an evolved audience for
my project but also want to seek feedback &amp
well-wishers.

Where am I going to use the funds?

I
am aiming at raising $4,400 through this campaign.  Following is the break-up of funds usage:
<ul>
<li>
Close to half of the funds are going to be spent
on making a 5 minute video for the story of each individual. In total, I will
be creating 5 videos
<li>
Second important item of funds usage is going to
be the purchase of video equipment like a shoulder rig, CF cards, Camera rail,
microphone etc.
<li>
I will also be hiring an intern for a period of
6 months to assist me in production work
How will be the choice of subjects made?
This is one of the most interesting parts of the project.
When I began ‘One Life, One Passion’, my sole aim was to create visual stories
of highly passionate individuals living their passion. Very soon it became
evident to me that these people also represented an upcoming class of indie entrepreneurs who provided a refreshing spin to words like enterprise,
profit and way of doing business.
I will be looking out for such passionate indie
entrepreneurs to visually tell their stories because these people represent the
next phase of socio-economic growth phase of my country. I am highly inspired
by the concept of Indie Capitalism propounded by Bruce Nussbaum, a former editor at BusinessWeek and current professor at Parsons the New School for Design.
My potential subjects could be entrepreneurs in
social space (making sustainable products, running ventures that benefit
communities etc.), creative entrepreneurs (making music, making handcrafted
products of artistic value, performing arts etc.) and other passionate

individuals with entrepreneurial acumen.

Jay Rege of Paaduks with his team

Arushi (in Center) makes runs 'The Initiative' - A social enterprise that provides sustainable livelihoods through well-designed, functional handcrafted products


Samir Karnik hand crafting an acoustic guitar in his home workshop


How will I tell the stories?
As mentioned earlier I intend to make a short compelling
video for each story. There are 6 principle dimensions to each of my stories- Person,
People, Process, Place, Product, and Power of vision.
Each video will be a 5 minute fast paced feature telling the
story by using stills, motion and a positive message.
What's in it for you?
I want you to be a part of the
project. I would love to receive your feedback and suggestions for my work
irrespective of the contribution. Those of you who offer their financial
support will have some nice perks as a token of my gratitude which will include
unrestricted access to my entire photo gallery for download apart from
acknowledgement on social media and my website.
For higher contributions, you
will become a partner in the project by offering your inputs through
personalized Skype calls. You will also receive prints on fine archival paper.
I have reserved the highest perk
for a single donor. This will include credit as a co-producer in each
video and opportunity to provide inputs to the creative process apart from big
prints.
What are the risks &
‘One Life, One Passion’ is a heavily people-centric project
that relies on individual subjects volunteering their time for it. Since there
is no commercial commitment between the subject and me, there is a possibility
of subjects giving low priority to making themselves available for the project
or, although a rare possibility, completely drop off the project midway for
personal reasons. This may affect the overall timeline of the project which
currently is set to January 2016 and result in wasted efforts.
Why you should join my campaign?
<ol>
<li>
Firstly, I will treat you with fresh pictures as I progress through the project.
<li>
You will be able to participate actively in the project by sharing your suggestions with me over Skype
• No matter how big or small your donation, you will feature in my Hall of Fame on Social media and my website
• You will be on my personal friends list. We will share stuff continuously to build shared knowledge  in effect a good rapport.

Thanks for reading and hope my project is worth your time and money.

Spread the positivity!

Rohan

The Problem.

America has continuously struggled for Acceptance and Love Equality. Throughout the State of Michigan, billboards and other advertisements that are hateful, discriminating and factually inaccurate have appeared. A recent hint in our beloved City of Grand Rapids, is a billboard on one of our major freeways.

The ""Michigan Oak Initiative"" group launched an digital billboard that promotes a disturbing message: ""homosexuality is a behavior, not a civil right.""
This billboard displays photos of individuals of varying ethnicities, stating ""born Latino,"" ""born Black,"" ""born Asian,"" etc — but then displays a person with a rainbow face painting, arguing that ""gay"" people are ""Not Born This Way.""
The group strategically placed this monstrosity along US-131, where over 90 thousand humans drive each day.

Grand Rapids is a beautiful city full of love, support, and acceptance. This billboard misrepresents what this city has created, while condoning inequality and hatred towards specific people in our community.

View the full story on WOOD TV 8 HERE: http://woodtv.com/2015/06/03/billboard-being-gay-a-behavior-not-a-civil-right/
Equality.
As a Community, the City and Citizens of Grand Rapids, and surrounding cities and suburbs, we must come together and make a statement to help advance Love Equality.
#LOVEGR will first raise $10k, to fund an opposing billboard, while utilizing multiple grassroots and public marketing tools to outshine the offensive and damaging message.
The purpose behind our billboard is purely to advance Love Equality - that family, community and love should not be defined by an individual's ethnicity, gender identity or sexual orientation.
We are all humans and deserve the same rights to Love.
All proceeds raised go directly towards the costs of buying time on billboards and to advance further #LOVEGR grassroots and promotional efforts.
More fundraisers, events and promotional assets will be creating and officially donate funds to other local ally organizations that spread love and defend Love Equality.
All You Need Is Love.

We understand that not everyone is able to make a financial contribution, but are more than able and willing to help assist us in spreading the love.

Help our community out:
-SHARE this link with the ones you love
-POST a photo to Facebook, Twitter, Instagram or ANYWHERE - that displays LOVE EQUALITY &
