Click Here for the English language version!
Ce teaser vous permet d'apprécier le potentiel du film. Pour le visionner cliquez ci-dessous.
<h3 style=""text-align: center
Après une petite enfance chaotique, Mélanie pense avoir enfin trouvé une
famille stable auprès de ses parents adoptifs. Mais soudain à l’âge de 16 ans ses
cauchemars d’enfance reviennent la hanter. Une menace pèse sur ce fragile
équilibre. Tirée de force du cocon douillet de l'enfance, Mélanie sera obligée
de faire face à un monde hostile. Elle partira à la recherche de son père afin
de prouver son innocence et tentera de sauver sa famille. Pour y arriver, elle
devra surmonter d'innombrables obstacles et, en premier lieu, Pascal, l'amant
de sa mère…
Les cauchemars ce sont d’abord ceux de Mélanie très jeune, suite au
traumatisme vécu auprès de ses parents naturels, des toxicos accros à l’héroïne.
Mais ce sont aussi les cauchemars que vivent ses deux
parents adoptifs. Les arcs-en-ciel font référence au proverbe amérindien : « L’âme n’aurait pas d’arc-en-ciel si les
yeux n’avaient pas de larmes ». En substance, c'est en affrontant les épreuves,
quitte à en
subir les conséquences, que se révèle notre vraie force de caractère. Pourquoi un proverbe amérindien ? Parce que pour
surmonter l’adversité, Mélanie sera épaulée par son mentor et principale
alliée, son amie Nakoma qui se vit comme la réincarnation d’une guerrière
amérindienne.
Car ce film a pour ambition de porter un message d’espoir et d’optimisme.
Mélanie aurait facilement pu succomber à l’accablement, jeter l’éponge, rentrer
dans sa coquille et refuser d’en sortir. Mais elle fait preuve d’un esprit
indomptable et refuse la fatalité en gardant foi en son père malgré toutes les

apparences.

Car il s’agit de montrer l’importance des valeurs essentielles que sont
le courage, l’amour et la confiance en autrui et comment ces valeurs peuvent
surmonter et vaincre le cynisme, l’égoïsme et le désespoir. Cette histoire met
également en scène les faiblesses des êtres humains, la lâcheté, la convoitise,
la peur d’agir, le désir de pouvoir et de domination, l’abandon de l’autre pour
laisser libre cours à ses propres addictions sexuelles ou toxicologiques.
Car nous allons assister au combat de Mélanie à travers des scènes fortes et
dramatiques décrivant les relations et les conflits entre les personnages :
Nakoma et Mélanie sur la montagne sacrée
column2: Pascal qui, en colère, révèle à

column1: Mélanie la vérité sur ses parents naturels
entre Mélanie et sa mère rendue impossible par la présence de Pascal
de Mélanie dans le monde de la prostitution parisienne à la recherche de son
père et surtout le dénouement final sur les bords de Seine...
Car s’il y a des larmes, il y a aussi des rires. Comment pourrait-il en
être autrement lorsque l’on veut célébrer l’esprit humain ? La relation
Nakoma - Mélanie est remplie de moments de joie, quand Nakoma tire Mélanie du
lit à 7 heures du matin pour aller faire une cérémonie amérindienne sur la montagne
sacrée. Une montagne sacrée à Ivry-sur-Seine ? Eh bien oui. Nakoma la
trouvera ! Ou quand elles arrivent à hacker le mail de Pascal, quand
Stéphane et Raymond se font racketter au bord de la Seine par une bande de
voyous très atypiques... Ces scènes apportent de la légèreté au film, ce qui a
pour effet de renforcer le message central tout en générant de l’empathie pour
les personnages, un atout essentiel pour toute histoire réussie.
J’aime profondément tous les personnages de cette histoire, avec leur
bagage et leur passé, leurs faiblesses et leurs forces, les relations et les
conflits qui les animent et leur évolution au fil de l’histoire.
Sur notre site web, vous pouvez suivre l’aventure de ce film et accéder
à une foule d'infos, photos, etc. ainsi qu’au teaser que nous avons déjà tourné,
à l’adresse www.rainbowofthesoullefilm.fr. Vous y retrouverez les principaux acteurs du film,
Agathe, une jeune actrice au naturel époustouflant, Louise, parfaitement ‘castée’
en mère piégée et percluse de culpabilité, Mickaël qui incarnera le père
adoptif, un rôle d’introspection difficile, Alex aux yeux d’acier qui sied si
bien au personnage de Pascal et enfin Céline qui donnera vie à Nakoma, l’amie

de Mélanie.

Nous espérons tourner très bientôt. Votre soutien est essentiel pour
faire de ce film un succès. Pour nous aider, vous pouvez soit faire une contribution sans contrepartie soit cliquer sur l’une des récompenses proposées,
et il y en a beaucoup ! Mais votre plus belle récompense sera de savoir que vous

contribuez à donner vie à ce film. Merci d’avance et à très bientôt.

Terence Lehane
English
Nightmares and Rainbows - English Campaign
A
thriller in the form of a family drama pitching a teenage girl against a
predator determined to destroy her family. See the pitch in English below.
We shot a teaser to show people the potential of this film. The version of the teaser below has subtitles in English.
Mélanie
had a chaotic childhood but thinks she has finally found a stable family with
her adopted parents. But now at the age of 16 the nightmares she had when she was
a young child come back to haunt her. Her new family is now also under threat.
Mélanie will be pulled by force out of the cosy cocoon of childhood and obliged
to confront a hostile world. She has to find her father and prove his innocence
to save her family. To do this she must overcome numerous obstacles not the
least of which is Pascal, her mother’s lover…
The
nightmares are firstly the nightmares Mélanie had as a very young child
traumatised by the experience she had with her natural parents, both heroin
drug addicts. But there are also the nightmares that both her adopted parents
go through. The rainbows come from the American indian proverb which goes “The
soul would have no rainbow if the eyes had no tears”. In other words it is by
facing the difficulties and injustices of life straight that shows how truely
courageous we are, however painful the consequences. Why an American indian
proverb? Because throughout this entire adventure, Mélanie’s mentor and guide
is her best friend Nakoma and Nakoma believes herself to be the reincarnation
of an American indian warrior.
Because the ambition of this film is to carry a message of
hope and optimism. Mélanie could easily have given in to despair, thrown in the
sponge, crawled into her shell never to come out again. But this film shows us
an indomptable spirit who refuses to lie down and who keeps the faith in her
father despite all the appearances.
Because this film
wants to show the importance of such essential values as courage, love and
trust in others and how these values can overcome cynicism, egoism and despair.
But this story also shows our weaknesses, our cowardice, greed, fear of acting,
desire for power and domination, abandoning of others to give in to
toxicological or sexual addictions.
Because we will
follow Mélanie’s struggle through strong and dramatic scenes where we see the
relationships and conflicts between the characters unfold: Nakoma and Mélanie on
the sacred mountain
column2: Pascal who angrily reveals to Mélanie the truth about her

column1: natural parents
column2: the collapse of the relationship between Mélanie and her

column1: mother made impossible by the presence of Pascal
world of Parisian prostitution in search of her father and especially the
dramatic climax at the edge of the Seine river when Stéphane is about to put an
end to his life.
Because while
there are tears there are also smiles. How could it be otherwise when you want
to celebrate the human spirit? Nakoma and Mélanie’s relationship is full of
moments of joy, when Nakoma drags Mélanie out of bed at 7 am to go up to the
sacred mountain to carry out an indian ceremony. A sacred mountain in
Ivry-sur-Seine ? Yes indeed. Nakoma will find one! Or when they manage to
hack Pascal’s email account or when Stéphane and Raymond are racketed down by
the Seine river by a very unsual gang of thugs. These scenes bring a light
touch to the film and this has the effect of strenthening its core message while
generating empathy for the characters, an essential part of any good story.
I
deeply love all these characters, with their foibles and backstory, their
strengths and weaknesses, their relationships and conflicts between each other
and the way they change over the course of the story.
You
can follow the adventure of this film and access lots more information, photos
etc. on our web site as well as the teaser we have already shot. The address is
www.rainbowofthesoullefilm.fr
. The site is in French but you can see pictures of the main actors who are going to take part in this film: Agathe,
a young actress with an amazingly natural way of acting, Louise, perfectly
casted as the mother trapped and riddled with guilt, Mickaël who has the
difficult task of playing Stéphane, the adopting father, Alex with his icy steel
look that so perfectly matches the character of Pascal and Céline who
will play Nakoma, Mélanie’s mentor.
hope to shoot very shortly. You help will be crucial to making this film a

success. To help us you can either just make a gratuitous contribution without a perk or click on one of the perks on the side. The English translation of each perk is given just below the French. There are many perks
but your biggest one will be knowing you helped make this film come to life.

Thank you so much.

Terence Lehane

Nakoma et Mélanie sur la montagne sacrée
column2: Pascal qui, en colère, révèle à

column1: Mélanie la vérité sur ses parents naturels
entre Mélanie et sa mère rendue impossible par la présence de Pascal
de Mélanie dans le monde de la prostitution parisienne à la recherche de son
père et surtout le dénouement final sur les bords de Seine...
Car s’il y a des larmes, il y a aussi des rires. Comment pourrait-il en
être autrement lorsque l’on veut célébrer l’esprit humain ? La relation
Nakoma - Mélanie est remplie de moments de joie, quand Nakoma tire Mélanie du
lit à 7 heures du matin pour aller faire une cérémonie amérindienne sur la montagne
sacrée. Une montagne sacrée à Ivry-sur-Seine ? Eh bien oui. Nakoma la
trouvera ! Ou quand elles arrivent à hacker le mail de Pascal, quand
Stéphane et Raymond se font racketter au bord de la Seine par une bande de
voyous très atypiques... Ces scènes apportent de la légèreté au film, ce qui a
pour effet de renforcer le message central tout en générant de l’empathie pour
les personnages, un atout essentiel pour toute histoire réussie.
J’aime profondément tous les personnages de cette histoire, avec leur
bagage et leur passé, leurs faiblesses et leurs forces, les relations et les
conflits qui les animent et leur évolution au fil de l’histoire.
Sur notre site web, vous pouvez suivre l’aventure de ce film et accéder
à une foule d'infos, photos, etc. ainsi qu’au teaser que nous avons déjà tourné,
à l’adresse www.rainbowofthesoullefilm.fr. Vous y retrouverez les principaux acteurs du film,
Agathe, une jeune actrice au naturel époustouflant, Louise, parfaitement ‘castée’
en mère piégée et percluse de culpabilité, Mickaël qui incarnera le père
adoptif, un rôle d’introspection difficile, Alex aux yeux d’acier qui sied si
bien au personnage de Pascal et enfin Céline qui donnera vie à Nakoma, l’amie
de Mélanie.Nous espérons tourner très bientôt. Votre soutien est essentiel pour
faire de ce film un succès. Pour nous aider, vous pouvez soit faire une contribution sans contrepartie soit cliquer sur l’une des récompenses proposées,
et il y en a beaucoup ! Mais votre plus belle récompense sera de savoir que vous
contribuez à donner vie à ce film. Merci d’avance et à très bientôt.Terence Lehane
English
Nightmares and Rainbows - English Campaign
A
thriller in the form of a family drama pitching a teenage girl against a
predator determined to destroy her family. See the pitch in English below.
We shot a teaser to show people the potential of this film. The version of the teaser below has subtitles in English.
Mélanie
had a chaotic childhood but thinks she has finally found a stable family with
her adopted parents. But now at the age of 16 the nightmares she had when she was
a young child come back to haunt her. Her new family is now also under threat.
Mélanie will be pulled by force out of the cosy cocoon of childhood and obliged
to confront a hostile world. She has to find her father and prove his innocence
to save her family. To do this she must overcome numerous obstacles not the
least of which is Pascal, her mother’s lover…
The
nightmares are firstly the nightmares Mélanie had as a very young child
traumatised by the experience she had with her natural parents, both heroin
drug addicts. But there are also the nightmares that both her adopted parents
go through. The rainbows come from the American indian proverb which goes “The
soul would have no rainbow if the eyes had no tears”. In other words it is by
facing the difficulties and injustices of life straight that shows how truely
courageous we are, however painful the consequences. Why an American indian
proverb? Because throughout this entire adventure, Mélanie’s mentor and guide
is her best friend Nakoma and Nakoma believes herself to be the reincarnation
of an American indian warrior.
Because the ambition of this film is to carry a message of
hope and optimism. Mélanie could easily have given in to despair, thrown in the
sponge, crawled into her shell never to come out again. But this film shows us
an indomptable spirit who refuses to lie down and who keeps the faith in her
father despite all the appearances.
Because this film
wants to show the importance of such essential values as courage, love and
trust in others and how these values can overcome cynicism, egoism and despair.
But this story also shows our weaknesses, our cowardice, greed, fear of acting,
desire for power and domination, abandoning of others to give in to
toxicological or sexual addictions.
Because we will
follow Mélanie’s struggle through strong and dramatic scenes where we see the
relationships and conflicts between the characters unfold: Nakoma and Mélanie on
the sacred mountain
column2: Pascal who angrily reveals to Mélanie the truth about her

column1: natural parents
column2: the collapse of the relationship between Mélanie and her

column1: mother made impossible by the presence of Pascal
world of Parisian prostitution in search of her father and especially the
dramatic climax at the edge of the Seine river when Stéphane is about to put an
end to his life.
Because while
there are tears there are also smiles. How could it be otherwise when you want
to celebrate the human spirit? Nakoma and Mélanie’s relationship is full of
moments of joy, when Nakoma drags Mélanie out of bed at 7 am to go up to the
sacred mountain to carry out an indian ceremony. A sacred mountain in
Ivry-sur-Seine ? Yes indeed. Nakoma will find one! Or when they manage to
hack Pascal’s email account or when Stéphane and Raymond are racketed down by
the Seine river by a very unsual gang of thugs. These scenes bring a light
touch to the film and this has the effect of strenthening its core message while
generating empathy for the characters, an essential part of any good story.
I
deeply love all these characters, with their foibles and backstory, their
strengths and weaknesses, their relationships and conflicts between each other
and the way they change over the course of the story.
You
can follow the adventure of this film and access lots more information, photos
etc. on our web site as well as the teaser we have already shot. The address is
www.rainbowofthesoullefilm.fr
. The site is in French but you can see pictures of the main actors who are going to take part in this film: Agathe,
a young actress with an amazingly natural way of acting, Louise, perfectly
casted as the mother trapped and riddled with guilt, Mickaël who has the
difficult task of playing Stéphane, the adopting father, Alex with his icy steel
look that so perfectly matches the character of Pascal and Céline who
will play Nakoma, Mélanie’s mentor.
We
hope to shoot very shortly. You help will be crucial to making this film a

success. To help us you can either just make a gratuitous contribution without a perk or click on one of the perks on the side. The English translation of each perk is given just below the French. There are many perks
but your biggest one will be knowing you helped make this film come to life.
Thank you so much.Terence Lehane",12.0,3,"1 Campaign

","Hi everyone!
My name is Dariga and I'm self-taught artist and animator aiming to create cartoons we've all wanted since childhood.
I began drawing at early age and currently working on an animated short films. Sorry, but I'd like better drawing than talking and writing. Also very like action and space fantastic combats.

Animating frame-by-frame is hard work, especially when doing it all by yourself so my son helps me sometimes with painting  speeding up the production. With your kind support we'll be able to create detailed action animated short series that shows realistic combat situation from all of the views.

Each short episode will be from different wars and periods of times since ancient till modern, even actions from space wars. The main points are : a lot of details and everything according to physics law.
You will never see such things neither in documentary films nor in movies.
My aim for  ""Action from all of the views"" is to be one of the first ( if not the only ) realistic combat animated short series in the world.
You can watch my proof-of-concept above, I hope you'll enjoy!
What We Need & What You Get
We need US$12,000 to fulfill this project in HD quality with high quality sounds.
The funds raised from this campain will allow me to purchase the necessary animation, editing and record sounds software licenses to animate in more better quality and acquire the best equipment.
If you kindly support us you'll receive action or fantastic combat animated short series with thanks directly to you plus more of your choice.
$3       Thank you!
- You'll get digital copy of  the ""Action from all of                   the views"" animated short series (via email).
$5       Thank you!
- You'll get digital copy of  the ""Action from all of                   the views"" animated short series (via email).
- Your name on the end of the film credits.
$10     Thank you so much!
- You'll get HD digital copy of the ""Action from all of             the views"" animated short series (via email).
- Your name on the end of the film credits.
- A signed screenshots (10+) from the ""Action                      from all of the views"" animated short series (via                email).
$25     Huge appreciate!

- You'll get HD digital copy of upcoming episodes                 of the ""Action from all of  the views"" animated                     short series (via email) each 2 month from the                   February 2016.
- Your name on the end of the film credits.
- A signed screenshots (5+) from upcoming                           episodes of the ""Action from all of the views""                       animated short series (via email) each 2 month.
$50    Extreme appreciate!

- You'll get HD digital copy of upcoming episodes of             the ""Action from all of the views"" animated short               series (via email)  each month from the end of                   December  2015.
- Your name on the end of the film credits.
- A signed screenshots (10+) from upcoming                        episodes of the ""Action from all of the views""                      animated short series (via email) each month.
Risks & Challenges
One of my main intention is to get perks out to you on time and without delay . I'll do everything to make it happen on time.
When it comes to risk & challenges, no project is immune. However, I have enough experience and knowledge of how to overcome any obstacles to complete this project.
Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't help financially a share would be greatly appreciated!
Please use the Indiegogo share tools to get the work out!
Thank you all !!!",0.0,0,"3 Campaigns

Come together to create something beautiful

2indya.com is a collaborative platform that has been launched to support things less talked. Musicians, dancers, writers, poets, artists, yoga practitioners, alternative therapists--a mostly neglected set of beautiful human beings who are left aside by the leading media platforms, and catering only to Hollywood, business, and newsy content to generate more and more business. 

  • I am a web professional with more than 11 years of experience. I love networking with people and I have a dream of creating this platform that supports all types of entrepreneurial people who are trying to create something beautiful in this world.  
  • I have passionately collaborated with lots of artists across the world. I feel they don't get exposure that will give their art and skill a proper understanding.
  • This project is totally based on crowdfunding and will require help in every kind possible. Money, advertisement, word-of-mouth, and sharing in your network.
<div>
*A picture taken at Hindu Monastery in Kaua'i Island of Hawai'i last year attending a mantra yoga retreat.
• I am presently working in a media house. I want to focus totally on this project but need funding to support my family and also the expenses that would be used to leverage the product.

• I want to open the platform to all people who would like to collaborate and contribute. I plan to offer promos, advertisement, and reviews about their projects.

    • The Impact of this campaign

• This campaign will become one-stop platform for people who don't get the right kind of exposure in the media
  • I have already experimented on its future track. Presently, it is getting 30,000 unique visitors with more than 100,000 page views per month. It has fantastic bounce rate of 8%, which is far-far lower than what the industry usually gets. The traffic the platform gets is from around 170 countries.

About Us
<div>

column2: >Charles McIntosh, Tessie Wilmot, Lilian Brooks, Kip Wilmot and Brent Brooks at the screening of ""Captured"".

column1: My husband, Kip, and I are military sweethearts. We met each other and started our journey together while we were stationed in Italy. That journey took us to many countries around the world. When we returned to the US in 2005, we started working towards our college degrees. Kip worked towards a degree in graphic design and illustration and I worked towards a degree in nursing, however, my heart wasn't really into it and Kip saw that. He encouraged me to follow my dreams of becoming an actor and filmmaker. After a few bit parts, supporting roles and stage plays, I wrote and produced my first film ""Secured Tightly"" directed by Bobby and Renee Peoples. We sold all but 7 copies. We started production on my second screenplay in 2014. Kip decided to try his hand at directing this time. The end result was an 18 minute short film entitled ""Captured"". This film generated a buzz and was accepted at some local film festivals. It is both surprising and satisfying when we meet someone who has watched our film multiple times. The positive response we've received from our fans and supporters has encouraged us to move on with our third project entitled ""Indomitable"".
Synopsis

""Indomitable"" follows Danielle Wilkes (Amber DeVos), a former soldier and wounded warrior who now runs a company that helps women veterans with their transition into civilian life. Her life is, suddenly, turned upside down when her former boyfriend, Nathan Lewis (D James Jones), comes back into her life.  Meanwhile, trouble follows Nathan after he was hired to investigate the co-owner of security contractor suspected of breaking international laws. The story takes many twists after Nathan is murdered and Danielle is left to solve the case.

Our Goal

Our goal for this campaign is $12,000. With these funds, we will be able to purchase an additional camera, additional lighting equipment, props and rigs. We will be able to continue paying our cast and crew who have worked hard and done a great job helping Kip to visually tell this story so far. Some of those members travel from other cities to work on this film and we will be able to continue paying for their accommodations. A couple of our characters are heavily scarred so prosthetics will have to be made. Other expenses include:
• Fight Choreography
• Hair, Makeup and Wardrobe
• Special Effects
• Music
• Film Festival Submissions

The Impact

I wrote this because women' s contribution to the defense of our great nation is often forgotten (and I know this from experience). I wanted to raise awareness about women in the military and how our level of invovlement has grown over the years. We have come a long way from the W.A.V.E.S. of WWII.  After months of writing and research, my husband and I came up with a story that will, hopefully, entertain and inform.

Thank You

We'd like to thank everyone who supports us, not only with the production of this film, but for supporting us in the production of our two previous films. We're still enjoying the buzz those two films received and that's because of you.

Film Overview

In a long awaited bid to rebuild the empty relationship with his daughter that he left for dead, skilled criminal, JONATHAN's dangerous past comes back to hinder any chance of reviving their bond. Will his return to the city to be re-united with his daughter EMILIA be worth it? His previous attempt at getting out of the organized crime of New York City, resulted in the loss of his wife CLAIRE and the near death of EMILIA, so will he be able to re-connect with his daughter? Will he seek revenge on the man who drove him to the bad decisions he made in his past? Or should he have stayed away?

Opening with a flashback scene of the car crash that resulted in the tragedy of the family, the film then follows JONATHAN's return to the city upon his discovery that his daughter is still alive. His dangerous past now interferes with the life of an innocent young girl, who was unaware that her father was even still alive. The destiny of everyone is lying in the hands of a man that was gone, but never forgotten.

JONATHAN: (TBC)
Jonathan, Father to Emilia (18), so he is in his 40's. Ex criminal, involved in organized crime, used to work for Alexander, before stealing money from him and leaving town. Tall (6ft+), athletic build, a good person at heart but with the skills to match the bad people around. He is attempting to rebuild his relationship with his daughter that he (accidentally) left for dead 14 years earlier. A strong character with a dark past.

EMILIA: (Vitória Mattos)
Emilia, daughter to Jonathan, 18 years old, a girl who has been brought up by a foreign family after losing her mother in a car crash, and under the impression that her father had passed also.

She is a good looking young girl, with a strong personality and an independent attitude. She is hard working and committed to creating a good life for herself, on her own.

ALEXANDER: (TBC)
Alexander, head of the organized crime family, the Richardson's. He runs the crime circles of Manhattan. Father to Christian (28) and Luka (25). Very powerful and intimidating man, with manipulative skills. Intelligent, borderline sadistic, without any real morals.

VICTOR: (TBC)
Victor, early 50's, old friend and confidant of Jonathan. Bar owner, friendly and kind. Used to work for Alexander, but got out as he got older and wiser. Again, has a very good heart but with the skills to match the bad people around. Has an extremely kind face and positive energy throughout.

CHRISTIAN: (Will Parker)
Christian, son of Alexander, 28 years old, extremely loyal to his father, and is practically his fathers right hand man. He is quiet and confident, with a serious amount of ambition.

LUKA: (Max Turner)
Luka, son of Alexander, 25 years old, is also extremely loyal to his father. He is more of an extrovert, with a limited vocabulary and vulgar mouth. Not as intelligent as his brother, and still immature with a lack of understanding of the serious business he's involved in.

ANDRE 'GUNS' JOHNSON: (Nić Hamilton)
Guns, good friend of the brothers Christian and Luka. Keeps an eye on Victor for Alexander in the hope of discovering any people that are going against his family.
Cheyenne Pasquer - Director

I am a 21 year old Director in New York City. I was born in France but raised in Germany, before moving to the Big Apple in 2014. I always wanted to be a Filmmaker due to my fascination of the different styles and genres that can be explored through a visual medium. One of my main inspirations is David Fincher with his dark films and intense visuals. Throughout my work on 41 Films from PA to Director, I started to create my own style and an acute level of professionalism. I have studied filmmaking at the New York Film Academy and have learnt many different techniques and learnt about the industry.

I created the concept and story of this film starting with the relationship of a Father and his Daughter. I then developed the story to introduce conflict, struggle and deep emotion combined with suspense, action and drama. With the help of my screenwriter, we have developed a screenplay that is captivating for an audience and also relatable and real, which allows me to be experimental with the visuals in modern and exciting ways. This film will be a huge platform for future success in the industry.
Will Parker - ScreenWriter

I am a 27 year old Actor and ScreenWriter in New York City. I was born and raised in Surrey, United Kingdom, studying at the University of Winchester gaining my Bachelors degree in Drama Studies. I have lived in New York City since January this year and have studied at the New York Film Academy in Acting for Film. After also studying some screenwriting techniques, I decided to start developing screenplays not only for myself but for other production companies also. I have worked on over 30 films as an actor, gaining on set experience at every level from Student to Professional.

Over the course of this year I have worked as an actor with Cheyenne, and have also written dialogue for a project we worked on together. We have developed a great working and personal relationship which enables us to combine our skills and visions, to create innovative and modern work. Working with Cheyenne this year to develop this intense and dramatic story has been both fun and challenging. However, after continuously fine tuning to ensure a full story with deep and real characters, living in a world that is not out of the ordinary, we have managed to create a visually captivating and emotional journey for the audience to join us on.
The Crew

This will be a full and talented crew with an experienced Director of Photography, a Camera Operator, Assistant Camera, Assistant Director, 2nd Assistant Director, multiple Gaffers, a Sound Engineer and production assistants. All working for free to create the movie.
Where we will spend the money
The film has multiple locations which we will need to rent. We will be filming long days to make the most out of the daily rental costs.
The rental of camera, sound and lighting equipment, also the rental or purchase of props and costumes.
We will be doing the catering for the project, so to provide food and beverages for the cast and crew.
There will also be costs applied to post production.
Every dollar invested in the film will go towards pre-production, principle photography and post-production. Including the submission to film festivals worldwide.
We have tried to keep the production costs of the film as low as possible, but to make it visually beautifully and a consistent and fulfilling story, we need to spend money.

Although this is a large amount of money, we are committed to spending every waking hour in developing the project. The risks we are going to come up against are securing every location within the specified 1 week that we have to film the project. We have commitments with actors and members of the crew that can always change, but we will be drawing up agreements to ensure that we will have a full cast and crew on board for the week of principle photography. Weather can always be an issue too, but we have ensured that we balance interior and exterior locations. As exterior is cheaper due to rent, but the weather and light can always be an issue we have attempted to make these compromises staying in the lines of the story.
Other ways to help
Share our campaign on all social media platforms, including but not limited to
column2:
Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Tumblr, Snapchat and of course IndieGoGo.


","Film Overview

column1: In a long awaited bid to rebuild the empty relationship with his daughter that he left for dead, skilled criminal, JONATHAN's dangerous past comes back to hinder any chance of reviving their bond. Will his return to the city to be re-united with his daughter EMILIA be worth it? His previous attempt at getting out of the organized crime of New York City, resulted in the loss of his wife CLAIRE and the near death of EMILIA, so will he be able to re-connect with his daughter? Will he seek revenge on the man who drove him to the bad decisions he made in his past? Or should he have stayed away?

Opening with a flashback scene of the car crash that resulted in the tragedy of the family, the film then follows JONATHAN's return to the city upon his discovery that his daughter is still alive. His dangerous past now interferes with the life of an innocent young girl, who was unaware that her father was even still alive. The destiny of everyone is lying in the hands of a man that was gone, but never forgotten.

JONATHAN: (TBC)Jonathan, Father to Emilia (18), so he is in his 40's. Ex criminal, involved in organized crime, used to work for Alexander, before stealing money from him and leaving town. Tall (6ft+), athletic build, a good person at heart but with the skills to match the bad people around. He is attempting to rebuild his relationship with his daughter that he (accidentally) left for dead 14 years earlier. A strong character with a dark past.

EMILIA: (Vitória Mattos)Emilia, daughter to Jonathan, 18 years old, a girl who has been brought up by a foreign family after losing her mother in a car crash, and under the impression that her father had passed also.

She is a good looking young girl, with a strong personality and an independent attitude. She is hard working and committed to creating a good life for herself, on her own.ALEXANDER: (TBC)Alexander, head of the organized crime family, the Richardson's. He runs the crime circles of Manhattan. Father to Christian (28) and Luka (25). Very powerful and intimidating man, with manipulative skills. Intelligent, borderline sadistic, without any real morals.

Again, has a very good heart but with the skills to match the bad people around. Has an extremely kind face and positive energy throughout.

Our Story

We are Fury Fellowship, a creative brotherhood and boutique graphic design studio entering our 2nd year of production on our ""Bar Betties of Dallas"" Pin-Up calendar. The 2015 Calendar was an entirely self funded run of 500 calendars featuring talented &
column3: the bars they tend.  Like the previous year, the 2016 Calendar will showcase elegant, professional photography and high end design highlighting not only sexy bartenders, but the coolest aspects of each bar as well.

column1: We are hoping to raise $7,500 to cover the production costs of the project, including wardrobe, hair &
column2: makeup as well as printing and promotions.

column1: This calendar focuses on real women and real
Dallas culture by shining light on ladies who work hard and look great doing
it. Without focusing on the commonly accepted female vision of beauty that is
perpetuated in the fashion world, and without using professional models. Our girls come from all cultures, in all sizes, and in any way THEY want to be
showcased.
After last year, where we sold out of our initial
run and even made local news, we are looking to make this an institution and do
it all over again.

column2: Make up stylists cost money and since we're totally independent, we would like to pay them for their work. Last year, their services were donated, and to show our appreciation we're using the same crew and we'd like to get them more than a few beers and a few meals for their awesome work.

column1: • Wardrobe also costs money and a lot of these girls don't normally dress up in the pin-up style we feature, so we go out and get them outfits on our own.
• The photography and design is something we do in house but there are hard costs there as well that we'd like to cover.
• Then there's the actual printing. We print locally on American presses to once again contribute to the local economy and showcase local businesses. The printing is high quality and so is the paper.
• With your contributions, we can cover these costs.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're unable to contribute financially, you can help us to get the word out.

  • Like our Facebook page and share this Indiegogo campaign to spread the word!
","Our Story

We are Fury Fellowship, a creative brotherhood and boutique graphic design studio entering our 2nd year of production on our ""Bar Betties of Dallas"" Pin-Up calendar. The 2015 Calendar was an entirely self funded run of 500 calendars featuring talented & lovely lady bartenders of Dallas & the bars they tend.  Like the previous year, the 2016 Calendar will showcase elegant, professional photography and high end design highlighting not only sexy bartenders, but the coolest aspects of each bar as well.
What We Need
We are hoping to raise $7,500 to cover the production costs of the project, including wardrobe, hair & makeup as well as printing and promotions.
Why your contribution is important:
This calendar focuses on real women and real
Dallas culture by shining light on ladies who work hard and look great doing
it. Without focusing on the commonly accepted female vision of beauty that is
perpetuated in the fashion world, and without using professional models. Our girls come from all cultures, in all sizes, and in any way THEY want to be
showcased.
After last year, where we sold out of our initial
run and even made local news, we are looking to make this an institution and do
it all over again.
Why we need you.

Hair & Make up stylists cost money and since we're totally independent, we would like to pay them for their work. Last year, their services were donated, and to show our appreciation we're using the same crew and we'd like to get them more than a few beers and a few meals for their awesome work.
Wardrobe also costs money and a lot of these girls don't normally dress up in the pin-up style we feature, so we go out and get them outfits on our own.
The photography and design is something we do in house but there are hard costs there as well that we'd like to cover.
Then there's the actual printing. We print locally on American presses to once again contribute to the local economy and showcase local businesses. The printing is high quality and so is the paper.
With your contributions, we can cover these costs.

Other Ways You Can Help If you're unable to contribute financially, you can help us to get the word out.  Like our Facebook page and share this Indiegogo campaign to spread the word!",4.0,0,"1 Campaign

<div class=""campaignStoryVideoWrapper""><iframe class=""embedly-embed"" height=""326"" src=""https://cdn.embedly.com/widgets/media.html?src=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.youtube.com%2Fembed%2FH9ZBoMHaQNA%3Ffeature%3Doembed&amp
<h2 style=""text-align: center
column2: >THE STORYBehind the makeup, under the wig, and out of the heels, what lies at the center of every Drag Queen is a human being
column3: Flawed, fabulous, and fearless….well, mostly fearless. At its heart, Life’s a Drag is a story about self-discovery as straight(ish) Mel (Ian Verdun), in an act of desperation, inexplicably embarks on a journey that will lead him to Drag superstardom. Along the way he'll meet a host of colorful characters, some new and some old as he struts his way to glory. But before the crown is won, he'll have to go toe to toe with more than a few shady queens, and be forced to come to terms with the most damaged parts of himself, forever altering the perception of his own identity, and testing the foundations of his relationships.
column5: ><i>Check out part one of the pilot episode here! The full episode will be made available soon...unless of course, you take a peak at our perks,

column1: <div class=""campaignStoryVideoWrapper""><iframe class=""embedly-embed"" height=""326"" src=""https://cdn.embedly.com/widgets/media.html?src=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.youtube.com%2Fembed%2FYCCLGdwue5M%3Ffeature%3Doembed&amp
<h3 style=""text-align: center

We're doing something a little different with this campaign in that we're only raising the funds necessary to produce the second episode, as well as what we'll need to  get the word out. (Festival submissions and promotion costs some major coin, hunties.)

The idea is to launch a campaign before we shoot each episode. This way, we can adjust costs according to the needs of each individual episode and only need to raise a relatively small sum each time! We think it's kinda brilliant.

Life's a Drag is a long form web series, basically meaning each episode is the length of a traditional TV show at around 25 minutes and in order to maintain the high quality standards set by our pilot episode, we have to cough up some dough. Apparently cast and crew need things like food and shelter, whodathunk?
For all that to happen, we need YOU! You and your incredibly generous contributions! I mean, we literally can't do it without you...literally.
Here's how it all breaks down...

column6: >Festivals and Promotion: Now we know that's a whole lotta purple, but just think about it. The average film and television show, even web shows (the best known ones, anyway) have invested a HUGE share of their budget into marketing (those billboards and commericals ain't cheap, honey). Now we're not saying that we're ready to buy billboard space quite yet (season 2?), we're still too small of a production for that, but we can do the next best thing. FESTIVALS!

column2: >The festival circuit is an incredible place to showcase fresh material and build our critical base. A bigger base means more interest, more interest means more money, and more money means a better show!  Festival submission fees can (and do) quickly add up, plus there's the cost of additional promotion (We have an awesome publicist) it's best to raise a good amount and whatever you can save, we just put right back into production costs for the next episode...told ya, freakin' brilliant. We've already started this process and have already received some critical buzz! (3 nominations? We fancy, huh?)

>Food/Misc: Now into production. Everyone in the cast and crew is taking significant (like, significant) pay cuts in order to be a part of this crazy little ride. The way we see it, if we can't pay you what you're worth, we can at least feed you well. If we're gonna ask everyone to work for peanuts, we need to make sure they're at least getting some tasty nuts. (Yes, pun totally intended)

>Locations: As the story progresses, we want to make sure we open the world up and take advantage of all the diverse and beautiful places available to us in Los Angeles. It's weird, but for some reason people generally charge for their beautiful places. Craziness.

>Cast and Crew: Finally, the meat and potatoes of our operation. Almost everyone worked for free putting together our pilot episode, and this time around we wanted to be able to scrape something together for all their hard work and immense talent. No one is getting rich (yet) by any stretch of the imagination. But gas money goes a long way when you're asking people to drive through LA traffic to work for tasty, tasty peanuts out in Calabassas.

column1: Oh, and speaking of Cast and Crew...
Ian Verdun (Writer/Creator, Producer, Melvin Everman) -
column5: >An LA native, Verdun's performances as an actor have been described as ""Brimming with grit and honesty"" - Backstage, ""As real as you can get"" - Stage and Cinema, ""Intense and unpredictable"" - EdgeLA, ""Quirkily charming"" - Variety, ""Finely nuanced"" - LA Weekly, and he has been hailed as ""The brightest stage discovery of 2011"" - Stage Scene LA.
column9: >A graduate of the California Institute of the Arts and the British American Drama Academy, Verdun has flown under the radar, cutting his teeth on the New York and Los Angeles stage. Having written and produced several plays himself and appearing ABC’s LAST RESORT, TNT’s HAWTHORNE as well as national commercials, he decided to throw his energy into producing his own show after years of experiencing the lack luster numbers facing diverse entertainers in Hollywood. Life’s a Drag is an opportunity to tell stories about people we don’t often see, to explore sexuality, identity, and the crippling expectation that comes along with growing older.

column1:
Sebastian La Cause (Director, Cinematographer, Editor, Producer) - Originally from Akron, Ohio, La Cause is a multi-faceted actor who has worked on Broadway, in film and on television. La Cause reprises his recurring role as Fahri in season three of the Emmy winning, ORANGE IS THE NEW BLACK and was recently added to the cast of the NBC pilot, THE CURSE OF THE FUENTES WOMEN, in the recurring role of Michael. The summer of 2014 saw La Cause in the Jerry Bruckheimer film DELIVER US FROM EVIL and Ira Sach’s LOVE IS STRANGE. La Cause also worked with Sach’s in the critically acclaimed drama KEEP THE LIGHTS ON in the supporting role of Russ. Other credits include the films PREMIUM RUSH, GHOST TOWN, BEAR CITY, CHICAGO, SHOWGIRLS, the television shows HOMELAND, GOSSIP GIRL, SVU, Silvio on the daytime drama, DAYS OF OUR LIVES and Rocky in the TONY nominated revival of The Rocky Horror Show. La Cause is also the creator, writer, director and star of the acclaimed and award winning web series, HUSTLING, winner of five Indie Soap Awards, Five Groovy Awards and a 2013 Official Webby Award Honoree. Also as a director, he helms the online series HE’S WITH ME – directing, shooting and editing and most recently directed the pilot of a new series called, LIFE’S A DRAG which will launch later this year.
Take a peak at his previous series, the award winning, ""Hustling""....

Toofun West (Producer, Shahin) - Toofun has been working on movies sets, both in front of the camera and behind, for over twenty years. West has been greatly inspired by some of the most talented and highly regarded leading men to grace the big screen, including: Marlon Brando, Paul Newman, James Stewart, Humphrey Bogart, Charles Chaplin, Kirk Douglas, Peter O'Toole, Charlton Heston Steve McQueen, Burt Lancaster, Gene Hackman and Sean Connery. Toofun has lived in Iran, Turkey, Germany, Denmark, Sweden, Canada and USA. He has endured the hardships of revolutions and political unrest only to emerge, stronger, wiser and more humble, with a better understanding of himself. He is able to make practical and effective use of these powerful experiences in his craft, both as a writer and as an actor.

Santana Dempsey (Noelle Watts) - A University of Missouri alumnus, Santana is a veteran of New York City's Primary Stages, INTAR, Soho Rep, Puerto Rican Traveling Theatre and Carnegie Hall. Currently, playing Ana in Real Women Have Curves at the Pasadena Playhouse through Oct. 4. Santana credits include roles on  FX’s hit comedy “It’s Always Sunny in Philadelphia', Crave:The Fast Life starring Jessica Camacho and Rene Alvarado, HBO's The Newsroom and DirecT.V's new drama Kingdom.  Other credits include: French Dirty (2015), Evolve (2015), English Vinglish (2012), Scholastics Read180 (2009-2010) and Courtside (2014).

Amanda Hyde (Smash) - Amanda makes her on screen debut as Smash walking away with whole scenes. Brash, funny, and with a fuck it all attitude that makes her totally engrossing to watch. Raw talent is so much fun to find!

Andy Gala (Asit ""Happy"" Panjabi) - Andy Gala aka Narendra Gala is an American Actor, born in Los Angeles California to Indian American immigrant parents. A CalArts graduate, Andy has appeared in a number of hit shows, including
column2: Criminal Minds, New Girl, Outsourced, Happy Endings, Hot In Cleveland, and Bad Judge just to name a few.

column1: Stephen Guarino (DJ Tricky Dicky) - Stephen Guarino has been performing and touring as a professional comedian since he was 17. Originally from Orlando and starting at the renowned SAK Comedy LAB. He received a BFA from Florida State University and co-founded Dad's Garage Theatre Company in Atlanta. He went on to co-create NYC's Off-Broadway hit The Nuclear Family, a fully improvised musical with longtime comedy partners Jimmy Ray Bennett, John Gregorio, and Matthew Loren Cohen. The show was since then developed into a pilot called The Extended Family as part of Viacom's TV Lab and airs on the Sundance Channel. His current series The Big Gay Sketch Show (2006) produced by Rosie O'Donnell has exposed his comic talents to the film world with several features on the horizon.

Nicole Faulkner (Makeup Artist) - We're incredibly blessed to have Nicole on board to beat these faces! Her talent is only rivaled by her overall badassery. You may have seen her work on the VMA's this year during Nicky Minaj's opening performance. And you can even catch her weekly on MTV's Todrick. Her work is nothing short of transformative, and we can't wait to bring some sickening looks to you over the course of the season! 
Check out a sample of her work....
YAAAAASSSSSS!

column2: >No story about drag queens is complete without some sickening beats! We were truly blessed to be able to collaborate with the immensely talented Jessica Sutta on the pilot, and look forward to showcasing music from her upcoming debut album, ""Feline Resurrection"" as the season progresses. Jessica was a founding member of the mega successful girl group, The Pussycat Dolls and has several number 1 hits to her name as a solo artist, including the dance track ""Show Me"" which is featured in our pitch video!
column5: >Diversity. It's become a hot button issue these days, and frankly, we think it's about damn time! But even though the narrative is increasingly inclusive and self-aware in Hollywood, the statistics remain stubbornly lopsided. Diversity is something that's incredibly important to us as story-tellers. Our cast and crew is full of people from all walks of life, people of all shapes, sizes, genders, identities, orientations and nations of origin. Not only are we creating opportunities for people of color to make and distribute material with us at the center of the narrative, through crowdfunding, we are taking an active part in making everyone an integral part of that process!
column7: >""BUT WHAT ABOUT ME?? WHAT ABOUT JUJUBEE!?!""
column8: >How does your contribution help you? Aside from the gag-worthy perks and opportunities we have available to backers, you get to be a HUGE part of the diversity revolution. The web is the next frontier, a place where audiences can directly influence (and support) the kind of content that they want to see. Stories that feature colorful casts, that place marginalized communities dead center, and feature the next wave of Hollywood talent.
column11: >As with any shoot, there's an element of risk, and a fair share of obstacles. You can always expect a bump in the road somewhere along the line, but our team is seasoned and professional. We've all spent plenty of time on set, and with Sebastian at the helm we have someone with a proven track record in the digital market. Basically, gurl, we got this.
column14: >Of course we understand that everyone isn't swimming in olympic size pools of money and while every little contribution helps, sometimes you just ain't gots it.
column15: >No worries, girl. HELP US SPREAD THE WORD. Share on facebook, twitter, intragram, snapchat, EVERYWHERE! Share it with your mother, your friends, your enemies (that'll teach those bitches). Shout it from the rooftops! The more people know about us, the more likely we'll reach our goal and we'll be able to get the rest of the season to you, wrapped in one hell of glamorous bow.

column1: Sebastian hard at work behind the scenes.
Make up artist extraordinaire, Nicole Faulkner, making sure that beat stays fresh.
<div>
Talk about multi-faceted, Sebastian La Cause choreographing Kara Melle's coming out performance in the pilot, ""Retrograde"".
<div>
Ian and Santana rehearse a pivotal scene.
<div>

And the nominees are...."" Sebastian, Stephen, and Ian pose for a picture after the final shot of the ""Life's a Drag"" pilot. These boys would go on to nab best director, actor, and supporting actor nominations for their work!
Producer, Toofun West keeping morale high behind the scenes.
The spirit of collaboration","THE STORYBehind the makeup, under the wig, and out of the heels, what lies at the center of every Drag Queen is a human being

Life's a Drag is a long form web series, basically meaning each episode is the length of a traditional TV show at around 25 minutes and in order to maintain the high quality standards set by our pilot episode, we have to cough up some dough. Apparently cast and crew need things like food and shelter, whodathunk?
For all that to happen, we need YOU! You and your incredibly generous contributions! I mean, we literally can't do it without you...literally.
Here's how it all breaks down...
Lets start with the big stuff....

Festivals and Promotion: Now we know that's a whole lotta purple, but just think about it. The average film and television show, even web shows (the best known ones, anyway) have invested a HUGE share of their budget into marketing (those billboards and commericals ain't cheap, honey). Now we're not saying that we're ready to buy billboard space quite yet (season 2?), we're still too small of a production for that, but we can do the next best thing. FESTIVALS!

The festival circuit is an incredible place to showcase fresh material and build our critical base. A bigger base means more interest, more interest means more money, and more money means a better show!  Festival submission fees can (and do) quickly add up, plus there's the cost of additional promotion (We have an awesome publicist) it's best to raise a good amount and whatever you can save, we just put right back into production costs for the next episode...told ya, freakin' brilliant. We've already started this process and have already received some critical buzz! (3 nominations? We fancy, huh?)

Food/Misc: Now into production. Everyone in the cast and crew is taking significant (like, significant) pay cuts in order to be a part of this crazy little ride. The way we see it, if we can't pay you what you're worth, we can at least feed you well. If we're gonna ask everyone to work for peanuts, we need to make sure they're at least getting some tasty nuts. (Yes, pun totally intended)

Locations: As the story progresses, we want to make sure we open the world up and take advantage of all the diverse and beautiful places available to us in Los Angeles. It's weird, but for some reason people generally charge for their beautiful places. Craziness.

Cast and Crew: Finally, the meat and potatoes of our operation. Almost everyone worked for free putting together our pilot episode, and this time around we wanted to be able to scrape something together for all their hard work and immense talent. No one is getting rich (yet) by any stretch of the imagination. But gas money goes a long way when you're asking people to drive through LA traffic to work for tasty, tasty peanuts out in Calabassas.
Oh, and speaking of Cast and Crew...
THE TEAM

Ian Verdun (Writer/Creator, Producer, Melvin Everman) - An LA native, Verdun's performances as an actor have been described as ""Brimming with grit and honesty"" - Backstage, ""As real as you can get"" - Stage and Cinema, ""Intense and unpredictable"" - EdgeLA, ""Quirkily charming"" - Variety, ""Finely nuanced"" - LA Weekly, and he has been hailed as ""The brightest stage discovery of 2011"" - Stage Scene LA. A graduate of the California Institute of the Arts and the British American Drama Academy, Verdun has flown under the radar, cutting his teeth on the New York and Los Angeles stage. Having written and produced several plays himself and appearing ABC’s LAST RESORT, TNT’s HAWTHORNE as well as national commercials, he decided to throw his energy into producing his own show after years of experiencing the lack luster numbers facing diverse entertainers in Hollywood. Life’s a Drag is an opportunity to tell stories about people we don’t often see, to explore sexuality, identity, and the crippling expectation that comes along with growing older.

Sebastian La Cause (Director, Cinematographer, Editor, Producer) - Originally from Akron, Ohio, La Cause is a multi-faceted actor who has worked on Broadway, in film and on television. La Cause reprises his recurring role as Fahri in season three of the Emmy winning, ORANGE IS THE NEW BLACK and was recently added to the cast of the NBC pilot, THE CURSE OF THE FUENTES WOMEN, in the recurring role of Michael. The summer of 2014 saw La Cause in the Jerry Bruckheimer film DELIVER US FROM EVIL and Ira Sach’s LOVE IS STRANGE. La Cause also worked with Sach’s in the critically acclaimed drama KEEP THE LIGHTS ON in the supporting role of Russ. Other credits include the films PREMIUM RUSH, GHOST TOWN, BEAR CITY, CHICAGO, SHOWGIRLS, the television shows HOMELAND, GOSSIP GIRL, SVU, Silvio on the daytime drama, DAYS OF OUR LIVES and Rocky in the TONY nominated revival of The Rocky Horror Show. La Cause is also the creator, writer, director and star of the acclaimed and award winning web series, HUSTLING, winner of five Indie Soap Awards, Five Groovy Awards and a 2013 Official Webby Award Honoree. Also as a director, he helms the online series HE’S WITH ME – directing, shooting and editing and most recently directed the pilot of a new series called, LIFE’S A DRAG which will launch later this year.Take a peak at his previous series, the award winning, ""Hustling""....

Toofun West (Producer, Shahin) - Toofun has been working on movies sets, both in front of the camera and behind, for over twenty years. West has been greatly inspired by some of the most talented and highly regarded leading men to grace the big screen, including: Marlon Brando, Paul Newman, James Stewart, Humphrey Bogart, Charles Chaplin, Kirk Douglas, Peter O'Toole, Charlton Heston Steve McQueen, Burt Lancaster, Gene Hackman and Sean Connery. Toofun has lived in Iran, Turkey, Germany, Denmark, Sweden, Canada and USA. He has endured the hardships of revolutions and political unrest only to emerge, stronger, wiser and more humble, with a better understanding of himself. He is able to make practical and effective use of these powerful experiences in his craft, both as a writer and as an actor.

Santana Dempsey (Noelle Watts) - A University of Missouri alumnus, Santana is a veteran of New York City's Primary Stages, INTAR, Soho Rep, Puerto Rican Traveling Theatre and Carnegie Hall. Currently, playing Ana in Real Women Have Curves at the Pasadena Playhouse through Oct. 4. Santana credits include roles on  FX’s hit comedy “It’s Always Sunny in Philadelphia', Crave:The Fast Life starring Jessica Camacho and Rene Alvarado, HBO's The Newsroom and DirecT.V's new drama Kingdom.  Other credits include: French Dirty (2015), Evolve (2015), English Vinglish (2012), Scholastics Read180 (2009-2010) and Courtside (2014).

Amanda Hyde (Smash) - Amanda makes her on screen debut as Smash walking away with whole scenes. Brash, funny, and with a fuck it all attitude that makes her totally engrossing to watch. Raw talent is so much fun to find!

Andy Gala (Asit ""Happy"" Panjabi) - Andy Gala aka Narendra Gala is an American Actor, born in Los Angeles California to Indian American immigrant parents. A CalArts graduate, Andy has appeared in a number of hit shows, including
column2: Criminal Minds, New Girl, Outsourced, Happy Endings, Hot In Cleveland, and Bad Judge just to name a few.

column1: Stephen Guarino (DJ Tricky Dicky) - Stephen Guarino has been performing and touring as a professional comedian since he was 17. Originally from Orlando and starting at the renowned SAK Comedy LAB. He received a BFA from Florida State University and co-founded Dad's Garage Theatre Company in Atlanta. He went on to co-create NYC's Off-Broadway hit The Nuclear Family, a fully improvised musical with longtime comedy partners Jimmy Ray Bennett, John Gregorio, and Matthew Loren Cohen. The show was since then developed into a pilot called The Extended Family as part of Viacom's TV Lab and airs on the Sundance Channel. His current series The Big Gay Sketch Show (2006) produced by Rosie O'Donnell has exposed his comic talents to the film world with several features on the horizon.

Nicole Faulkner (Makeup Artist) - We're incredibly blessed to have Nicole on board to beat these faces! Her talent is only rivaled by her overall badassery. You may have seen her work on the VMA's this year during Nicky Minaj's opening performance. And you can even catch her weekly on MTV's Todrick. Her work is nothing short of transformative, and we can't wait to bring some sickening looks to you over the course of the season! Check out a sample of her work....
YAAAAASSSSSS!THE MUSIC

No story about drag queens is complete without some sickening beats! We were truly blessed to be able to collaborate with the immensely talented Jessica Sutta on the pilot, and look forward to showcasing music from her upcoming debut album, ""Feline Resurrection"" as the season progresses. Jessica was a founding member of the mega successful girl group, The Pussycat Dolls and has several number 1 hits to her name as a solo artist, including the dance track ""Show Me"" which is featured in our pitch video!THE IMPACTDiversity. It's become a hot button issue these days, and frankly, we think it's about damn time! But even though the narrative is increasingly inclusive and self-aware in Hollywood, the statistics remain stubbornly lopsided. Diversity is something that's incredibly important to us as story-tellers. Our cast and crew is full of people from all walks of life, people of all shapes, sizes, genders, identities, orientations and nations of origin. Not only are we creating opportunities for people of color to make and distribute material with us at the center of the narrative, through crowdfunding, we are taking an active part in making everyone an integral part of that process!""BUT WHAT ABOUT ME?? WHAT ABOUT JUJUBEE!?!""How does your contribution help you? Aside from the gag-worthy perks and opportunities we have available to backers, you get to be a HUGE part of the diversity revolution. The web is the next frontier, a place where audiences can directly influence (and support) the kind of content that they want to see. Stories that feature colorful casts, that place marginalized communities dead center, and feature the next wave of Hollywood talent. RISKS AND CHALLENGESAs with any shoot, there's an element of risk, and a fair share of obstacles. You can always expect a bump in the road somewhere along the line, but our team is seasoned and professional. We've all spent plenty of time on set, and with Sebastian at the helm we have someone with a proven track record in the digital market. Basically, gurl, we got this.OTHER WAYS TO HELPOf course we understand that everyone isn't swimming in olympic size pools of money and while every little contribution helps, sometimes you just ain't gots it.No worries, girl. HELP US SPREAD THE WORD. Share on facebook, twitter, intragram, snapchat, EVERYWHERE! Share it with your mother, your friends, your enemies (that'll teach those bitches). Shout it from the rooftops! The more people know about us, the more likely we'll reach our goal and we'll be able to get the rest of the season to you, wrapped in one hell of glamorous bow.
Sebastian hard at work behind the scenes.
Make up artist extraordinaire, Nicole Faulkner, making sure that beat stays fresh.
Talk about multi-faceted, Sebastian La Cause choreographing Kara Melle's coming out performance in the pilot, ""Retrograde"".
Ian and Santana rehearse a pivotal scene.

And the nominees are...."" Sebastian, Stephen, and Ian pose for a picture after the final shot of the ""Life's a Drag"" pilot. These boys would go on to nab best director, actor, and supporting actor nominations for their work!
Producer, Toofun West keeping morale high behind the scenes.
The spirit of collaboration",15.0,3,"1 Campaign

What We Need &
column2:
What You Get

Our Central Texas Filmmakers will work tirelessly throughout the week to create an extraordinary film that highlights the outstanding work being done by nonprofits in our community.

column1: • We're raising $5,000 and then splitting it between our 10 filmmaking teams. This money goes towards covering the hard costs associated with making a film, including renting equipment, reserving locations, and feeding their crew.

• By donating a minimum of $25, you will be a credited producer of your very own cause-driven film.  NOTE: A survey will be sent out to all donors prior to the screening November 2, 2015 to choose the team (nonprofit and filmmaker) whose film you wish to support and whose film your name will appear!
• If we don't reach our goal, our filmmakers have agreed to split whatever comes in 10 ways.  Let's not disappoint them though!

The Impact

Organizations that use video to get their message out raise more money, recruit more volunteers, and have a larger impact than organizations that don't use video.  You can be a very real part of making our Central Texas community better by helping 10 nonprofits create a professional quality video.
• When the word video is used in an email subject line, open rates double. (Experian Digital Marketing Report)

<li>Click-through rates increase 2-3 times when a video is included in an email. (<a href=""http://content.digitalsherpa.com/free-whitepaper-integrating-video-marketing?utm_campaign=Video+Marketing+WP&amp
• Companies using video require 37% fewer site visits before a person responds to a call to action. (Aberdeen Group and Brightcove)
• People who watch video are 85% more likely to make a purchase than those who don’t. (Kiosked and Brightcove)

• If you ever hope to reach a younger audience, you need to be using video. According to a 2013 ComScore study, 83% of 12-17 year olds and 91% of 18-24 year olds are watching online video on a regular basis.
    • - See more at: BethKanter.org

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:
<li>
Purchase tickets to the screening at the Alamo Drafthouse on S. Lamar (6:00pm) on November 2nd.
• Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.

Short Summary
Toxic Hearts is a short film about a green, glowing, radioactive boy named 'Jeremy Winkler'. He's been locked away his whole life in a dirty, bat infested attic by his cruel father.
One day, when the father's gone out, a cricket ball comes smashing through a window Jeremy didn't know existed!
'Steve', a thick skinned, rebellious girl, and 'Chubba', her bumbling friend, see the curious, green boy from afar and she decides to change his life forever, and break him out into freedom.
Jeremy experiences the outside world for the first time
column2: and as he does, he finds other exciting things he'd never even known existed before: friendship, and true love.

column1: As well as (hopefully) taking the film to festivals around the world on it's release, the film doubles as my graduation film for my Bachelors of Arts at Met Film School - based in the UK's renowned Ealing Studio's.
The short tripples as an opening to the feature film - which I really hope to make by pitching this short to production companies (and possibly even Indiegogo).
What We Need &
We've shot the film now and it's looking fantastic! We are now looking for some capital for the post production side, and for funding to take it to festivals!
Where will it all go?
<ul>
• Professional Sound Design
• Travel Expenses
• Actors fee's for ADR (Audio Replacement)
• Crew Fee's (Sound, Art Dept, Cam Team etc)
• Composed film score!
• VFX!
• Random thingymabob costs like printing hundreds of scripts, posters...
• Festival Fee's
• Starting work on the feature version!!!
The Impact

Your contribution would mean a huge amount to all of us already working on the film as you read. We have already shot the film, and it's looking better than I could've ever hoped! Now it's about distributing the film, polishing it with VFX, sound design and beautiful music composition!
We really want to be able to take the film around the world to the biggest festivals on the planet. We know we can do it with your support!
If that's the case we want to keep you all in the loop about any progress we make and all the new information we get we get it.

When we make the film into a feature afterwards, a opens up a door where we could get the contributors at least a day on set! 

Risks &
column2:
Challenges

We've already shot the film, so the footage is no longer a risk!

column1: The risk is that we can't show it anywhere, and the final polish isn't as good as it can be. That's why we need your help!
Other Ways You Can Help

If you're not quite able to contribute anything of your hard earned cash towards the project, or you're not inspired by our perks...

If you are able to take the time to get the word out in any way you can it would be so greatly appreciated and mean someone, somewhere might want to spare a few pounds.

To spread the world, you could use:
<ul>
• The Indiegogo share button
• Twitter
• Facebook
• Tinder
• Text
• Telegraph
• Word of mouth
• ANYTHING!

Thank you so much for coming to the page and checking it out, and I hope you're intrigued enough to spare a share, or a fiver!

Here's our facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/toxicheartsshortfilm

Short Summary
Tim's Encounter is a science
fiction drama about a timid, but smart 12-year-old boy, Tim, who attempts to contact

his parents who were abducted by extraterrestrials. He builds an apparatus to send signals to the moon, where he believes his parents were taken to. Trouble comes when his cousin Jacob, comes to spend the weekend
at his house and threatens to ruin Tim’s experiment. In order to succeed with his experiment, Tim realizes he must first get rid of Jacob.

My name is Ed Elias and I'm a senior film production student at California State University, Long Beach. Tim's Encounter will be a film about perseverance, courage and wonder. It shows you that when you really want to make or do something, you shouldn't give up until you accomplish it. This film also deals with bullying. I want to show people that bullies are not always as tough as they pretend to be. Lastly, I would like to inspire people to dream and have an open mind for whatever is out there, outside our planet. This short film is also my final senior project so I want to make sure it is the best that it can be.  I would love to bring my idea to the big screen. However, we are in need of financial help.

Your contributions will help bring my vision and message to the big screen. 

What We Need &
column2:
What You Get

Your contributions will go to:

column1: Actors
Permits
Production Design
Props/ Wardrobe
Camera Rental
Craft Services/ Catering

We have several different perks to each contributor. They include thank you letters, posters of the film, and original props. 

The Impact

I would like to inspire the people of today, especially children, to have courage to stand up for themselves and to not be pushed around or bullied. 

Risks &
column2:
Challenges

Being a full time student at California State University Long Beach, and working on the side, it becomes very difficult to finance myself for this project. Although we are slightly funded by the Hollywood Foreign Press Association (HFPA), it is not enough to help finance our project completely.

column1: Paying for actors, props/wardrobe, and feeding the crew is more costly than it appears to be.

With your contribution, you will help make all of these things possible and bring this wonderful story to life. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute to our campaign, don't worry. You can still help us out. How? By sharing our Indiegogo page. It would be of great help for you to share it on Facebook, other social networks or email the link to your friends and family.

Our Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/timsencounterfilm

Hallo!

Wir sind aktive Baseballspieler, die bei Vereinen in Wien und Tulln spielen. Nun möchten wir in Klosterneuburg den ersten öffentlich zugänglichen Baseballplatz errichten!  Dazu brauchen wir Eure Unterstützung!

Wir möchten Jugendlichen und Sportbegeisterten ermöglichen, wann immer sie wollen, in die Aupark Arena in Klosterneuburg zu gehen, um dort Baseball zu spielen! Außerdem ist geplant, dass in Zukunft auf dem Feld in Klosterneuburg ein Nachwuchs-Baseballteam von 10-18 Jährigen trainiert und spielt!
Wir benötigen das Geld für die Errichtung eines Backstops (Ballfangzaun), eines Schlagkäfigs, eines Mounds (Wurfhügel) und im Idealfall sogar Flutlicht!

Sollte unser Ziel von EUR 3.000,- nicht erreicht werden, werden wir innerhalb des Klosterneuburger Vereins die Mittel zusätzlich zu unseren Fixkosten aufstocken, um auf den erforderlichen Betrag zu kommen! Es ist also jeder einzelne Euro extrem wichtig für unser Projekt! Bitte unterstützt dieses Projekt, es kommt der Allgemeinheit zu Gute!
Let's Play Ball!
p.s.: Die Genehmigung der Gemeinde für die Errichtung haben wir bereits!
