A message from our lead actor: James Smith-
A message from our lead actor: Ryan Fitzgerald-
Thanatos: Psychoanalysis. The death instinct, especially as expressed in violent aggression. Where Eros is the will to live. Thanatos, is our will to die.
Thanatos is a short thriller about a young adult who begins seeing a psychiatrist about his violent, obsessive thoughts that began when he found out he was adopted.

Thanatos is a short horror film that is in production and will be filming in late February/early March of 2016. The idea came from the need to understand why people are driven towards death and committing self-destructing acts. In the psychiatric field it is believed that once one's 'Thanatos' is discovered, it is a step to helping with their depression and anxieties. Thanatos follows a young Darnell as we watch his death drive unfold and how his psychiatrist draws closer to the reason behind it.

We understand that there needs to be a convincing, genuine, and relatable central character, and that's exactly what Thanatos will achieve. We believe in character driven stories with visual and technical metaphors from the horror genre that are convincing and dynamic to the story line. With mental issues being brought into the forefront world-wide, we want to explore a story that dives into these issues with a conclusion that is realistic and reflective.

Our group is full of hardworking, ambitious, rising filmmakers who have worked for some of the most successful productions companies in and around Toronto. A bunch of us met in school at Sheridan while attending the Advanced Television and Film program
column2: where we learnt all aspects involved in the filmmaking process.

column1: Together, as a cohesive team, we unite to bring this compelling story to life.

We have worked hard to budget, script, schedule, and plan most aspects of the production. In preparation for the shoot, we turn to crowd funding to help us achieve the level of professionalism for the look and feel of the film in order to achieve a high level of quality. Every dollar helps. Each of you can feel as if you had a hand in the filmmaking process just like those currently involved in the production. Because with you, our film can be a success!

James Smith - James is an up and coming actor, based out of Toronto. He has been part of independent films, and many theater related projects where he has developed his craft.  He will be playing the lead in Thanatos as a young adult dealing with his demons. With his eerie approach, and hypnotic vibe, James Smith brings a chilling feeling to the film.

Frances Townend - Frances will be playing Laura, the mother of the main character. Having appeared in many TV episodes and short films we found her as the perfect fit to prod at Darnell's Thanatos.
http://www.imdb.com/name/nm3266807/

Ido Visentin - Ido's well versed in the genre and known for his roles in TV. His kind demeanor and likability will bring to life the extent of how far one's Thanatos will go.
http://www.imdb.com/name/nm3588099/
Director/Writer/Producer - Brandon Zyma

Brandon Zyma is an emerging filmmaker from the Greater Toronto Area. Brandon served as Director on the short film Portrait of Ryan which played at both Hamilton and Toronto Short Film Festivals. The lead actor, Austin Macdonald, was nominated for Best Performance in a Short Film - Young Actor 16-21 at the 2014 Young Artist Awards. He also wrote the short drama titled Ivy, which won best international film at the 2014 Short. Sweet. Film Fest, US.
http://www.imdb.com/name/nm5683886
Producer - Devan Salvatore

Devan is an ambitious and innovative team lead. He works in marketing/business development and has been apart of many commercial media projects. He enjoys directing music videos and producing short films. He is a cult/horror fiend, who is eager to bring the vision of Thanatos to the genre.
Director of Photography - Dexter Calleja

Dexter has en exceptional eye when it comes to visual story telling. As an emerging artist, he already has a keen style to his work. Recently, Dexter has just come off of the critically acclaimed web series, World Away. Check out his IMDb list of completed works, which there are plenty of.
http://www.imdb.com/name/nm5398846
Editor - Cameron Smith

Cameron is an epic editor, and we are thrilled to have him as part of the Thanatos team! He worked on the web series, World Away, where he serves as editor on all six episodes. He also edited the short Ivy.
http://www.imdb.com/name/nm5707297
Assistant Director - Alessia Nicole Holowwachuk

Alessia Nicole Holowachuk is an emerging filmmaker from Toronto, Ontario.  Though she has experience in various different positions in the film industry, she specializes in assistant directing.  She is the director of the soon to be released film Obsession and has worked on films with production companies such as Lionsgate.
http://www.imdb.com/name/nm6107036/?ref_=fn_al_nm_1
Makeup Artist - Angelica Avendano

One day, looking for adventure in her new city, Angelica found herself at a Makeup Artist Convention. That's when everything changed. She realized she had found her passion. She decided to make this passion my career and enrolled in the School of Makeup Art to become a professional Makeup Artist.

Throughout her journey, Angelica has had the love and support of her husband and of the wonderful people she's made connections with. She now wants to share that love and my passion with her clients through her art.
Since her realization, Angelica has been part of fashion events, and short films, where her art form has come to life. Her next project, is none other than THANATOS.
http://www.imdb.com/name/nm7300744/

We are full speed ahead in pre-production, and have already been through the casting process. However, with production in our sights we need your help to produce a high quality project that us filmmakers along with you contributors can feel proud of. 

Our largest costs are basic production essentials: equipment rentals, cast, craft (for our dedicated cast and crew), production design -including props, set, wardrobe-, locations &
column2: transportation, and other costs that come about through the process.

column1: 100% of the contributions go to the campaign and will be greatly appreciated. It will all play a vital role in the final outcome of the short.
This is where your contribution(s) will be going:

$10,000 dollars is the amount we need to cover the expenses of the film. This will allow us to share our vision and story in a concrete and creative manner. If we do not reach our goal, we will still use all the funds towards our short, but the overall quality will be unfulfilled along with the filmmakers' vision.  Please check out our PERKS. The list has a bunch of great offerings in exchange for your contributions. 
Thanks for being a part of this process and we look forward to having you as part of this team
What does it mean to contribute to our campaign?
<div>
<ul>
• You decide what it is you want to see. You pick a project you believe in.
• You will be able to be a part of the filmmaking process and be able to get updates and special offers before others. You'll be one of the originals.
• You brighten the lives of the filmmakers. Each ambitious individual will put hard work into this project and you will part of furthering their careers.
• This is just the beginning. By contributing and helping us reach our goal, you make it possible for future projects to happen.
We know that times are tight, and fellow filmmakers and film fans are
no exception! If you can’t make a donation, we appreciate your help in
other ways -
<ul>
• Make some noise about our campaign in person or social media
• Use the IndieGoGo share tools to share our fundraising site

Thanks again, your contribution, large or small, means a lot to us!

- Brandon &
column2: Devan

column5: >The Runaway is a coming of age story abut a recent college graduate trying to prove his maturity by leaving home for the first time.

column1: We want to explore the difference between how our generation and previous generations have approached this transition period of life. As we and our peers approach the daunting challenge of a future after college, the idea of taking the safe and easy way out can sound tempting. The job market is tumultuous, student loans can be crippling, and entry level jobs rarely pay enough to sustain a living, but is only through rejecting the simple solution that our generation will find its way.  In The Runaway, Michael acts as an expression of that struggle.
Locations &
column2:
Look
We have currently acquired several locations that will be used to bring this film to life. Our main character is caught in the safety net that his parents have provided for him.  The locations in this project offer a glimpse into what his future could be like, in the case that he embraces that safety net or breaks free of it. We will be working tirelessly to find more locations that perfectly suit the mood and aesthetics of the film, but until then, below are some of the location photos we’ve already gathered.

column1:
Casting
We are currently in the thick of the casting process.  We’ve seen a lot of amazing actors and have plans to hold casting sessions in both New York and Philadelphia in order to find the best possible actors to bring our story to life.

Primary Photography
We plan to shoot in January 2016 which brings with it the possible risks of snow and other winter weather, but we feel it suits the tone and look of our film best.

Director--Casey Hays
After developing a love for film and television at an early age, Casey began making movies as a child, and hasn’t stopped since. Primarily focused on writing, directing, and editing, Casey believes that the most important aspects of filmmaking are characters and story. The Runaway is a story that is very important to Casey, as it covers themes and issues that are not only prominent in his life, but ones that he feels others will relate to.

Producer--Michaela Murray
Michaela Murray has been working closely with Casey to nail down all of the logistics for The Runaway. The story and style of this film are exactly in line with the types of film she plans to make after graduation. Her previous work as Executive Producer for Drexel University’s Pretentious Film Majors has garnered recognition from media outlets including Rolling Stone, Variety, and The Hollywood Reporter.

column2:
>Cinematographer--Josh Rosenzweig
Josh is very excited to be working with Casey and the entire team behind The Runaway. He and Casey have been friends for many years and both share a deep  appreciation of Cinematography and visual storytelling. He is very excited to work on this project because it is a story for our time.

>You--Indiegogo Backer
You are the most important piece to this puzzle. While we would love to be able to finance this film with our plucky optimism and million dollar smiles, most retailers and banks do not accept such currency. Your contribution is what will bring this film to screens and allow us to develop our voices as filmmakers. With your support we can turn this story into a film that we can all be proud of and our moms will put on the fridge.

column7: >The process of filmmaking is expensive and taxing, but that’s part of what makes it so rewarding. Your contributions will help with:

column1: Props: We want all of the money we raise to be reflected on screen. Our trusty production designer, Beth Bender, will make our film beautiful with whatever means she has, but more Indiegogo contributions allow for more props for Beth to work her magic on!

Transportation: We’ll primarily be filming in and around the Philadelphia area, but until teleportation is invented, driving crew and equipment to locations unfortunately adds costs to our production.
Crew Meals: YOU CAN’T EAT LOVE!
Post Production: We need to buy hard drives to make sure our project stays safe and warm to the very end.

Film Festival Submission Fees: We’re all so invested in making the best film we can and when we finish post production our work is far from done. We’re already crafting a list of film festivals to submit The Runaway to, and we need a way to pay the submission fees.
Please like us on Facebook and encourage your friends to do the same!

Why is saving the Wurth House important?
The Wurth House was slated for demolition in the wake of a massive land deal
on the north side of Roosevelt Street in Downtown Phoenix. Of the houses on that
side of Roosevelt, this may be the only surviving piece of history. Stepping up
to save this beautiful home with beautiful bones was the right thing to do and I
need your help to ensure its survival.
Only two continuous blocks remain of Roosevelt Row, which sits inside the
historic Evans Churchill neighborhood. The area was re-zoned for high-rise
buildings in the 1970s and since then many buildings have been torn down.
Artists began to occupy empty buildings and brought new life and new audiences
to the area. As the arts district began to flourish, new businesses opened up,

and now the success has attracted residential developers.

Today, it is important to preserve what’s left of Roosevelt Row and the
overall arts district experience in the face of dramatic change surrounding it.
The Wurth House is safe at the moment at its new location on a previously
empty lot next door to Modified Arts, but it’s going to take a lot of work to
restore and prepare the house for its next life. The future use of the building
is still to be determined, but at least another piece of downtown’s Roosevelt
Row history has been saved from the wrecking ball. There’s a very long list of
things that need to take place to get the house up to current building code,
including five different sets of engineering plans (structural, mechanical, etc.),
all new electrical and plumbing systems, air conditioning and basic
infrastructure, and then there’s replacing doors and windows, sanding down interior
and exterior graffiti on the wood and brick, gas hookups, rebuilding the
concrete porch, and dozens of other requirements. And then we plant some trees,

please!

I jumped in to save this old house, and knew Phoenix folks would step up to help make it happen.
column5: >This project has the potential to represent Phoenix's best self: committed to preservation, community engagement, and shared action.

column1: The Wurth House will stand as a constant reminder that small things really
do make a big difference.
Join me in building a better city.
- Kimber Lanning
About the Roosevelt Row Neighborhood
In addition to having a high quality of life and more diversity, cities that
preserve their old buildings also perform better in real estate and the
retention of talent. They tend to have more arts and culture, and are better at
attracting a higher wage work force, while providing more opportunity for
diverse populations to participate in a prosperous economy. Roosevelt Row was just
named a “Great Place in America” by the American Planning Association and was recently
named the most walkable corridor in Phoenix, largely because its older building
stock creates interesting, human-scale streetscapes. Home to the largest
monthly art walk in the U.S., Roosevelt Row is among USA Today’s Top Ten arts
districts nationwide.
About Kimber Lanning

Kimber Lanning is Founder and Executive Director of Local First Arizona, a statewide organization implementing innovative strategies for new models of economic development that create vibrant local economies. Lanning is an entrepreneur, business leader and community development specialist who works to cultivate strong self-reliant communities and inspire a higher quality of life for people across Arizona. Lanning’s passions, which are seen throughout her work, include fostering cultural diversity and inclusion, economic resilience and responsible growth for Arizona’s urban areas.

Lanning has grown Local First Arizona into a widely respected organization that is leading the nation in implementing systems and policies to ensure a level playing field for entrepreneurial endeavors of all sizes.  With nearly 3,000 business members and four statewide offices, Lanning leads a team of 17 who work on a diverse array of programs ranging from healthy local food access, entrepreneurial development in underserved communities, and rural community development, each of which plays a part in building sustainable and resilient local economies.

Lanning’s entrepreneurial career began in 1987, when at the age of 19 she launched Stinkweeds new and used music.  Over the past 28 years, Stinkweeds has firmly establishing itself as a cultural landmark on the local music scene and a mainstay of the Phoenix business community.

Kimber is a longtime champion of the local arts community.  In 1999, she opened Modified Arts in downtown Phoenix.  The multi-functional art space transformed a ramshackle building in a neglected neighborhood into a popular and respected art gallery, theater and concert venue.  Over the past sixteen years, Modified and its neighboring galleries on Roosevelt Row have emerged at the epicenter of a nationally accredited arts district.  

Lanning is consistently recognized and has received numerous awards for her diverse work and extensive leadership. In 2014, Lanning was recognized as the Citizen Leader of the Year by the International Economic Development Council, a pivotal moment in recognizing the use of Localist policies as a force for economic development. Her work in promoting adaptive reuse in Phoenix’s urban core was recognized by the American Planning Association, who presented Lanning with the Distinguished Citizen Planner Award in 2013. Lanning has also been named one of the “50 Most Influential Women in Arizona” (Arizona Business Magazine, 2011), was the recipient of the Athena Award by the Greater Phoenix Chamber of Commerce in 2013, and was the 2014 Leader of the Year in Public Policy (Arizona Capitol Times).
Wurth House Project Budget

Following are the project costs that have been incurred to date in order to save this building. And this is before the actual renovations have even started!

Moving the home: $40,998
New foundation and stem walls, masonry: $13,300
Environmental testing: $350
Engineering (mechanical, electrical, structural): $6,554
Engineering (grading and drainage): $2,100
Demolition of back addition: $5,900
Fence rental: $1,400
Lot clean up on both sides: $1,650
City of Phoenix permits: $985
City of Phoenix plan review: $990
Rent for neighbor's lot to the south: $7,000

Your support will provide the additional funds needed to help preserve this historic building which will become a beautiful beacon for the Roosevelt Row arts district.
Funds are needed for:

Engineering (mechanical, structural, electrical and civil)
All systems including plumbing, HVAC, electrical
Architectural fees
General contracting
Plan review permitting/city fees

","Why is saving the Wurth House important?
The Wurth House was slated for demolition in the wake of a massive land deal
on the north side of Roosevelt Street in Downtown Phoenix. Of the houses on that
side of Roosevelt, this may be the only surviving piece of history. Stepping up
to save this beautiful home with beautiful bones was the right thing to do and I
need your help to ensure its survival.
Only two continuous blocks remain of Roosevelt Row, which sits inside the
historic Evans Churchill neighborhood. The area was re-zoned for high-rise
buildings in the 1970s and since then many buildings have been torn down.
Artists began to occupy empty buildings and brought new life and new audiences
to the area. As the arts district began to flourish, new businesses opened up,
and now the success has attracted residential developers.Today, it is important to preserve what’s left of Roosevelt Row and the
overall arts district experience in the face of dramatic change surrounding it.
The Wurth House is safe at the moment at its new location on a previously
empty lot next door to Modified Arts, but it’s going to take a lot of work to
restore and prepare the house for its next life. The future use of the building
is still to be determined, but at least another piece of downtown’s Roosevelt
Row history has been saved from the wrecking ball. There’s a very long list of
things that need to take place to get the house up to current building code,
including five different sets of engineering plans (structural, mechanical, etc.),
all new electrical and plumbing systems, air conditioning and basic
infrastructure, and then there’s replacing doors and windows, sanding down interior
and exterior graffiti on the wood and brick, gas hookups, rebuilding the
concrete porch, and dozens of other requirements. And then we plant some trees,

please!I jumped in to save this old house, and knew Phoenix folks would step up to help make it happen. This project has the potential to represent Phoenix's best self: committed to preservation, community engagement, and shared action.
The Wurth House will stand as a constant reminder that small things really
do make a big difference.
Join me in building a better city.
- Kimber Lanning
About the Roosevelt Row Neighborhood
In addition to having a high quality of life and more diversity, cities that
preserve their old buildings also perform better in real estate and the
retention of talent. They tend to have more arts and culture, and are better at
attracting a higher wage work force, while providing more opportunity for
diverse populations to participate in a prosperous economy. Roosevelt Row was just
named a “Great Place in America” by the American Planning Association and was recently
named the most walkable corridor in Phoenix, largely because its older building
stock creates interesting, human-scale streetscapes. Home to the largest
monthly art walk in the U.S., Roosevelt Row is among USA Today’s Top Ten arts
districts nationwide.
About Kimber Lanning

Kimber Lanning is Founder and Executive Director of Local First Arizona, a statewide organization implementing innovative strategies for new models of economic development that create vibrant local economies. Lanning is an entrepreneur, business leader and community development specialist who works to cultivate strong self-reliant communities and inspire a higher quality of life for people across Arizona. Lanning’s passions, which are seen throughout her work, include fostering cultural diversity and inclusion, economic resilience and responsible growth for Arizona’s urban areas.Lanning has grown Local First Arizona into a widely respected organization that is leading the nation in implementing systems and policies to ensure a level playing field for entrepreneurial endeavors of all sizes.  With nearly 3,000 business members and four statewide offices, Lanning leads a team of 17 who work on a diverse array of programs ranging from healthy local food access, entrepreneurial development in underserved communities, and rural community development, each of which plays a part in building sustainable and resilient local economies.Lanning’s entrepreneurial career began in 1987, when at the age of 19 she launched Stinkweeds new and used music.  Over the past 28 years, Stinkweeds has firmly establishing itself as a cultural landmark on the local music scene and a mainstay of the Phoenix business community. Kimber is a longtime champion of the local arts community.  In 1999, she opened Modified Arts in downtown Phoenix.  The multi-functional art space transformed a ramshackle building in a neglected neighborhood into a popular and respected art gallery, theater and concert venue.  Over the past sixteen years, Modified and its neighboring galleries on Roosevelt Row have emerged at the epicenter of a nationally accredited arts district.  Lanning is consistently recognized and has received numerous awards for her diverse work and extensive leadership. In 2014, Lanning was recognized as the Citizen Leader of the Year by the International Economic Development Council, a pivotal moment in recognizing the use of Localist policies as a force for economic development. Her work in promoting adaptive reuse in Phoenix’s urban core was recognized by the American Planning Association, who presented Lanning with the Distinguished Citizen Planner Award in 2013. Lanning has also been named one of the “50 Most Influential Women in Arizona” (Arizona Business Magazine, 2011), was the recipient of the Athena Award by the Greater Phoenix Chamber of Commerce in 2013, and was the 2014 Leader of the Year in Public Policy (Arizona Capitol Times).

Story Summary

LOST TREASURES OF THE THIRD REICH is a feature-length motion picture, currently in Development and slated for production and world-wide release. It is inspired by true events, meticulous research, and well-grounded speculation. It's powerful story-telling in the wake of

LOST TREASURES OF THE THIRD REICH is totally unique and unlike any of the many films offered on Indiegogo. It is the biggest, most ambitious, and noteworthy motion picture project ever available to Indiegogo patrons. It is not the typical independent movie, because once out of development and in production, the plan is to embody seasoned Hollywood professionals, an Academy Award winning producer, and an A-list cast in its ultimate creation.

LOST TREASURES OF THE THIRD REICH is a non-stop, heart-pounding, action thriller that weaves its way from Europe and the Middle East to South America in search for the men who, in the movie, kill Aubrey Temples, an 82nd Airborne paratrooper, D-Day and Market Garden participant, and German POW. In real life, Aubrey Temples is the only living eyewitness to the truth about Hitler’s escape at the very end of WWII. In the brief video interview below, Mr. Temples discloses how Hitler escaped from Germany on April 30, 1945, the day he was supposed to have committed suicide in his Berlin Fuhrerbunker.

column1: The $750,000 in funding we are seeking from Indiegogo Backers is to pay for Development rather than Production costs.  ""Development"", as the term is used in the motion picture industry, is the critical ""beginning"" of a film. It is the Acquisition of an underlying Work and Intellectual Property, the Researching of the Facts, and the Creation of the Story, among many, many other factors that go into the development of a film.

THAT is exactly why we are doing this as a Development project. The filmmakers behind LOST TREASURES OF THE THIRD REICH have opted to develop this special project with the help of Indiegogo Contributors for three very important reasons:
1) To insure that such a controversial, politically charged, and historically challenging story is created without compromise
2) To control what decisions are made at the inception of the Production Phase
3) To create as much world-wide advance interest in the film as humanly possible.
If we surpass our goal, we will use the additional funds to further enhance the Development package.

We wholeheartedly welcome your participation. Pick up one of our exciting and unique, one of a kind, campaign Perks right now!
>-What really happened to Adolf Hitler and Martin Bormann?
>-What became of the billions in Nazi gold and treasure stolen in the rape of Europe?
>-Why is approximately 80% of it still missing after all these years?

column1: -Who is Amin Al Husseini and why has history never heard of him? What is the link between Hitler, Husseini and genocidal campaign against the Jews?
-Who is funding Islamic terrorism? Why does the Sword of Allah and the Nazi Swastika adorn the black flag of the most radical and clandestine order of Islamic terrorists?
-What was the smoking gun and final link between the billions in Nazi gold and radical Islamic terrorism?
Why does the Guinness Book of World Records proclaim that “the greatest unsolved robbery in the history of the world was the disappearance of the treasures of the Third Reich at the end of the war?”
LOST TREASURES OF THE THIRD REICH is a treasure hunt, a spy thriller, an action adventure of the highest order with the greatest stakes of all.
A Message from Director Kieth Merrill

“Over a long and wonderful career in the movie business, and having had the privilege of writing, producing and directing some very successful films, I have to say that LOST TREASURES OF THE THIRD REICH is, without question, the most explosive and dynamic film project I've ever had the opportunity to be involved in. Due to several startling discoveries in recent years, this action adventure-thriller, based on a true story, will truly take audiences where they've never gone before and leave them breathless. The creative independence you give us via Indiegogo will insure that the truth will unquestionably be told…. and you will not be disappointed.”

column1: <figure style=""margin: 0px

KIETH W. MERRILL, Writer/Director/Producer. Kieth Merrill is a writer, director and producer of motion pictures. He has created an assortment of motion pictures, television shows and commercials in a wide variety of formats. His films include numerous award winning productions. Mr. Merrill was nominated for an Academy Award for his IMAX film, Amazon. He won an Oscar for his film, Great American Cowboy. He was nominated for an Emmy for his direction of Wild West for Warner Television. Mr. Merrill has worked with Hollywood’s major studios, written and directed feature motion pictures and directed films for network television, but may be best known for his work with IMAX motion pictures, like Yellowstone. He was a pioneer in the large screen cinema industry. With the development of the Grand Canyon IMAX Theater and film project, Mr. Merrill introduced a new concept known as “destination cinema”. His film, Grand Canyon -- The Hidden Secrets is currently listed as one of the 25 most successful independent films in history and the first film to be inducted into the IMAX Hall of Fame. Mr. Merrill is also a published author. His debut novel was Evolution of Thomas Hall. His second novel, Saga of Kings, Blood of the Dragon, Book I, starts a fantasy series and hit the shelves in the Spring of 2015. He has served as a member of the Board of Trustees of Southern Virginia University. He is past president of the Brigham Young University Alumni Association and recent recipient of BYU’s Distinguished Alumni Award. He is an adjunct professor to the Cinema Department of Dixie State University and member of the Southern Utah Film School Think Tank.
<div>
<figure style=""margin: 0px

AUBREY M. TEMPLES, LLC Advisor. Aubrey M. Temples grew up in Texas. In 1943 he enlisted in the United States Army at the age of 19. He received his basic training at Camp Wheeler, Georgia, and was deployed to the European Theater in Leicester, England, as a member of the 82nd Airborne Division. He participated in the D-Day campaign, as well as the subsequent Market Garden airdrop, one of the largest in the history of warfare. He was wounded, then captured by German forces and spent time in Stalag VIIa, near Munich. Prior to the end of the war, he was transferred to farm duty in the small village of Nussdorf, Germany, close to the Austrian border where the incident, upon which the LLC’s Film is partly based, occurred. At the end of the war he was the recipient of two purple hearts. Back home in Dallas he went to work for the United States Postal Service where he eventually rose to the position of Manager of Mailings, reporting directly to the Postmaster General in Washington, D.C. Today, Mr.Temples lives in Carrollton, Texas, with his wife, Gwen. He has recently been very involved with the publication of his memoir, Recollections of WWII and Hitler – The War Experiences of Aubrey M. Temples @ www.aubreytemples.com.  He serves as an Advisor to Lost Treasures of the Third Reich, LLC. The beginning of the Film’s story is based on his eye-witness account of Hitler’s escape from Germany at the end of the war.

JOHN W. CONES, Attorney/Author/Lecturer, Counsel to LLC Manager.John Cones is a securities/entertainment attorney licensed to practice in the states of California and Texas. His primary area of expertise is federal and state securities compliance for entertainment oriented business plans, limited partnership, limited liability and corporate stock offerings providing financing for feature films, Internet companies, television pilots, live stage plays, documentaries and infomercials. Mr. Cones has worked in that area of the law for 23 years in Los Angeles and has participated in the production of the required disclosure documents for more than 260 securities offerings, including 165 film offerings. More than 58 independently produced feature and documentary films have been developed, produced or distributed as a result of those investor offerings. Mr. Cones has lectured on film finance topics throughout the United States and is currently conducting a national “film finance” lecture tour. He has authored nine books relating to the business and legal affairs side of the Hollywood-based U.S. film industry:Dictionary of Film Finance and Distribution – A Guide for Independent Filmmakers(Algora Publishing, 2013), Film Industry Contracts (self–published,1993), 43 Ways to Finance Your Feature Film, Third Edition (Southern Illinois University Press, 2007, The Feature Film Distribution Deal – A Critical Analysis of the Single Most Important Film Industry Agreement (SIUP, 1996), Hollywood Wars – How Insiders Gained and Maintain Illegitimate Control Over the Film Industry (Marquette Books, 2007), Introduction to the Motion Picture Industry – A Guide for Students, Filmmakers and Scholars (Marquette Books, 2008), Patterns of Bias in Hollywood Movies (Algora Publishing, 2012), Business Plans for Filmmakers (SIUP, 2010) and Motion Picture Biographies – The Hollywood Spin on Historical Figures (Algora Publishing, 2015). Mr. Cones has also authored more than 30 articles about film finance. The articles are posted online at his website (filmfinanceattorney.com). Mr. Cones is a graduate of the University of Texas at Austin (Bachelor of Science in Communications '67 and Doctor of Jurisprudence '74) and maintains his legal domicile in Austin, Texas while traveling on a national lecture tour on film finance for independent filmmaker groups.

column1: ","Story Summary

LOST TREASURES OF THE THIRD REICH is a feature-length motion picture, currently in Development and slated for production and world-wide release. It is inspired by true events, meticulous research, and well-grounded speculation. It's powerful story-telling in the wake of American Sniper, Unbroken and 13 Hours that gives the movie unlimited potential.

LOST TREASURES OF THE THIRD REICH is totally unique and unlike any of the many films offered on Indiegogo. It is the biggest, most ambitious, and noteworthy motion picture project ever available to Indiegogo patrons. It is not the typical independent movie, because once out of development and in production, the plan is to embody seasoned Hollywood professionals, an Academy Award winning producer, and an A-list cast in its ultimate creation.

LOST TREASURES OF THE THIRD REICH is a non-stop, heart-pounding, action thriller that weaves its way from Europe and the Middle East to South America in search for the men who, in the movie, kill Aubrey Temples, an 82nd Airborne paratrooper, D-Day and Market Garden participant, and German POW. In real life, Aubrey Temples is the only living eyewitness to the truth about Hitler’s escape at the very end of WWII. In the brief video interview below, Mr. Temples discloses how Hitler escaped from Germany on April 30, 1945, the day he was supposed to have committed suicide in his Berlin Fuhrerbunker.
A SPECIAL THANKS TO: President George H.W. Bush, President Jimmy Carter, Tom Brokaw and Governor Mike Huckabee for their letters and kind words about Aubrey Temples' service during WWII.
What We Need & What You Get

The $750,000 in funding we are seeking from Indiegogo Backers is to pay for Development rather than Production costs.  ""Development"", as the term is used in the motion picture industry, is the critical ""beginning"" of a film. It is the Acquisition of an underlying Work and Intellectual Property, the Researching of the Facts, and the Creation of the Story, among many, many other factors that go into the development of a film.
The Impact Of Your Contribution

THAT is exactly why we are doing this as a Development project. The filmmakers behind LOST TREASURES OF THE THIRD REICH have opted to develop this special project with the help of Indiegogo Contributors for three very important reasons:
1) To insure that such a controversial, politically charged, and historically challenging story is created without compromise
2) To control what decisions are made at the inception of the Production Phase
3) To create as much world-wide advance interest in the film as humanly possible.

If we surpass our goal, we will use the additional funds to further enhance the Development package. If we don't succeed in raising our projected goal, we will employ the monies raised principally and primarily on the Screenplay, (which is the heart and soul and singularly most important element of any film), as well as other contributing elements of the story. Regardless and in any event, we plan to go forward with either investor participation, production (film) financing, a Joint Venture (JV) with a Major Studio, or an outright sale to a Major Studio so that the movie can be made (See Risks & Challenges below).

You good people of the Indiegogo nation can insure that this is a great success by contributing and helping us develop this unique, one of a kind, motion picture project. Support us TODAY! We wholeheartedly welcome your participation. Pick up one of our exciting and unique, one of a kind, campaign Perks right now!
SYNOPSIS
-What really happened to Adolf Hitler and Martin Bormann?
-What became of the billions in Nazi gold and treasure stolen in the rape of Europe?
-Why is approximately 80% of it still missing after all these years?
-Who is Amin Al Husseini and why has history never heard of him? What is the link between Hitler, Husseini and genocidal campaign against the Jews?
-Who is funding Islamic terrorism? Why does the Sword of Allah and the Nazi Swastika adorn the black flag of the most radical and clandestine order of Islamic terrorists?
-What was the smoking gun and final link between the billions in Nazi gold and radical Islamic terrorism?
Why does the Guinness Book of World Records proclaim that “the greatest unsolved robbery in the history of the world was the disappearance of the treasures of the Third Reich at the end of the war?”
LOST TREASURES OF THE THIRD REICH is a treasure hunt, a spy thriller, an action adventure of the highest order with the greatest stakes of all.
A Message from Director Kieth Merrill

“Over a long and wonderful career in the movie business, and having had the privilege of writing, producing and directing some very successful films, I have to say that LOST TREASURES OF THE THIRD REICH is, without question, the most explosive and dynamic film project I've ever had the opportunity to be involved in. Due to several startling discoveries in recent years, this action adventure-thriller, based on a true story, will truly take audiences where they've never gone before and leave them breathless. The creative independence you give us via Indiegogo will insure that the truth will unquestionably be told…. and you will not be disappointed.”
Risks & Challenges
There are many risks in developing, producing and distributing a motion picture, especially films designed to be International in scope. The Risks inherent in this project are as follows:

No commitment for Production funding. No Distribution agreement In place. A significant amount of Time required. Production activities may be difficult. Commercial Success is not certain. Development, Production, or Distribution may be prematurely abandoned. Cost Overruns may occur.The motion picture industry is Highly Competitive and is constantly Changing. Foreign Distribution can be unstable. Audience appeal Is Unpredictable.

The Challenges in our Campaign are as follows: There may be a perceived disconnect between the $750,000 for Development and the money required for Production (filming). Development is the process of research, writing the script, selecting locations, production schedule and selecting the creative team. The
base, no frills, filming budget for an international film like Lost
Treasure of The Third Reich is roughly estimated at $30-$40 Million. A
precise Production (filming) budget cannot be created until the script is
completed, the locations determined, the creative team selected, and the
production plan in place.

Once Development is completed, a DGA Production Manager will prepare a 40 page, line-item budget and calculate the precise cost of the picture. In addition to the the actual cost of production, additional money may be required for A-List Actors, Producers and Director. These additional costs can vary greatly, depending on who is cast.
The

question everyone obviously asks themselves is “OK, so what happens if I go ahead and contribute to this project and the film is developed, then what? How does the script and the development package turn into a movie?""
The possibilities following Development include: 1) JV with an alliance of
Independent Production companies, 2) Joint Venture (JV) with a Major or
Mini-major Studio,  3) Sell the Development package to a Major or Mini-major
Studio, or 4) Raise the funding from private investors and/or investment
companies and produce the film ourselves. The key to getting independent
financing is to have a high-quality Development Package completed and in
hand. It is at this point that
Development"" and ""Production"" would merge, thereby allaying any concerns about
a perceived disconnect.

Our # 1 goal is to pursue the most likely possibility of getting the movie made and staying involved to insure that our Contributors receive their Perks. Regardless of whichever possibility we pursue in getting the movie made, the commitments made to Contributors will be a part of any contract(s) and/or agreement(s) going forward.

Obviously folks want to know that if they contribute to the project at any level, will they actually be able to see the film. Consequently, if we sell the Development package to a Major Studio, it will be at a contractual price and commitment level that it stands to reason that they would want to make the film, but we can't speak for them. If we Joint Venture with a Major Studio and put up half the cost of the film, we'll obviously have a lot more say
column2: or if we do it solo and pay all the cost of the film, we'll have all the say.

column1: There
is a correlation between the probability of Production and the time and money spent
on Development. The better the Development package, the higher
the probability the movie will get made. If we don't sell to a Major, JV with a
Major, or have an alliance with a group of independents, our plan is to raise
the money and do it ourselves.

For Contributors who opt for the higher-priced perks, the making of the movie becomes even more of a critical question.  Factors that favor the probability that the movie will get made by one or more possible means include the following: 1) Producer/Director Kieth

Merrill is a two time Oscar nominee and winner of an Academy Award, 2) Merrill has done numerous successful films, 3) Merrill and Robinson have done two successful films together, 4) Merrill has many industry contacts, credentials and credibility, 5) Robinson is a successful entrepreneur who has an impressive track record of getting projects (including films) financed, 6) Robinson and Merrill have access to industry sources, investors, and funding methodologies. In the event the film is sold to third parties, who may be unwilling to honor any or all of the levels of our higher-priced perks, we will refund to our Contributors the cost of the non-utilized perks above $500 at the time of such sale.
It
is important for our Contributors to understand what Development is and why it is so important. The key elements of what we call THE DEVELOPMENT PACKAGE are:
Rights to the book. Research. Screenplay. Locations. Incentives and Rebates.

Production design. Production plan. Distribution plan, Story boards and Pre-Visualization, Identify Key Creative Team, Identify Key A-List Talent, Completion Guarantee, Create a precise Budget, Create a PACKAGE suitable
for presentation.
Assuming we raise the $750,000, Development of the movie will proceed time-wise as follows:
Development :                              6 months
Presentations:                              2 months
Contract and funding:                2 months
Total Development Package  10 months
AFTER
DEVELOPMENT:
Go after A-List cast
Go after A-list creative production talent
Attach talent
Seek co-production alliances
Pitch Major Studios
Pitch Mini-Majors
Pitch foreign distributors
Pre-sales
Presentation funding sources:
Private PMM
Production loans
Gap finance
Perfect incentives (State govt)
Make choices
Contracts
Funding
Prep and pre-production
Production
Perks for doners.
Pre-distribution
Post Production and visual effects
Publicity and promotion
Distribution
Production & Financing of the Film
Every
movie showing today opens with half a dozen credits for various production
companies and entities involved in the funding and production of the motion
picture. As you can see in the section AFTER DEVELOPMENT above, we go through an
exhaustive period of presentation in search of production alliances and funding
partners.  With the Development Package and A-List Talent, we will have many
options for funding alliances. Only in the event that we are unhappy with alliance offers will we turn solely and
wholly to private placement and conventional fund raising, via a Limited Liability Company or Partnership.
As
noted above, raising money from private individual investors and institutions is the last option, and under almost any circumstances, is unlikely to be the sole source of funding. That said, both

Lewis Robinson and Kieth Merrill have raised significant monies from private investors and/or institutions on many different occasions, but that does not guarantee they will be able to secure funding for this film.
THE FILM WILL BE SHOT IN A NUMBER OF DIFFERENT LOCATIONS, which will be determined by the script, requirements of the story, and the budget. The number one rule of quality
filmmaking is: EVERYTHING BEGINS WITH THE SCRIPT. That is WHY Development
is so important. We approach Lost Treasure of the Third Reich the same way a
major studio approaches Star Wars. DEVELOP the property until it is a slam dunk
winner. THAT is what entices talent, attracts film financing, and increases the possibility of having a HUGE HIT in theaters.
The
film will be released 22 months from the date of Development funding if all goes well.
SCHEDULE:
Development
:                        6  months
Presentations:
2 months
Contract
and funding:          2 months
Total Development              10 months
Prep & Pre-production:     4 months
Production Begins At This Point
Production:                            2 months
Visual
Effects:                       2 months (plus 2 overlapped)
Post
Production:                  4 months
Total Production                 12 months
Film Released                  22 months

Our preference is that the Film be produced by us in a JV with a major studio, but ONLY if the terms are right. We will push hard for the optimum JV with a major studio, but it is far more likely we will go with a mini-major or an alliance
of independent production and funding entities. The GOOD NEWS is that because of
our alliance with GMT Studios and GMT Releasing, we have access to major quality, world-wide distribution on excellent terms and conditions.

Through our alliance with GMT Releasing, we have the best of all distribution options. Our arrangement with GMT would allow the production to put up P&A money (Prints and Advertising, the cost of distribution) in exchange for  a 10% distribution fee (verses 35% with any one of the 7 major studios) pari passu returns and complete transparency in accounting.

Having been in the movie business a long time and having made films distributed by Disney, Warner Brothers, Columbia, Sony and United Artist,"" Merrill states, ""our preference is GMT Studios-GMT Releasing. No matter how the film is financed, we have access to distribution through GMT Releasing, subject only to approval of the project.""

In concluding the RISKS and CHALLENGES section, we believe that development is the key and first step in making a motion picture that holds significant promise for success, and that is why we are asking for your help with the process. It's a story that needs to be told. In addition, we believe the additional and historical information and insights could very well make this film a media event. We want you to be a part of this Development Phase, because in doing so you will be contributing to a significant film project, as well as what we believe will be a history making event!
REGARDING PERKS:
As it concerns fulfillment of our PERKS, we are in discussions with and plan to use a major fulfillment company Austin, Texas, in order to get Perks delivered safely and on schedule.

IN SUMMARY: This campaign is for DEVELOPMENT of the motion picture, and the target amount does not include PRODUCTION. Perks for contributions over $25 are made only upon the successful funding and production of the motion picture. Transportation and Lodging are included in certain reward bundles and are not the responsibility of the Contributor.

This fundraising campaign is subject to all applicable rules/regulations, movie guild rules, and applicable law. If any of these requirements are the basis for a potential conflict, we will, in good faith, work with you to enable you to have a substitute Perk. Our campaign has a limited amount of time, so please make sure to contribute before it ends! Also, please use Indiegogo's share tools to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign. MANY THANKS!
OUR TEAM

LEWIS S. ROBINSON, III, Executive Producer and Development Executive, An Owner of the LLC Manager. Lewis S. Robinson, III, is an entrepreneur with an extensive history of starting, buying, underwriting, merging, managing and selling companies, ranging from co-founding Institutional Equity Corporation, the first securities firm in the world to go public, and subsequently be admitted to the New York and American Stock Exchanges
column2: IE Management and Research, Inc., which managed the Hedge Fund of America, the first publicly-held hedge fund
column3: two Cable TV companies, Jackson Hole Telecommunications, Inc. and Gallatin Cable Telecommunications, Inc.
column4: several real estate development and sales companies, WRB West Associates, Inc., developer of the Madison Addition to the Town of West Yellowstone, MT, Hebgen Lake Estates, Ltd., Firehole Land Corp., developer of the Grizzly Park Addition to the Town of West Yellowstone
column7: an IMAX theater and film titled YELLOWSTONE, as Grizzly Cinema Partners and RSP Investors, Inc.
column8: a Grizzly and Wolf Discovery Center and an IMAX film titled AMAZON, as Firehole Entertainment Corp., a wholly-owned subsidiary of Ogden Corp
column9: as well as Sound City Recording Corp., a recording studio and record company. Additionally, he has served as an officer and/or director of numerous public & private companies and non-profit organizations. He is a former Allied Member of both the New York and American Stock Exchanges, a former Registered Investment Adviser with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission, a former Registered Principal with the National Association of Securities Dealers, and a former member of the National Association of Realtors. He earned his BA degree from Tulane University and studied Business Administration at Centenary College of Louisiana. Mr. Robinson currently resides in Austin, Texas, with Linda, his wife of 40 years.

column1: KIETH W. MERRILL, Writer/Director/Producer. Kieth Merrill is a writer, director and producer of motion pictures. He has created an assortment of motion pictures, television shows and commercials in a wide variety of formats. His films include numerous award winning productions. Mr. Merrill was nominated for an Academy Award for his IMAX film, Amazon. He won an Oscar for his film, Great American Cowboy. He was nominated for an Emmy for his direction of Wild West for Warner Television. Mr. Merrill has worked with Hollywood’s major studios, written and directed feature motion pictures and directed films for network television, but may be best known for his work with IMAX motion pictures, like Yellowstone. He was a pioneer in the large screen cinema industry. With the development of the Grand Canyon IMAX Theater and film project, Mr. Merrill introduced a new concept known as “destination cinema”. His film, Grand Canyon -- The Hidden Secrets is currently listed as one of the 25 most successful independent films in history and the first film to be inducted into the IMAX Hall of Fame. Mr. Merrill is also a published author. His debut novel was Evolution of Thomas Hall. His second novel, Saga of Kings, Blood of the Dragon, Book I, starts a fantasy series and hit the shelves in the Spring of 2015. He has served as a member of the Board of Trustees of Southern Virginia University. He is past president of the Brigham Young University Alumni Association and recent recipient of BYU’s Distinguished Alumni Award. He is an adjunct professor to the Cinema Department of Dixie State University and member of the Southern Utah Film School Think Tank.

AUBREY M. TEMPLES, LLC Advisor. Aubrey M. Temples grew up in Texas. In 1943 he enlisted in the United States Army at the age of 19. He received his basic training at Camp Wheeler, Georgia, and was deployed to the European Theater in Leicester, England, as a member of the 82nd Airborne Division. He participated in the D-Day campaign, as well as the subsequent Market Garden airdrop, one of the largest in the history of warfare. He was wounded, then captured by German forces and spent time in Stalag VIIa, near Munich. Prior to the end of the war, he was transferred to farm duty in the small village of Nussdorf, Germany, close to the Austrian border where the incident, upon which the LLC’s Film is partly based, occurred. At the end of the war he was the recipient of two purple hearts. Back home in Dallas he went to work for the United States Postal Service where he eventually rose to the position of Manager of Mailings, reporting directly to the Postmaster General in Washington, D.C. Today, Mr.Temples lives in Carrollton, Texas, with his wife, Gwen. He has recently been very involved with the publication of his memoir, Recollections of WWII and Hitler – The War Experiences of Aubrey M. Temples @ www.aubreytemples.com.  He serves as an Advisor to Lost Treasures of the Third Reich, LLC. The beginning of the Film’s story is based on his eye-witness account of Hitler’s escape from Germany at the end of the war.

JEREMY NEILSON, Mananging Director, ASSURE FUND MANAGEMENT II, LLC, Private Equity Fund Administrator.  Assure Fund Management II, LLC (“Assure”) is a private equity fund administration firm based in Salt Lake City, Utah. The firm has been retained to provide fund administrative services for a wide range of crowdfunding platforms, angel groups and venture capital firms. Assure’s Managing Director and Founder is Jeremy Neilson, who previously served for seven years as the Managing Director of the State of Utah’s private equity program, the Utah Fund of Funds. Mr. Neilson directs a staff with more than 20 years of private equity investment experience. Assure has agreed to provide administrative services in support of the Lost Treasures of the Third Reich, LLC.

AUSTIN G. ROBERTSON, JR, Certified Public Accountant and LLC Advisor. Austin G. Robertson, Jr. is a Shreveport, Louisiana CPA, Personal Financial Specialist and Certified Valuation Analyst with more than 40 years of public accounting experience. Since 2006 he has served as “Of Counsel” for the firm of Cole, Evans and Peterson where he maintains a practice involving business valuations, litigation support, consulting, marital dissolution, taxation and estate and financial planning. Previously, he served as the Managing Partner at Robertson, Bailes and McClelland, LLP (1993 -2006) after the firm purchased the Shreveport office of BDO, where Mr. Robertson was Managing Partner for 11 years (1982 - 1993). In 1967, Mr. Robertson formed a Shreveport CPA firm with Henry C. Stewart. The firm of Stewart, Robertson & Co. continued until 1982, when it merged with BDO. Among other organizations, Mr. Robertson is a past president of the Society of Louisiana Certified Public Accountants, Ark-La-Tex Tax Institute, Shreveport Chapter, Society of Louisiana Certified Public Accountants, President’s Advisory Council of Centenary College and the Society of Financial Service Professionals. He currently serves as the Vice Chairman and a member of the Board of Trustees at Centenary College, as a member of the SLCPA Estate and Financial Planning Committee and as a member of the National Association of Certified Valuation Analysts. Mr. Robertson earned his BBA degree from Tulane University in New Orleans and his MBA from Centenary College, Shreveport.

W. HOWARD WOLF, Attorney and LLC Advisor. For more than 49 years, Howard Wolf practiced law with Fulbright & Jaworski LL.P. in Houston and Austin where he served a variety of clients in commercial law, corporate finance and aviation-related law. He also served on the board of many companies including Texas Air Corp. (subsequently Continental Airlines), Offshore Logistics (Chairman), Canadian Helicopters, Stewart & Stevenson Services and Simmons & Co. International. Mr. Wolf currently serves as Vice Chairman and a founder of Lobo Leasing, one of the largest helicopter leasing and operating firms in the world, with national and international offices. The Blackstone Group, through one of its affiliates, is the owner of Lobo Leasing and is the provider of substantial capital to the firm. Blackstone is one of the largest private equity firms in the world, with approximately $334 billion in Total Assets Under Management as of 6/30/2015. Mr. Wolf has also worked on a number of Texas state law initiatives including the Tax Reform Commission and the Texas Department of Transportation Restructure Council. Mr. Wolf is a graduate of the University of Texas at Austin and the University of Texas School of Law.

JOHN W. CONES, Attorney/Author/Lecturer, Counsel to LLC Manager.John Cones is a securities/entertainment attorney licensed to practice in the states of California and Texas. His primary area of expertise is federal and state securities compliance for entertainment oriented business plans, limited partnership, limited liability and corporate stock offerings providing financing for feature films, Internet companies, television pilots, live stage plays, documentaries and infomercials. Mr. Cones has worked in that area of the law for 23 years in Los Angeles and has participated in the production of the required disclosure documents for more than 260 securities offerings, including 165 film offerings. More than 58 independently produced feature and documentary films have been developed, produced or distributed as a result of those investor offerings. Mr. Cones has lectured on film finance topics throughout the United States and is currently conducting a national “film finance” lecture tour. He has authored nine books relating to the business and legal affairs side of the Hollywood-based U.S. film industry:Dictionary of Film Finance and Distribution – A Guide for Independent Filmmakers(Algora Publishing, 2013), Film Industry Contracts (self–published,1993), 43 Ways to Finance Your Feature Film, Third Edition (Southern Illinois University Press, 2007, The Feature Film Distribution Deal – A Critical Analysis of the Single Most Important Film Industry Agreement (SIUP, 1996), Hollywood Wars – How Insiders Gained and Maintain Illegitimate Control Over the Film Industry (Marquette Books, 2007), Introduction to the Motion Picture Industry – A Guide for Students, Filmmakers and Scholars (Marquette Books, 2008), Patterns of Bias in Hollywood Movies (Algora Publishing, 2012), Business Plans for Filmmakers (SIUP, 2010) and Motion Picture Biographies – The Hollywood Spin on Historical Figures (Algora Publishing, 2015). Mr. Cones has also authored more than 30 articles about film finance. The articles are posted online at his website (filmfinanceattorney.com). Mr. Cones is a graduate of the University of Texas at Austin (Bachelor of Science in Communications '67 and Doctor of Jurisprudence '74) and maintains his legal domicile in Austin, Texas while traveling on a national lecture tour on film finance for independent filmmaker groups.

    I salute you, kind sir, or madam as the case may be! Seriously, I can't thank you enough for watching, reading and considering. Now let's get to work, and together let's make Season 2 great.","So, what is this puppet thing, anyway?

So glad you asked. Hello, everyone! I'm Nicola Rose, producer of the webseries Callie & Izzy. In 2015, we shot and edited our Season 1, which we're now releasing one episode per week. It's exciting to see the views grow and hear people's reaction. More than anything, it's gratifying to know people are laughing, since that's the whole point!

I really enjoy being a webseries producer, and I want to tell more of this story in a Season 2. But in order to do that, I need your help to fund it. Your contributions will help us achieve all of the following:
The most important one: Pay, feed and transport our actors and crew, who have all donated immense time and effort to the series. You can read about them here.
Funds left over will go to:
Cover in part the cost of location rentals
Cover in part the cost of a consistent camera, to unify the filming look of Season 2
Enhancement of sound and lighting
Perks! Talk about perks!
Don't mind if I do. Here's how they break down:
Any contribution gets you a shout out on our website and all our social media. Like we'd keep quiet about you! (Unless you want us to, of course.)
$15 and up gets you the shout-out PLUS a customized Callie & Izzy thank you card with a personalized note.

$30 and up gets you the shout-out and the card PLUS a custom-made Callie & Izzy sticker. (Not one of those wussy teeny ones. We promise, we'll make it a good sticker. This is to make up for the fact you no longer get a sticker at the doctor as an adult, which seems just wrong.)
$50 and up gets you the shout-out, the card and the sticker PLUS a personalized video message from Callie and Izzy.
$75 and up gets you the shout-out, card, sticker, and video message PLUS a Callie & Izzy poster.
$100 and up gets you the shout-out, card, sticker, message and poster PLUS a  Callie & Izzy T-shirt.
$200 and up gets you the shout-out, card, sticker, message, poster and T-shirt PLUS your very own Izzy-style puppet. (Don't tell her
$500 and up gets you all of the above PLUS TWO puppets PLUS producer credit on all Season 2 episodes.

$1,000 and up gets you all of the above, PLUS we'll figure out a way to write you into an episode, PLUS executive producer credit on all Season 2 episodes. Heck, if you drop a grand on it, Izzy will knight you, which I understand is legal in some countries.
Other Ways You Can Help If you can't contribute, please take a moment to spread the Callie & Izzy word on social media!  Facebook: Callie & Izzy
Twitter: @izzy_puppet
Instagram: @callieandizzy

Official Website And last but not least, don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!   You Made It to the End! Thank You!I salute you, kind sir, or madam as the case may be! Help Dedicate the ""Women of the Class of 1980"" Room at the Historic Thayer Hotel at West Point 

In 1976 the first women entered West Point.  119 new cadets entered in the summer of 1976 and 62 graduated as Second Lieutenants in 1980.  This esteemed group of trailblazers, the ""Women of the Class of 1980"" have earned their place in history and are deserving of a room at the Historic Thayer Hotel.  

This room dedication effort is being led by the President of the Class of 1980, Bret Dalton.   When the room is dedicated it will be a great event that can be a mini-reunion.    It is hoped that this effort will be funded by men and women, grads and non-grads, to honor this group of graduates and their accomplishments.
column3: > April 28-30 at West Point to honor 40 years of women
column4: > at the Academies.  It is hoped that this room can be dedicated prior
column5:
> to that event so that all attendees can visit it.  

The Historic Thayer Hotel at West Point was built in 1926 and is one of our national treasures, located on the grounds of West Point, high above the banks of the Hudson River.   The 151 guest rooms of the hotel are being dedicated in honor of some of West Point's most famous graduates: Presidents,Generals, Astronauts, Medal of Honor recipients, CEOs, Governors and other distinguished leaders of character.    The program has been so successful it was even featured on a FOX News show that highlights the program:  FOX NEWS SHOW FEATURING THE ROOM DEDICATION PROGRAM

Over half the guest rooms have now been dedicated by families, friends, West Point classmates and corporations including  USAA, Pentagon Federal Credit Union, OshKosh, Remington, Jostens and the classes of 1959, 1960, 1964, 1965, 1974 and 1986.     

There are two steps to achieving a dedicated room:  first is a nomination and second is a sponsorship that allows the dedication to occur.  First, a Thayer Hotel committee chooses graduates who are worthy of a room nomination.  Out of 60,000 West Point graduates in history there are countless incredible leaders who have shaped our world.   There is certainly no way to provide a definitive list of the top 151 graduates.   Rather, this program seeks to honor a representative cross section from all aspects of inspirational leadership.  That list is several hundred graduates long, more than the number of rooms available. 

While most rooms are dedicated to individual graduates, there are a few exceptions to honor families of graduates or groups of graduates.   There is an Army Baseball Room, a 1953 Army Football team room and a 1958 Army Football Team room (The last undefeated Army football team).     The Women of the Class of 1980 are a unique group and deserve to be honored and thus the committee found  this group worthy of a room dedication and approved the nomination. It is important to raise these sponsorship to ensure ""The Women of the Class of 1980"" get their  room dedicated prior to all of the rooms being sponsored to other graduates.        

A list of the rooms that have been dedicated can be found here: List of Dedicated Rooms and Explanation of the Thayer Hotel Room Dedication Program

column1: • A plaque will go outside of the door with the highlighting the ""Women of the Class of 1980"" and many of their accomplishments.  The current photo of the plaque is only a mock-up,  the actual plaque will be edited be select members of the class.
• The room will be filled with photos and memorabilia chosen by the Class President Bret Dalton in cooperation with the Women in the Class.
• The room will be a permanent testament to the bravery, fortitude and impact  of the Women of 1980 and all of those who have followed.
In order to fund the room and conduct the ceremony
• Funds can be donated in any amount, from $1 to $45,000.
• Anyone donating more than $300 will receive two invitations to the dedication ceremony and their name will be listed as a donor in the room on a donor list, permanently on display.
• The first $5,000 raised will go to fund the dedication ceremony.
<li>The rooms are $25,000 for a standard room
column2: $35,000 for an Executive Suite and $45,000 for a Super Suite
column3: plus the $5,000 for the dedication ceremony (Party).    This fundraise is seeking to provide ""The Women of 1980"" with an Executive Suite ($35,000, plus $5,000, with 8% credit card and website fee for a total of $43,200).

column1: • The Sponsorship plaque will read  ""Proudly Sponsored by family, friends and classmates""

• If the funds are not completely raised through this site, private donors will be sought to complete the raise to ensure the room is dedicated.  So all funds donated will be accepted.   There is a 5% fee for this site and a 3% credit card processing fee, so the raise is 8% higher than needed in order to accommodate.  If more funds are raised above and beyond the executive suite, those funds will go towards the dedication of other West Point Special Operations leaders as determined by the management of the Thayer Hotel.

Other Classes Have Already Done This

Several other West Point classes have already led the effort to raise the funds for their classmates rooms.   These include: 

1959:  The Class of 1959 has dedicated several rooms including the 1958 Football Room  (which was the last undefeated Army football team),  the Captain Rocky Versace Room (POW/MIA/KIA/Medal of Honor) and several others.  

1960:  This class dedicated the Colonel Nick Rowe room.

1974:  This class dedicated the room to General Martin Dempsey while he was the Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff. 

1986:   This class dedicated two rooms: Joe DePinto, CEO of 7-Eleven and Steve Cannon, CEO Mercedes-Benz USA.
There are several other classes who have contributed to the 80 dedicated rooms and who are currently organizing their planned class dedicated rooms for their most successful graduates.
The Impact

Thus far the Historic Thayer Hotel has 80 rooms dedicated out of a total of 151 rooms in the hotel.  The remainder will likely be dedicated by the end of 2016.  The dedication ceremony for ""West Point Women of 1980"" is currently planned for spring 2016 if the funds are raised.
<ul>
• By donating you will be helping to ensure the millions of guests who visit West Point will remember the Women of the Class of 1980 and those who have been inspired by them.

• You can currently visit the Thayer Hotel to see other rooms and stay in rooms dedicated to Buzz Aldrin, BG Becky Halstead, Henry O. Flipper (1st African-American graduate of West Point) and other amazing graduates.

• Future cadet candidates, men and women, can come to visit West Point and be inspired by the leadership shown by these women and understand the opportunities afforded to them if they are accepted into West Point are limitless.
<h3>Risks &amp

The Thayer Hotel management team has already raised the funds to dedicate 80 rooms out of the 151 rooms in the hotel.   They are rapidly dedicating the remaining rooms.  If this and other fundraising efforts are not successful for this particular room, then the Women of the Class of 1980 will not be honored in a way that they deserve.
There currently is only one room sponsored to honor a female graduate:  BG Rebecca Halstead, USMA 1981.  There are several other rooms that have been nominated and are seeking sponsors including:
<ul>

Other Ways You Can Help
<ul>
• If you can contribute, thank you for making history!  If you cannot contribute, please help get the word out!
• This is not a tax deductible contribution and should be considered in a similar way to sponsorship of the naming of a stadium or building.
• Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

Summary of the Documentary

column5: >Our film has been focused on the only Rehabilitation centre in Kobane. We have followed a great man, Dr. Dorpec Kobane as he helps heal the wounded soldiers of the YPG and YPJ, along with his assistants. These young men and women have fought on the front lines against Daesh (ISIS) and suffered terrible wounds because of it - many having been shot in the head and survived. After two trips and two months in Kobane, Syria, the crew has finalized production on ""This is Kobane"". It has been a trying time dealing with the emotional and psychological toll of living in a warzone. We have laughed, we have cried, and we have been witness the workings of a revolutionary political system.

column1:
As they come together each day, the revolution they fought for can be seen through their interactions. This is the only revolution in the Middle East that puts women's equality and empowerment to the forefront of its goals.

What We Need &
column2:
What You Get

Most of production was self funded. Because of this we are in urgent need of funding to begin editing this documentary. While our goal is humble, it would allow us to begin the post-production phase and enable us to continue working full time on this project while scouting for further funding.

column1: Any and every contribution is helpful to our project. In donating money to this campaign, not only will you be helping finalize an independent documentary, you will also be participating in sharing the realities of the Kurdish people with the world.
You actively become a member of global change.
$10 gives you one digital copy of the completed film.
$20 gives you one digital copy of of the completed film as well as a digital photo of Kobane, taken by the crew, of your choosing. (We will provide sampler images upon completion of the campaign).
$50 gives you one digital copy of the completed film, a digital photo of your choosing, as well as a post card photo print with a personalized thank you note from the crew.

$75 gives you one digital copy of the completed film, a digital photo of your choosing, a post card print photo, as well as a hard copy DVD of the film with a personalized thank you note from the crew.

$100 gives you one digital copy of the completed film, a digital photo of your choosing, a post card print photo, a hard copy of the DVD, a kuffiyah (Kurdish scarf) bought in Syrian Kurdistan (limited to the first 20 donations of either $100, $500, or $1000) bearing the colours of Rojava, as well as a thank you in the credits of the film.

$500 gives you one digital copy of the completed film, a digital photo of your choosing, a post card print photo, a hard copy of the DVD, a kuffiyah (first 20 donations of either $100, $500, or $1000), a special thank you in the credits of the film, as well as 2 reserved seats to the audience participation screenings in Montreal and Toronto.

$1000 gives you one digital copy of the completed film, a digital photo of your choosing, a post card print photo, a hard copy of the DVD, a kuffiyah (first 20 donations of either $100, $500, or $1000), a special thank you in the credits of the film, 2 reserved seats to the audience participation screenings in Montreal and Toronto, as well as a photo print (12"" x 18"") of your choosing.

Other Ways You Can Help

Being independent filmmakers, we understand that it is not possible for everyone to give a financial contribution to the project.
Actively sharing this project on social media is just as important as financial aid.
We therefore invite you to like our facebook page: This is Kobane, to share updates on the film and news posted on our page.

This film is being created to raise awareness about the Rojava revolution and the realities on the ground in Syrian Kurdistan. By helping spread awareness on social media, you actively become a participant of global change.
