0,"<div class=""routerContentStory-storyBody"" data-v-1df7bf5a=""""><div> <h3><span style=""color: rgb(106, 106, 106)

Birds is a honest love story. The story we all know of two people that are very much in love, yet have no way of finding complete happiness in each other. 

Story 

""I wished you were smaller so I could put you inside of me.

A tiny version of you was the only thing that would fit where my heart had been.

Otherwise I would have nothing.""

- ""Timmy Reed""

Sadie is wholly in love with Alice, so much so, she doesn't need anything else. Alice unfortunately doesn't feel the same kind of fullness. And when Sadie accidentally frees the lovebirds living in Alice's chest, she is left utterly empty. Alice soon falls into a deep depression. Stricken by guilt, Sadie goes out in search of something that will replace the lovebirds and restore Alice.

Born in Atlanta, Georgia, Saeedah developed as a storyteller through immersed in the black arts scene. After gaining her BA in communications from St. John’s University, Saeedah spent some time at BET and Loki Films working in casting, development, and production management. Her work focuses on telling female and minority narratives in new, engaging and multi-layered ways.
Director:
Bubba Murray is a writer and director based in Chicago, known for his work on McTucky Fried High (2015).
<span style=""font-weight: normal
column2:
>Why Is This Story Important?

While developing this film, something became painfully clear from my research. I can probably count the number of fantasy films with characters of color on one hand. It’s true. Try it. Name five fantasy movies where most of the cast are people of color? It’s hard, and that’s because of the convention that minority characters should only play certain roles in certain type of films. You see what they did to Rue?

Birds breaks this convention, placing two minority queer in the center of a fantastic dystopian future. Birds will transport the viewers to a world that's magical, surreal and embellished with cultural nuance.
column3:
>What Your Contributions Will Achieve!

Contributions = Collaboration and Creation. Directly contributing to this film means you directly have a hand in helping the project come to life. As a contributor, you have power. You help make the films you want to see
column4:
which most likely are the films that Hollywood won’t create. You help empower artist. You create.

Birds is an extremely important story to us, and with your contributions, you’ll be empowering us to tell it the way it deserves to be told.

What We Will Your Contributions Go To?
column5:
>Send Love. Spread Love.

It's all love. Even if you can't contribute, you can still collaborate. By supporting, spreading the word, and boosting this campaign to all those who you love.

Be sure to follow us at http://birdsashortfilm.tumblr.com/

News Flash
Dan Tambling Comedy has invested £5,000 into the project and with support from a previous Indiegogo Campaign, we now only need £2,500. Thank you for your support. 

What is it?

‘12 Sketches In A London House’ is exactly that, 12 sketches in a London house. It's an online series, so FREE for everyone to enjoy, and there are loads of ways to get involved.

Each of the 12 sketches is set in a different room as the series explores various everyday life scenarios made hilarious. The exciting part is that each area, however big or small, has to be used for a sketch and each sketch can only use that room or area. The areas are
column2:
1. ATTIC
2. LOUNGE
3. KITCHEN
4. DINING  (Script writing competition, see below)
5. GARDEN  (Script writing competition, see below)
6. UNDER-STAIRS (Script writing competition, see below)
7. BEDROOM
8. GUEST (bed)
9. BATHROOM
10. LANDING
11. ENTRANCE
12. HOUSE (whole)

See the pilot episode here!
column3: >12 sketches in a London House was inspired by an
column4: >uncontrollable desire to make people laugh
column7:
>.

On top of that, this series gives aspiring actors and writers opportunities to get involved in what promises to be a great laugh, and therefore an even better platform for their careers.

Clapper board getting prepared for the First Take 

Script Writers Wanted! 

The series will be promoted by the British Comedy Guide, and THREE out of the 12 sketches’ scripts are up for grabs. This means any three publicly submitted scripts have potential to be developed and filmed as part of a series to be watched by thousands! 

Each Winning Script Will Receive £250 Prize Money!
And lots more.....www.dantamblingcomedy.com/scripts

column1: The scripts must be 3 minutes long max and are for the following sketch locations
column2:
Dining Room, Under-Stairs Cupboard or Garden. Please read through all the rules www.dantamblingcomedy.com/scripts

To enter the script competition, please purchase the £5 'Script Entry' PERK or
column6:
> will get FEEDBACK too!

After that, please submit your script/s on my website at www.dantamblingcomedy.com/scripts - please use either CELTX (a free script writing package) or Final Draft to format your script correctly.

DEADLINE 15th FEB 2016!

A script prepped ready with the Directors notes.

Other Ways You Can Help
It’s an online series, so is completely free to enjoy. So if you can’t help contribute, please pass it on, or even subscribe to my Youtube Channel.
Use the Indiegogo share tools to help us get the word out. We would be delighted if you would!
Hayley-Marie Axe (Guest Director) on set, shooting the hilarious 'ATTIC' sketch with Marcin BilSki (DoP) and Ben Keenan (Guest Actor)

HOUSE (whole)See the pilot episode here! 12 sketches in a London House was inspired by an uncontrollable desire to make people laugh, and a passion for helping other creatives.On top of that, this series gives aspiring actors and writers opportunities to get involved in what promises to be a great laugh, and therefore an even better platform for their careers.Clapper board getting prepared for the First Take Script Writers Wanted! The series will be promoted by the British Comedy Guide, and THREE out of the 12 sketches’ scripts are up for grabs. This means any three publicly submitted scripts have potential to be developed and filmed as part of a series to be watched by thousands! Each Winning Script Will Receive £250 Prize Money!And lots more.....www.dantamblingcomedy.com/scripts

column1: The scripts must be 3 minutes long max and are for the following sketch locations
column2: Dining Room, Under-Stairs Cupboard or Garden. Please read through all the rules www.dantamblingcomedy.com/scriptsTo enter the script competition, please purchase the £5 'Script Entry' PERK or £10 'Send 3 Scripts' PERK and every script will get FEEDBACK too!After that, please submit your script/s on my website at www.dantamblingcomedy.com/scripts - please use either CELTX (a free script writing package) or Final Draft to format your script correctly.DEADLINE 15th FEB 2016!A script prepped ready with the Directors notes.Cast

column1: Dan Tambling & Lynsey McQuaid
Plus brilliant guest actors
Adam Willis, Amy Finegan, Ben Keenan, Hayley-Marie Axe, Jak Ford Lane, Johnny Hansler, Nickie Kelly, Sydnee Howard and many more.

Where the Money stuff will be usedWe need £9,500 to produce the full 12 sketches. Each sketch is around 3 minutes long and therefore costs approximately £900Here is a break down of the budget (so you know exactly where the money will be spent) in a pie chart because everyone loves a pie chart
The web series will be professionally produced and published on YouTube for
everyone’s future viewing and Promoted through the British Comedy Guide too.
All crowd funders are eligible to receive SPECIAL PERKS, of which you can see on the side.
Other Ways You Can Help
It’s an online series, so is completely free to enjoy. So if you can’t help contribute, please pass it on, or even subscribe to my Youtube Channel.
Use the Indiegogo share tools to help us get the word out. We would be delighted if you would!
Hayley-Marie Axe (Guest Director) on set, shooting the hilarious 'ATTIC' sketch with Marcin BilSki (DoP) and Ben Keenan (Guest Actor)

Completing this film will prove that the Houston area is capable of producing great quality work by students for the people. There is only three of us creating this film and we’re giving only four months to produce this short. So time is very limited by the opportunity is huge. He has created another short film called “A Love Story.” Also recently has done Asst. Directing on “Streets of Harvest,” which is submitting in Film Festivals as we speak. Short Summary

My name is Karl Heinz Schilling III and I am the writer/director of ""The Mephistopheles"".  I have been practicing cinematography for 7 years, mainly working on projects for local musicians directing music videos.  Throughout the years, I always knew that I would be writing and directing my first film eventually.  I've had plenty of screenplays written but none that really ""hit home"".  I wanted my first film to affect people whether it be positively or negatively.  ""The Mephistopheles is going to do just that.  This film is going to question the fine line of good and evil deep within every human individual, including yourself.  It is going to make its viewers question the morality of the individuals closest to them, but more importantly, their own.  Out of the generosity of our cast and production crew, we were able to film just enough scenes to produce two small teaser trailers of the film.  Based off of those trailers and a small sipnosis , we have already been accepted to screen our film at numerous film festivals throughout New Jersey and Pennsylvania, once the film is complete.  Your support is vital to our projects success.

In the mid 1990's, a man named Christopher Nolan developed a small budget amongst friends, family, and sponsors.  With his personal camera, he wrote and directed a film starring some of his friends and family.  With nothing but a strong story, passion, and a vision, he created this film for it to go on winning numerous awards and grossing over 250,000 dollars.  Ten years later, the same man went on to co-write and direct The Dark Knight Trilogy.  Our team share the same common goals and posses that same passion and talent.  With our strong story, passion, and vision, we plan to achieve that same goal with one difference.  Our film is a ""non profit"" production with all proceeds being donated to charities that help the same cause that the film touches on.  Your much needed assistance is going to go directly to the cause for: essential post production hardware and cast compensation.  NOTE: None of the production crew, including myself, will be financially gaining from this film.  This is our passion project.  With your contributions, you will receive credited appreciation at the end of the film listed before any cast and production credits.  The contributors credits will be listed in the order of their generosity starting with the greatest.

The Impact

Every dollar earned will be equally donated to certain charities that are touched on in the film.  Non profit organizations to battle drug addiction and mental illness will be the profiteers of this film.  Our team is as passionate about bettering our community as we are filmmaking and thats exactly what motivates this film.

column2: >""The Mephistopheles"" is going to be a controversial piece, however it is a controversial piece with an outstanding message and a more important cause.  Our biggest risk is that our audience could overlook the films message because of its controversial visuals, however whatever is controversial will be discussed amongst film fanatics and that only supports our main cause.  Even if the worst case scenario comes about and our message isn't comprehended, we have still succeeded with our donations to organizations that NEED it.

column1:
Other Ways You Can Help

As writer and director of this project, I sincerely hope that you can come aboard and support the cause.  With your contribution, you aren't just supporting a film project, but a project that is going to be beneficiary to so many people that need it more than you and me.  Please email your name and email to m8g8zin3@gmail.com once your contribution is made to be listed in the final credits of the film unless you choose to remain ""unlisted"".    We sincerely appreciate your generosity and your hard earned dollar is going to bring this project to life.  Also, please be sure to get the word out to any other possible contributors by using the Indiegogo share tool.

column13:
>  Boulder Neighbors  Livable Boulder

_____________________________________________________________________________

The time to vote is quickly approaching for the 2015 Boulder City Council Election. I am requesting your support to make it to the finish line.  I offer unflinching approaches for tackling our most difficult challenges.

column1: I urge you to donate to my campaign ($100 maximum allowed per person) so that I can advertise in local print publications in order to give exposure to the critical issues listed below:
• Enabling the people to mindfully control growth and development rather than letting growth and development control us
• Preserving affordable housing  for middle- and lower-income families
• Meeting our climate change action goals
ENDORSEMENTS INCLUDE:
<ul>
• Sierra Club
• PLAN Boulder County
• Livable Boulder
<li>
Boulder Neighbors
LEARN MORE:

Boulder’s growth and development policies conflict with other core community concerns such as flooding, carbon emissions reduction, housing affordability, reducing traffic congestion, and preserving our iconic mountain backdrop views.  It is my goal to reconcile these conflicts.
I will work to:
<ul>
• Ensure that new development pays for the additional burdens it imposes on City services and facilities so that it pays its own way rather than being subsidized by the taxpayer
• Ensure that growth and development do not force current community members out of Boulder and do not erode the characteristics that make it special
• Support neighborhood vision plans that guide development in their vicinities and require that local area plans be adopted as prerequisites to land use changes in those areas
• Implement community wide EcoPass
Affordability

People should be able to live in the community they help build. Affordable housing allows our neighbors - from teachers to firefighters to designers to musicians – to spend their money in the city where they earn it.  But our policies are causing the exclusion of entire classes of people.  That’s not good for us, and it’s not right.
I will work to:
<ul>
• Expand affordable housing options for middle- and low-income families
• Preserve existing affordable housing

• Increase opportunities for alternative housing choices including Accessories Dwelling Units, Owner Accessories Units (in-law suites) and group houses when permanent affordability is ensured, there are clearly defined parameters, and there is significant input by affected neighborhoods
Climate Change

Boulder’s carbon footprint is simply too high, and it’s growing. For all of the community’s talk of sustainability and environment, we are actually increasing our per capita carbon emissions impact faster than rest of the nation.  Our failure to act forcefully now has dramatic implications for future generations.
I will work to:
<ul>
• Implement policies that get us on track to reduce greenhouse gas emissions 80% below 2005 levels by 2050.
• Ensure that Boulder decarbonizes its electricity supply to the maximum extent possible.
• Equitably allocate the costs of carbon emissions to encourage the changes from business as usual that will be necessary to achieve our emission reduction goals.
Thank you in advance for supporting me in these final laps of my run for Boulder City Council Council!  And remember,  JUST SAY MAY!

column2:
>

Thank you so much to those who donated to THE FALLEN STATE campaign to fund our first season. We raised over $10,000 in 1 month. To help us fund the other nearly $30,000 needed, please donate directly to Jesse Lee Peterson's nonprofit, BOND, a 25-years-strong national nonprofit dedicated to ""Rebuilding the family by rebuilding the man.""

column1: (Our set, stage, lighting, and camera-work have been done in-house as much as possible by BOND staff and supporters, offering their own time, effort, and expertise, to make your donations go a long way.)
Give us a call to check availability of any unclaimed ""perks"" for donating to support THE FALLEN STATE web series with Jesse Lee Peterson. Call BOND at 1-800-411-BOND (that's 1-800-411-2663).

column2: >Tim Solliday is a well-known landscape and figure painter. His works have appeared in numerous prestigious group exhibitions. Tim's paintings are in the collections of important Amercan and Western art enthusiasts--even Oprah has a Tim Solliday original! Tim's work is often featured in national publications. Art and Antiques referred to Tim as ""one of the top contemporary plein-air artists.""
column4: >And Tim is a friend of BOND! Our cause of ""Rebuilding the Family by Rebuilding the Man"" is dear to his heart.

column2: >Tim is donating Limited Edition Prints of two of his works to our crowdfunding campaign, which needs to raise $40,000 to fund Season 1 of THE FALLEN STATE Web TV series.
>Starting Tuesday 12/8/15 at 8 AM Pacific Time, Tim's works are available at our campaign site through Thursday or until they sell out.
column4: >See THE FALLEN STATE Host Jesse Lee Peterson speaking with Tim about this exclusive offering!

column2: >Just one print is available of ""Desert Wind"", a 9 1/4"" x 9 1/4"" work, which includes a frame. For a contribution to our campaign of $950, you can have this print for yourself, or make it an amazing Christmas present for a family member or friend.
>And just three prints are available of ""Standing Tall,"" a 14 1/4"" x 8 1/2"" work, and includes a special drawing by the artist. For a contribution of $800, you can have one of these rare prints.
>These are exceptional deals. Tim's work is very hard to come by. When he creates work, it goes fast.

column1: Make a contribution, and choose your ""Perk""--the Tim Solliday print of your choice. But don't wait. Only four prints total are available. Support Season 1 of THE FALLEN STATE with Jesse Lee Peterson Web TV series. This Web series will explore--through in-depth interviews, as well as audience and viewer interaction--just what this state is, the many manifestations of it, and how to break its spell over us.

And whether you decide to contribute and get a great Limited Edition Print, or if you just want to help us bring an exciting new show that has the potential to change numerous lives worldwide, please contribute to our crowdfunding campaign to fund Season 1 of THE FALLEN STATE Web TV series. 

Thank you for your support!
THE FALLEN STATE Team
Short Summary
99% of human beings--male and female, young and old, black and white-- are living in the FALLEN STATE and don't even know it.

This Web series will explore--through no-holds-barred interviews with both known and previously unknown guests--just what this state is, the many manifestations of it, and how to break its spell over us.

For the past twenty five years, I've run an organization dedicated to rebuilding families by rebuilding men in Los Angeles. We've had some amazing breakthroughs, and changed countless lives--all without accepting one dime from the government!

We've operated a home for boys, offered counseling to individuals and families, spoken to audiences nationwide, organized protests and rallies, started a leadership academy for young people, and aired a thought-provoking radio show.
I've done thousands of interviews, some with major networks such as Fox News Channel, CNN, MSNBC, and others. But there's a limit to what I can say on TV.
There won't be a limit on my new series.

column2: >THE FALLEN STATE is my upcoming original online talk show.

column1: A cutting-edge, top-notch, totally original production, THE FALLEN STATE will go where no talk show has gone before--into exploring a state few speak of, and almost no one understands.
We will air in-depth interviews, dealing with the exact nature of this state of mind that causes human beings to commit any and every act imaginable.
And for those who have the desire to live free--THE FALLEN STATE will open the curtain to show the way out!
What We Need
<h3><span style=""font-size: 16px
column4: >We need to raise $40,000 to finish pre-production, production, post production, and airing of the program for Season 1 (13 episodes), which includes:

<li><span style=""letter-spacing: 0px
<li><span style=""letter-spacing: 0px
<li><span style=""letter-spacing: 0px

<li><span style=""letter-spacing: 0px
<li>
<span style=""letter-spacing: 0px

If for any reason we do not reach our entire goal, funds will go toward creating at least a pilot episode, though, shooting and airing an entire season is what we need to do to make a serious impact on our world.
The Impact

column3: >THE FALLEN STATE needs to be seen by every person in America and worldwide. Through it, the

column1: What are my credentials to host such a show?
I'm the author of the brand new book, The Antidote: Healing America From the Poison of Hate, Blame, and Victimhood.
My nonprofit organization has successfully aired a national radio show for over a decade, producing 15 hours of unique, entertaining, invaluable content every week.
We have hosted six Annual Conferences on Fatherhood &
column2: Men, which we have videotaped and produced.

column1: We have transformed the lives of thousands of men and their families.
Risks &

We are risking much to bring THE FALLEN STATE to the web. We're investing hundreds of hours of hard work, purchasing needed equipment and services, and betting big that the world is ready to see a presentation that will bring illumination, and ultimately freedom, to viewers worldwide.

Other Ways You Can Help

We fully understand there there will be some who--though they love the idea of THE FALLEN STATE web talk show--just cannot afford to contribute financially. But you can always spread the word! Become a FALLEN STATE Ambassador! Help us spread this crowdfunding campaign everywhere.

Be sure to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you so much for being a part of our campaign. We welcome you, and look forward to successfully reaching our $40,000 goal together. The world has never seen a show like THE FALLEN STATE. I believe we will make history together!


","Thank you so much to those who donated to THE FALLEN STATE campaign to fund our first season. We raised over $10,000 in 1 month. To help us fund the other nearly $30,000 needed, please donate directly to Jesse Lee Peterson's nonprofit, BOND, a 25-years-strong national nonprofit dedicated to ""Rebuilding the family by rebuilding the man.""

(Our set, stage, lighting, and camera-work have been done in-house as much as possible by BOND staff and supporters, offering their own time, effort, and expertise, to make your donations go a long way.)

Give us a call to check availability of any unclaimed ""perks"" for donating to support THE FALLEN STATE web series with Jesse Lee Peterson. Call BOND at 1-800-411-BOND (that's 1-800-411-2663). Limited Edition Print Offering

Tim Solliday is a well-known landscape and figure painter. His works have appeared in numerous prestigious group exhibitions. Tim's paintings are in the collections of important Amercan and Western art enthusiasts--even Oprah has a Tim Solliday original! Tim's work is often featured in national publications. Art and Antiques referred to Tim as ""one of the top contemporary plein-air artists.""And Tim is a friend of BOND! Our cause of ""Rebuilding the Family by Rebuilding the Man"" is dear to his heart.
Tim is donating Limited Edition Prints of two of his works to our crowdfunding campaign, which needs to raise $40,000 to fund Season 1 of THE FALLEN STATE Web TV series.

Starting Tuesday 12/8/15 at 8 AM Pacific Time, Tim's works are available at our campaign site through Thursday or until they sell out.See THE FALLEN STATE Host Jesse Lee Peterson speaking with Tim about this exclusive offering!

Just one print is available of ""Desert Wind"", a 9 1/4"" x 9 1/4"" work, which includes a frame. For a contribution to our campaign of $950, you can have this print for yourself, or make it an amazing Christmas present for a family member or friend.
And just three prints are available of ""Standing Tall,"" a 14 1/4"" x 8 1/2"" work, and includes a special drawing by the artist. For a contribution of $800, you can have one of these rare prints.
These are exceptional deals. Tim's work is very hard to come by. When he creates work, it goes fast.

Make a contribution, and choose your ""Perk""--the Tim Solliday print of your choice. But don't wait. Only four prints total are available. Support Season 1 of THE FALLEN STATE with Jesse Lee Peterson Web TV series. This Web series will explore--through in-depth interviews, as well as audience and viewer interaction--just what this state is, the many manifestations of it, and how to break its spell over us.

And whether you decide to contribute and get a great Limited Edition Print, or if you just want to help us bring an exciting new show that has the potential to change numerous lives worldwide, please contribute to our crowdfunding campaign to fund Season 1 of THE FALLEN STATE Web TV series. Thank you for your support!
THE FALLEN STATE Team
Short Summary My name is Jesse Lee Peterson.
99% of human beings--male and female, young and old, black and white-- are living in the FALLEN STATE and don't even know it.

This Web series will explore--through no-holds-barred interviews with both known and previously unknown guests--just what this state is, the many manifestations of it, and how to break its spell over us.

For the past twenty five years, I've run an organization dedicated to rebuilding families by rebuilding men in Los Angeles. We've had some amazing breakthroughs, and changed countless lives--all without accepting one dime from the government!

We've operated a home for boys, offered counseling to individuals and families, spoken to audiences nationwide, organized protests and rallies, started a leadership academy for young people, and aired a thought-provoking radio show.
I've done thousands of interviews, some with major networks such as Fox News Channel, CNN, MSNBC, and others. But there's a limit to what I can say on TV.
There won't be a limit on my new series.
THE FALLEN STATE is my upcoming original online talk show.
A cutting-edge, top-notch, totally original production, THE FALLEN STATE will go where no talk show has gone before--into exploring a state few speak of, and almost no one understands.
We will air in-depth interviews, dealing with the exact nature of this state of mind that causes human beings to commit any and every act imaginable.
And for those who have the desire to live free--THE FALLEN STATE will open the curtain to show the way out!
What We Need
We need to raise $40,000 to finish pre-production, production, post production, and airing of the program for Season 1 (13 episodes), which includes:
Production Crew
Cameras (including an audience camera)
Camera stands
Lighting
Rigging
Power cords and accessories
Wireless microphone system
Hardware
Noise reduction
Stage furniture
Wardrobe
Internet Hosting
Advertising and Marketing

If for any reason we do not reach our entire goal, funds will go toward creating at least a pilot episode, though, shooting and airing an entire season is what we need to do to make a serious impact on our world.
The Impact

THE FALLEN STATE needs to be seen by every person in America and worldwide. Through it, the viewer will recognize a state of mind that runs the world, and indeed, they may even recognize a state of mind that is running them! The impact of awakening to this reality cannot be overstated, for it has the power to change the world.
What are my credentials to host such a show?
I'm the author of the brand new book, The Antidote: Healing America From the Poison of Hate, Blame, and Victimhood.
My nonprofit organization has successfully aired a national radio show for over a decade, producing 15 hours of unique, entertaining, invaluable content every week.
We have hosted six Annual Conferences on Fatherhood & Men, which we have videotaped and produced.
We have transformed the lives of thousands of men and their families.
Risks & Challenges

We are risking much to bring THE FALLEN STATE to the web. We're investing hundreds of hours of hard work, purchasing needed equipment and services, and betting big that the world is ready to see a presentation that will bring illumination, and ultimately freedom, to viewers worldwide.

Other Ways You Can Help We fully understand there there will be some who--though they love the idea of THE FALLEN STATE web talk show--just cannot afford to contribute financially. But you can always spread the word! Become a FALLEN STATE Ambassador! Help us spread this crowdfunding campaign everywhere.

Be sure to use the Indiegogo share tools!  Thank you so much for being a part of our campaign. We welcome you, and look forward to successfully reaching our $40,000 goal together. The world has never seen a show like THE FALLEN STATE. I believe we will make history together!",3.0,0,"2 Campaigns

“Departure” es un drama que narra la historia de Morgan, una presa condenada a muerte, que se enfrenta al reto de ser cuestionada por su conciencia en los últimos momentos en su celda, antes de ser ejecutada. La historia muestra el proceso por el cual pasa una mujer al debatir la decisión que cambió su vida por completo y las consecuencias que eso ha conllevado.
Desde hace muchos años me ha llamado la atención el proceso
de hacer una película, por lo que hace tiempo, decidí invertir en aprenderlo
por mi misma para poder hacer mis propios proyectos. <b>Actualmente estudio la maestría en dirección y producción de cine en
Los Ángeles. He disfrutado de manera increíble el estar aquí. He aprendido muchísimo en cuanto a
producción, dirección, escritura de un guión, cinematografía y edición, y ha
llegado el momento de realizar mi tesis, la cual por supuesto es escrita y
dirigida por mi.
Siempre me ha interesado como trabaja la psicología en el ser humano así que me surgió la
inquietud de explorar esta cuestión en una situación excepcional.
<b>Vivimos en una sociedad que emana
violencia y que hace que las mujeres se sientan atrapadas, por lo que
ocasionalmente reaccionan devolviendo lo que se les da. Sin embargo, <b>muchas veces es muy fácil para nosotros
juzgar sin saber la verdad, así que los invito a profundizar en este
cortometraje con nosotros.
Hacer cine tiene
mucho que ver con trabajo en equipo y colaboración. Contamos con un
equipo excelente, apasionado y dispuesto a dar lo mejor de si, sin embargo existen
infinidad de gastos a tomar en cuenta al momento de hacer una película y para
nosotros, siendo estudiantes, la adquisición del dinero resulta complicada. <b>Por eso les pido su ayuda para poder
hacer de este sueño una realidad.
Desde el inicio ha habido mucho apoyo y muy buena respuesta
por lo que sabemos que este caso no será la excepción. <b>Cada una de sus aportaciones, no importa el monto que sea, es muy valiosa. Todo el que contribuya recibirá agradecimiento especial en los
créditos del cortometraje.
Con su contribución económica, fundamental para lo que
promete ser un cortometraje excepcional, se logrará cubrir costos de producción
como:
<ul>
• Pago de locación
• Permisos
• Seguros

Estaremos grabando la semana del 23 al 29 de Octubre del
2015, por lo que sus donaciones serán de vital importancia para poder cumplir
el objetivo.
Otra forma de apoyar es compartiéndolo con todos tus conocidos para que ellos a su vez puedan
formar parte de este gran proyecto.
De verdad no tienen
idea de lo que significa poder contar con su apoyo. Hemos trabajado
bastante y lo seguiremos haciendo para alcanzar el éxito. No los defraudaremos.
“Departure” is a drama, which tells the story of Morgan, a death row prisoner, challenged by
her conscience in the last moments in her cell before execution. The story
shows the process a woman goes
through when she happens to debate one decision that changed her life
completely and the consequences this
entails.
I’ve always had a profound interest in the process of
making a movie, which is why I decided to invest in learning how to do it so I
can create my own projects<b>. I’m
currently studying a Master of Fine Arts in Film and Media Production in Los
Angeles. I have really enjoyed being here. I have learned a lot in terms of producing, directing, screenwriting,
cinematography and editing, and now it’s time to do my thesis, which of
course is written and directed by me.
I’ve always been interested in psychology
and how it works in the human brain, so I decided to explore this matter in
an exceptional situation.
We live in a society
that emanates violenceand a society that makes women feel trapped,
forcing them occasionally, to give back what is given to them. However,<b>it is easy for
us to judge without knowing the truth, so I would like to invite you to
go deeper into this short film.
Filmmaking is
all about teamwork and collaboration. We have an excellent team,
passionate and willing to give their best, however there are plenty of expenses
to consider while making a movie, and for us, as students, the acquisition of
money can be complicated. <b>That’s why I am askingfor your help, so that we can make this
dream a reality.
Since the beginning, everybody has been very
supportive and we’ve had a very good response so we know that this case will not
be an exception. <b>Every single donation,
no matter the amount, is really appreciated. Everyone who contributes will
receive special thanks in the credits of the film.
With your
vital economic contribution, to what promises to be an outstanding short film, we will be able
to cover production costs such as:

of October 2015, so your donations will be crucial to accomplish the objective.

this amazing project.
You have no
idea what it means to have your support. We have worked hard and we will
continue to do so achieving the success this movie deserves. We won’t let you
down.

Jennifer Dinoia(Producer/director): Jennifer has produced and directed 4 full length theatre productions that merge dance, theatre and juggling. She studied theatre and modern dance at U.C. Berkeley. Now based in San Francisco, she is excited to co-create in New York once again.

To see videos by Angie Pearl Productions please search Youtube.

 Trio will be a three minute short set to the music of Lux Moderna. We have an extremely talented cast dancers (Miriam Barbosa, former Graham Company dancer) and juggler extraordinaire Jacob D'Eustachio. The seed of the project was to play, rehearse and make new art: to push the boundaries of what is possible in the art of juggling. As a dancer and choreographer, Jenn Dinoia  merges  the two art forms so viewers can see how dance can be enhanced with props and jugglers can move with grace. Our team is excited to be able to show the work to more people via the world wide web. Thank you for your support.

Your support will help primarily in:

-transportation

-housing

-paying the cast and crew

-materials

-editing costs

-food

-miscallaneous

Seedboms are the friendly bombs that grow. Join forces with nature to transform unloved spaces with a blast of life and colour!
Made from recycled paper and embedded with an explosive mix of organic peat-free compost and wildflower/herb seeds, Seedboms are the weapons of choice for Guerrilla Gardeners.
""Seedboms put the power to beautify into the hands of everyone.""

Guerrilla gardening is 'the act of gardening on land that the gardeners do not have the legal rights to utilise, such as an abandoned site, an area that is not being cared for, or private property.' (wikipedia)
'A covert unauthorised planting of flora or crops in a public location.'(dictionary)

It can also be described as 'subversive gardening'. A kind of responsible rebellion. Simply put Guerrilla Gardeners are individuals or groups of people who take it upon themselves to improve areas they don't own with plant life. This can be done traditionally with forks and flowers or by seed bombing (the ideal solution for quick insurrections and for growing on those hard to reach places).

Most of who live in the city will find there are lots of places that could use a little colour in the form of flowers. It's easy to miss these sites but when you start looking for them you'll be amazed just how much potential there is out there. Next time you travel across a city, be it on your walk to work, driving along a dull motorway or commuting on the train, keep your eyes peeled for these areas full of Guerrilla Gardening potential.
Examples of places in need of Guerrilla Gardening / seed bombing:
Guerrilla Gardening and seed bombing in action:

column3: >We are Kabloom and we've been in the Seedbom making business for almost 5 years.

column4: > in the past selling our product and so why c

column5: >Traditionally we made all our Seedboms by hand, working every hour we could to meet customer demand.
column7: >Basically we couldn't keep up! A great problem to have, yes, however we needed to make a change in order to meet the demand and move the business forward.

column4: > this? Through research, development, re-design, materials and manufacture sourcing, increased manufacture capability
column5: > and a good helping of innovation.

column3: >With Seedbom 2.0 we are now well on the way to having the capability to meet the market demand for our product. Although the final result has the same function (that was never in question) we have fully re-designed the product in order to allow for larger scale manufacture without compromising on our values and material sourcing policy. In fact by taking the time to redevelop the product we've managed to streamline the manufacture processes and reduce waste. Importantly this has also given us the opportunity
column4: > to add some new fun improvements, such as a pull pin and hollow construction for easy watering from the inside out.

column1: The idea for Seedboms came from Kabloom founder and director Darren Wilson. During his studies in 3D Design and Craft at university he decided to focus his attention on eco-friendly design. Finding that this area had precious few great products on the market at the time he took it upon himself to design something new. Not only did these products have to be designed with the environment in mind they also had to be innovative, fun and desirable. It was Darren's belief (and still is) that good design and good ideas and narratives should come first, the eco-friendly part should exist anyway and so from that standpoint the concept of the Seedbom began.

Darren decided to look into the root of this apparent modern problem, the problem modern (urban) cultures apparent disassociation with nature. The mission? To design a product that got people outside and create nature in their cities. It was also very important to design products that weren't going to end up in landfill someday. How do you achieve this? Either design something so desirable it would be passed on through generations (very difficult to do and impossible to predict) or design something that would destroy itself and be reborn through plant life.
And so the Seedbom was born!

Fact: Might sound crazy but Darren came up with this idea independently of any knowledge of the Guerrilla Gardening concept or even seed bombing! Imagine his surprise when he discovered that all his hard work actually had a movement he could associate with and participate in. This gave his product idea even more of a story, set the wheels in motion and gave Darren the drive he needed to make his design dream a reality. Serendipty at work!
A slightly younger Darren (founder of Kabloom and inventor of the Seedbom) talking about Guerrilla Gardening and Seed bombing.
Some of our clients:
A few awards along the way:
Pull the pin to open. Seedbom can now be watered from the inside out, watering the compost and seeds directly.

Seedboms split open on impact with the ground allowing the seeds to sprout. The shell protects the seedlings and the root system through early growing stages. 

                                                                                                             Prototype testing June 2015

+ 4 Pack Gift Boxes: 

Details:

Corn Poppy A wildflower known for it's scarlet paper like flowers. Poppies are a symbol of wartime remembrance, peace and hope. Cornflower Power A rich electric blue wildflower, now endangered was once common in crop fields. Let's bring it back! Starflower An ancient herb commonly known as Borage. Produces vivid blue edible star shaped flowers loved by bees. Borage is said to gladden the heart. Lovebom (forget-me-not) A wildflower known for its masses of tiny vibrant blue flowers. Forget-me-nots are symbolic of faithfulness and enduring love. Pollinator Beebom A positively buzzing mix of wildflower seeds that will grow into bright and beautiful nectar rich flowers loved by bumblebees and honey bees. Butterflybom A nectar rich wildflower mix loved by butterflies as well as other pollinating insects. Help to promote butterfly populations. Urban Bloomer An easy to establish mix of wildflowers perfect for bringing life to built up areas and attracting pollinating insects. Featherbom A wildflower mix to attract butterflies and bees during the summer and produce grains and seeds for wild birds during the cold winter months. Thymebom A herb known for its scented lilac flowers. Not only is thyme an edible herb it is also an important nectar source for bees when it flowers. Catnipbom The herb all the cool cats are into. Catnip is a mint like plant that treats most cats to a state of natural euphoria.

As part of our ethical sourcing policy all our suppliers are based in the UK. We try to keep as many supplies and processes as local as possible. All our manufacture, labour, assembly and packing are based locally in our home city of Glasgow.

We couldn't keep up with the demand for our original Seedbom. Our production method worked but was labour intensive and very time consuming. With our new production method we have the capability to make at least double the amount per week than we could with the potential to produce even more by scaled upsizing.
<div><span style=""background-color: initial
column2: >It's important to state that things are already well under way and that we are going into production no matter what the outcome of this campaign. However without your help things will certainly go a lot slower. We will be unable to commit to a large production run and get the product out across Europe and beyond as soon as possible. We have already committed to a starter production run so there is no risk involved to you regarding getting your perks. However we want to go ahead with a clear commitment, by ordering higher number of supplies and committing to larger production orders. This way we can meet demand and keep our costs down in order to make this a viable prospect for the future.

column1: Any funds contributed will go directly into materials and labour costs for mass production. In order to get the best prices we need to order our materials in bulk. The main things that have the highest cost and need to be purchased currently are:
<ul>
• Recycled paper shells
• Seed supplies
• Packaging
• Labour costs
<div>

With your help we can secure a bright future with Seedbom 2.0 and reach our goals to supply our product worldwide. We have years of experience in the market and we know what needs to be done to make things happen. We have a great client base already in place that ranges from distributors in the Netherlands and the United States (US sales of Seedbom 2.0 will commence in 2016) to department stores, museums, galleries, botanic gardens and many independent retailers.

So help us make an impact with our new Seedbom design by getting the word out and sharing our campaign as much as possible. We want to bring the world an ethically produced product that makes our daily environment just a little bit better, one Seedbom at a time!
Thanks for reading.
The Kabloom Team
","Seedboms are the friendly bombs that grow. Join forces with nature to transform unloved spaces with a blast of life and colour!
Made from recycled paper and embedded with an explosive mix of organic peat-free compost and wildflower/herb seeds, Seedboms are the weapons of choice for Guerrilla Gardeners.
Seedboms put the power to beautify into the hands of everyone.""                                                                                Richard Reynolds ~ GuerrillaGardening.org

Guerrilla gardening is 'the act of gardening on land that the gardeners do not have the legal rights to utilise, such as an abandoned site, an area that is not being cared for, or private property.' (wikipedia)
'A covert unauthorised planting of flora or crops in a public location.'(dictionary)

It can also be described as 'subversive gardening'. A kind of responsible rebellion. Simply put Guerrilla Gardeners are individuals or groups of people who take it upon themselves to improve areas they don't own with plant life. This can be done traditionally with forks and flowers or by seed bombing (the ideal solution for quick insurrections and for growing on those hard to reach places).

Most of who live in the city will find there are lots of places that could use a little colour in the form of flowers. It's easy to miss these sites but when you start looking for them you'll be amazed just how much potential there is out there. Next time you travel across a city, be it on your walk to work, driving along a dull motorway or commuting on the train, keep your eyes peeled for these areas full of Guerrilla Gardening potential.
Examples of places in need of Guerrilla Gardening / seed bombing:
Guerrilla Gardening and seed bombing in action:
UK's Guerrilla Gardening Guru Richard Reynolds on Guerrilla Gardening:
Want to know more? Visit www.guerrillagardening.org
We are Kabloom and we've been in the Seedbom making business for almost 5 years.
We've had great success in the past selling our product and so why change now?

Traditionally we made all our Seedboms by hand, working every hour we could to meet customer demand. Basically we couldn't keep up! A great problem to have, yes, however we needed to make a change in order to meet the demand and move the business forward.
How did we achieve this? Through research, development, re-design, materials and manufacture sourcing, increased manufacture capability and a good helping of innovation.

With Seedbom 2.0 we are now well on the way to having the capability to meet the market demand for our product. Although the final result has the same function (that was never in question) we have fully re-designed the product in order to allow for larger scale manufacture without compromising on our values and material sourcing policy. In fact by taking the time to redevelop the product we've managed to streamline the manufacture processes and reduce waste. Importantly this has also given us the opportunity to add some new fun improvements, such as a pull pin and hollow construction for easy watering from the inside out.

The idea for Seedboms came from Kabloom founder and director Darren Wilson. During his studies in 3D Design and Craft at university he decided to focus his attention on eco-friendly design. Finding that this area had precious few great products on the market at the time he took it upon himself to design something new. Not only did these products have to be designed with the environment in mind they also had to be innovative, fun and desirable. It was Darren's belief (and still is) that good design and good ideas and narratives should come first, the eco-friendly part should exist anyway and so from that standpoint the concept of the Seedbom began.

Darren decided to look into the root of this apparent modern problem, the problem modern (urban) cultures apparent disassociation with nature. The mission? To design a product that got people outside and create nature in their cities. It was also very important to design products that weren't going to end up in landfill someday. How do you achieve this? Either design something so desirable it would be passed on through generations (very difficult to do and impossible to predict) or design something that would destroy itself and be reborn through plant life.
And so the Seedbom was born!

Fact: Might sound crazy but Darren came up with this idea independently of any knowledge of the Guerrilla Gardening concept or even seed bombing! Imagine his surprise when he discovered that all his hard work actually had a movement he could associate with and participate in. This gave his product idea even more of a story, set the wheels in motion and gave Darren the drive he needed to make his design dream a reality. Serendipty at work!
A slightly younger Darren (founder of Kabloom and inventor of the Seedbom) talking about Guerrilla Gardening and Seed bombing.
Original Seedbom featured in:
Some of our clients:
A few awards along the way:
Pull the pin to open. Seedbom can now be watered from the inside out, watering the compost and seeds directly.

Seedboms split open on impact with the ground allowing the seeds to sprout. The shell protects the seedlings and the root system through early growing stages.                                                                                                              Prototype testing June 2015                                             + 4 Pack Gift Boxes: Details:Corn Poppy A wildflower known for it's scarlet paper like flowers. Poppies are a symbol of wartime remembrance, peace and hope. Cornflower Power A rich electric blue wildflower, now endangered was once common in crop fields. Let's bring it back! Starflower An ancient herb commonly known as Borage. Produces vivid blue edible star shaped flowers loved by bees. Borage is said to gladden the heart. Lovebom (forget-me-not) A wildflower known for its masses of tiny vibrant blue flowers. Forget-me-nots are symbolic of faithfulness and enduring love. Pollinator Beebom A positively buzzing mix of wildflower seeds that will grow into bright and beautiful nectar rich flowers loved by bumblebees and honey bees. Butterflybom A nectar rich wildflower mix loved by butterflies as well as other pollinating insects. Help to promote butterfly populations. Urban Bloomer An easy to establish mix of wildflowers perfect for bringing life to built up areas and attracting pollinating insects. Featherbom A wildflower mix to attract butterflies and bees during the summer and produce grains and seeds for wild birds during the cold winter months. Thymebom A herb known for its scented lilac flowers. Not only is thyme an edible herb it is also an important nectar source for bees when it flowers. Catnipbom The herb all the cool cats are into. Catnip is a mint like plant that treats most cats to a state of natural euphoria.

As part of our ethical sourcing policy all our suppliers are based in the UK. We try to keep as many supplies and processes as local as possible. All our manufacture, labour, assembly and packing are based locally in our home city of Glasgow.

We couldn't keep up with the demand for our original Seedbom. Our production method worked but was labour intensive and very time consuming. With our new production method we have the capability to make at least double the amount per week than we could with the potential to produce even more by scaled upsizing.

We have a great client base already in place that ranges from distributors in the Netherlands and the United States (US sales of Seedbom 2.0 will commence in 2016) to department stores, museums, galleries, botanic gardens and many independent retailers.

So help us make an impact with our new Seedbom design by getting the word out and sharing our campaign as much as possible. We want to bring the world an ethically produced product that makes our daily environment just a little bit better, one Seedbom at a time!
Thanks for reading.

Mario and Giovana are expecting a baby in January. They live in an abandoned building in Rome. They sleep on the floor.
<div>
<span style=""background-color: initial
column2: >Sofia and her teenage daughter Alessandra have no home. In her mid-fifties, Sofia lost her rented apartment. Alessandra is embarrassed, she can't tell her fellow students she sleeps on the floor. Sofia is ashamed, she's let her daughter down.

column1: <div><span style=""background-color: initial
column2: >Fabio has a drink problem, it gets him through the day, between meals. Otherwise, there's just the prospect of a cold, thin sheet of cardboard in a door way to lie on.

column1: Maria used to clean the steps of a hotel for a wage of 200 euros / month. It was never a sustainable life, but now she sleeps in Tiburtina station. She's 58 years old.
We have met each of these people and many more. We know their names, their needs, their stories. What they really need is to know someone cares about them.
<div>
<span style=""background-color: initial
column2: >They are among many hundreds of people in Rome who have slipped beneath a line. No longer able to support themselves, they lose their house, their ability to work or apply for a job, they become invisible.

column1: They are all Italian, living in their country's capital city.
<div>
<span style=""color: rgb(0, 0, 0)
Imagine, queuing up in a supermarket and you stink. People are looking at you, moving away from you. Soap, deodorant, shampoo are all luxuries, usually not affordable to a homeless person.
Could you sleep on a sheet of cardboard?
column5: >It's cold on the street, cardboard and a worn sleeping bag is a far cry from a memory foam mattress in a warm room.

column1: Pants? How would you feel if you didn't take your underwear off for 10 days or more? You don't have another pair, so you have to wait until you can wash and dry yours.

We have responded to the needs of one homeless community living in an abandoned building by giving them sleeping bags, air beds, blankets. This was an act of kindness and love, and the human warmth behind the donations meant even more than a comfortable, warm bed.
We want to replicate this formula and ensure that people sleeping in Rome, in buildings or on the street can sleep in comfort.

Love helps

People living on the streets see others around them surviving. They feel ashamed and humiliated. They see other people buying luxuries in shops, renting apartments, driving cars. Doing everyday things that are inaccessible to them.

A small act of kindness to a homeless person is a gift of love. We can't all do great things, but we can do small things with love. Hold out a hand to them, give them a reason to live, to get back above that line.
It's huge
<div><span style=""font-size: 16px
column4: >It is no small task to help even a fraction of the homeless in one of the world's greatest cities, but holding out a loving hand, giving a homeless man a hug, kissing a woman who is in tears of helplessness, can be replicated.

column1: <div><span style=""font-size: 16px
column4:
>We want to inspire others, we lead by example. Project Rome is about doing small things with great love. It doesn't matter where you do it, how you do it or what you do, as long as you do it. 

Share
column6: >If you can't spare money, spare love. Do small acts with great love. Share our message with your friends. Love is all it takes.

column1: ","Mario and Giovana are expecting a baby in January. They live in an abandoned building in Rome. They sleep on the floor.

Sofia and her teenage daughter Alessandra have no home. In her mid-fifties, Sofia lost her rented apartment. Alessandra is embarrassed, she can't tell her fellow students she sleeps on the floor. Sofia is ashamed, she's let her daughter down.
Fabio has a drink problem, it gets him through the day, between meals. Otherwise, there's just the prospect of a cold, thin sheet of cardboard in a door way to lie on.
Maria used to clean the steps of a hotel for a wage of 200 euros / month. It was never a sustainable life, but now she sleeps in Tiburtina station. She's 58 years old.
We have met each of these people and many more. We know their names, their needs, their stories. What they really need is to know someone cares about them.

They are among many hundreds of people in Rome who have slipped beneath a line. No longer able to support themselves, they lose their house, their ability to work or apply for a job, they become invisible.
They are all Italian, living in their country's capital city.
Do you stink?
Imagine, queuing up in a supermarket and you stink. People are looking at you, moving away from you. Soap, deodorant, shampoo are all luxuries, usually not affordable to a homeless person.
Could you sleep on a sheet of cardboard? It's cold on the street, cardboard and a worn sleeping bag is a far cry from a memory foam mattress in a warm room.
Pants? How would you feel if you didn't take your underwear off for 10 days or more? You don't have another pair, so you have to wait until you can wash and dry yours.

We have responded to the needs of one homeless community living in an abandoned building by giving them sleeping bags, air beds, blankets. This was an act of kindness and love, and the human warmth behind the donations meant even more than a comfortable, warm bed.
We want to replicate this formula and ensure that people sleeping in Rome, in buildings or on the street can sleep in comfort.

Love helps People living on the streets see others around them surviving. They feel ashamed and humiliated. They see other people buying luxuries in shops, renting apartments, driving cars. Doing everyday things that are inaccessible to them.

A small act of kindness to a homeless person is a gift of love. We can't all do great things, but we can do small things with love. Hold out a hand to them, give them a reason to live, to get back above that line.
It's huge

It is no small task to help even a fraction of the homeless in one of the world's greatest cities, but holding out a loving hand, giving a homeless man a hug, kissing a woman who is in tears of helplessness, can be replicated.

We want to inspire others, we lead by example. Project Rome is about doing small things with great love. It doesn't matter where you do it, how you do it or what you do, as long as you do it.    Share If you can't spare money, spare love. Do small acts with great love. Share our message with your friends. Love is all it takes.",0.0,0,"1 Campaign
|","Rome, Italy",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/project-rome-to-bring-love-onto-the-streets/pica
0,"<div class=""routerContentStory-storyBody"" data-v-1df7bf5a=""""><div> <h3>
<span style=""color: rgb(106, 106, 106)
column8: >My name is Joshua Leonard. I am the Writer/Director of the feature film, ""Half LIght."" I am an multi-award winning filmmaker and have been making films for the last 11 years.

column1: I remember the first time I ever saw a zombie movie. I was four years old and my mom introduced me to ""Night of the Living Dead."" From there, I was hooked. I have always wanted to make a zombie film of my own and ""Half Light"" is the story that I want to tell in doing so.
To contribute to this film means you will help create a zombie movie like you've never seen before. The story is unique, captivating, and very character driven.
""Synopsis""

Half Light follows the story of Aazia, whom carries the antigen for the zombie virus in her blood. She is told about a rumored, last government outpost that can create a cure with her help. Aazia runs into a small group of survivors and they decide to take up her quest in making the world back to the way it was.

They are getting hunted by a new, deadly threat that isn't human or the living dead. Now, Aazia and the survivors must get to the government outpost that may or may not still exist before this new 'breed' catches up to them.

What We Need &
column2:
What You Get

We are looking to raise $15k for the film
column3: a very small budget for a feature, but it is what is necessary in order to complete the movie. There is a very unique look and style to our members of the undead and especially for The Marauders. In order to achieve that, as well as feeding our cast and crew, we need the funding to complete this process.

column1: The perks offered are unique and we want to ensure that with your donation, you truly feel like you helped make a feature film come to life...or in our case, a member of the undead!

If we aren't able to reach the entire goal needed, we are going to have to, unfortunately, cut key scenes and elements out, but, are going to proceed with finishing this project. Everyone on the team, cast and crew included, are very driven and passionate to finish this film.

The Impact

""Half Light"" is valuable to you as it is a very unique take on the genre that is already over-saturated with the same ol' story and elements you've already seen over and over again. With your help, we can create a zombie movie that turns the genre 'on its head' and give it a freshness that has been lacking with other zombie films.
Risks &
column2:
Challenges

Thus far, everyone working on the project has worked for free
column3: using their own materials, make-up, and creating props with the hard-earned money from their individual pockets. This is how much this project means to them.

column1: In order to solve these issues, I would like to be able to fund the project with your donations in order to finish what we have started.
With every low-budget movie, there are always hurdles and challenges. This is one challenge I am looking to overcome.

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to help fund the movie, you can always help by getting the word out about the campaign and the movie we are trying to make. There are indigogo share tools made just for that!

""Dance for it"" story
«Dance for it» is a full-length documentary
about the strength of dreaming. We want to tell you the story about six
dancers, who believe that if you live your dreams, you can have the whole
world. Dancing is their passion, their meaning of life, their way, and they
could turn all this into their lifestyle. Very lucky, aren’t they? Every week
they fly to a new country to teach kizomba, semba and kuduro on social dance
festivals, spend there several days of work-shops, dance with every person
during night parties (and there is always a huge line of girls and guys
waiting to dance with them), go back home and as a result
they have nothing left from this week for their own life. they
are changing countries so fast that they don't have time to appreciate it.
They are booked for two years ahead. That means that next several years they are
going to live like this. They feel really blessed to have the opportunity to
live like this – to meet hundreds of awesome people, to be invited to a new
country where they might not even have an opportunity to come by their own, to
perform on respectful scenes, to feel that huge sincere gratitude from people
who take their workshops. Each of them dreams to fill every single day of their
life with dancing, to become better than they were yesterday and to help others
to do the same.
However, one day these huge dreams happened to
become a serious obstacle for making another huge dream come true. Is it
possible to accept the fact that the job you love the most, makes you refuse of
seeing parents, starting your own family, graduating from the university or
developing your own projects? Do they really have to sacrifice one dream to
another? How to make this choice? You will see a fascinating story about people who are dancing for their
dreams, looking for their way and will find it after all.
About our characters
I met our characters a year ago on a kizomba
Festival in Porto. I have been dancing kizomba
for half a year already and wanted to improve my dancing skills by learning
from the best European instructors.  I still remember, how fascinated I
was by inspiration, freedom and inner beauty which were coming out of them
while they were dancing during their performance. I really couldn’t stop
staring at them! I remember how Paulo and Lanna didn’t stop smiling for a
second, sharing joy, energy and pride from sharing their African heritage. <span>Or how Ricardo and Paula, having a very difficult
choreography and playing powerful and severe roles, but still were looking at
each other with love and gratitude for support in such a responsible moment.
I remember how Albir and
Carola hugged each other  after they finished their performance – I have
never seen something more warm and touching – like all the love of the world
was in that hug.
These people are made for dancing and they are
giving all of them to it. They have so many stories about pain, happiness,
disappointment and hope – and all this is screaming inside of them, getting out
in form of dance.
little bit about Kizomba
Kizomba is a pure love. This is about
having strength to overcome the fear of trusting people. This is about being
brave and open-hearted, because it is not easy to let an absolute stranger
embrace you. This is about giving to your partner all your care and tenderness,
and about being concerned about his feelings more than about your own. It lets man to be man and lets woman
to be a woman.
Why
this project our dream
Anna Vinokur, director: To be honest, when I was leaving for that
Festival in Portugal
a year ago, I was kind of broken and lost. I didn’t know where I should look
for the inspiration which could help me move on. I was watching them dancing
and it became a long-awaited turning point. When I see their sparkling eyes
while dancing, I catch their feeling of freedom and happiness. It makes me a
better person, more kind and caring. It gives me the a belief that there is

nothing I cannot do. I want you to feel the same.

Taras Onoprienko, producer: The story of our characters really touched me, I have been dancing for
18 years and can't visit my family too as often as I want. But no matter what is happening in my life, the dance is always with me!
How much money do we need
We want to spend together with our characters four-five
months and see together with you important and maybe crucial moments of
their lives. We will make our shootings in Lisbon,
Porto and Madrid.
We want to visit Albir’s family in Panama
and to meet people he loves the most, we want to go to Luanda to meet big families of Paulo and
Lanna and to see rich and beautiful Angolan culture and traditions. We want to
see, how Carola is creating her new life and how Ricardo with Paula are
achieving their ambitious dreams about their “Afrolatin Connection” and
“Muxima” brands. And we are inviting you to join us on our amazing journey. To
make this project happen, from the very beginning till the end, we need 109,000
euros.
Risks and challenges
Anna Vinokur, director: My main challenge is that this is my first
full-length documentary as a director. I graduated from film school in Saint-Petersburg, Russia, my diploma documentary film
had won the nomination for «The best documentary filmmaker» on a student film
festival in Saint-Petersburg. For the last three years I have been working as
television producer. I am absolutely sure that this film will be interesting to
totally different people – even if you learned the word “Kizomba” just five
minutes ago, you will find a kind human story about strong and beautiful people
who are trying to find the best recipe for their life. So basically this is a
film about each of us. So many people already believe in this project and that
is a huge inspiration and motivation for us – we absolutely cannot let you

down.

If you can't donate right now, support us by sharing our page, we will appreciate it!

Thank you!

Hugs, ""Dance for it"" team.

was by inspiration, freedom and inner beauty which were coming out of them
while they were dancing during their performance. I really couldn’t stop
staring at them! I remember how Paulo and Lanna didn’t stop smiling for a
second, sharing joy, energy and pride from sharing their African heritage. Or how Ricardo and Paula, having a very difficult
choreography and playing powerful and severe roles, but still were looking at
each other with love and gratitude for support in such a responsible moment.
I remember how Albir and
Carola hugged each other  after they finished their performance – I have
never seen something more warm and touching – like all the love of the world
was in that hug.
These people are made for dancing and they are
giving all of them to it. They have so many stories about pain, happiness,
disappointment and hope – and all this is screaming inside of them, getting out
in form of dance.A
little bit about Kizomba
Kizomba is a pure love. This is about
having strength to overcome the fear of trusting people. This is about being
brave and open-hearted, because it is not easy to let an absolute stranger
embrace you. This is about giving to your partner all your care and tenderness,
and about being concerned about his feelings more than about your own. It lets man to be man and lets woman
to be a woman.
Why
this project our dream
Anna Vinokur, director: To be honest, when I was leaving for that
Festival in Portugal
a year ago, I was kind of broken and lost. I didn’t know where I should look
for the inspiration which could help me move on. I was watching them dancing
and it became a long-awaited turning point. When I see their sparkling eyes
while dancing, I catch their feeling of freedom and happiness. It makes me a
better person, more kind and caring. It gives me the a belief that there is
nothing I cannot do. I want you to feel the same.Taras Onoprienko, producer: The story of our characters really touched me, I have been dancing for
18 years and can't visit my family too as often as I want. But no matter what is happening in my life, the dance is always with me!
How much money do we need
We want to spend together with our characters four-five
months and see together with you important and maybe crucial moments of
their lives. We will make our shootings in Lisbon,
Porto and Madrid.
We want to visit Albir’s family in Panama
and to meet people he loves the most, we want to go to Luanda to meet big families of Paulo and
Lanna and to see rich and beautiful Angolan culture and traditions. We want to
see, how Carola is creating her new life and how Ricardo with Paula are
achieving their ambitious dreams about their “Afrolatin Connection” and
“Muxima” brands. And we are inviting you to join us on our amazing journey. To
make this project happen, from the very beginning till the end, we need 109,000
euros.
Risks and challenges
Anna Vinokur, director: My main challenge is that this is my first
full-length documentary as a director. I graduated from film school in Saint-Petersburg, Russia, my diploma documentary film
had won the nomination for «The best documentary filmmaker» on a student film
festival in Saint-Petersburg. For the last three years I have been working as
television producer. I am absolutely sure that this film will be interesting to
totally different people – even if you learned the word “Kizomba” just five
minutes ago, you will find a kind human story about strong and beautiful people
who are trying to find the best recipe for their life. So basically this is a
film about each of us. So many people already believe in this project and that
is a huge inspiration and motivation for us – we absolutely cannot let you
down. If you can't donate right now, support us by sharing our page, we will appreciate it!Thank you!Hugs, ""Dance for it"" team.",2.0,2,"2 Campaigns

My name is Rhavynn Drummer and I am a casting director and the creator of the series GOOD GIRLS!!  I started writing this project in 2013 because I wanted to create an honest depiction of what women like me face today!  We filmed and released the project in 2014.  We've had GREAT feedback from our audience and have been able to take home some awesome awards as well!

Season one consisted of five episodes and was COMPLETELY self-funded!  Season two consists of TEN episodes and we'll need your help to make this season a success!!

What We Need 

There are a lot of elements and costs involved in filming a digital series.  Filming ten episodes is almost the equivalent of filming a feature film!  We're looking to raise $30,000 for production, post-production, and marketing!
Here is how your contribution will assist us!!
<li><span style=""letter-spacing: 0px
<li><span style=""letter-spacing: 0px
<li><span style=""letter-spacing: 0px
<li><span style=""letter-spacing: 0px
• Hair and Make Up
• Cameras and Equipment
• Props
• Hard Drives
• Editor
• Music Composition
• Promotional Materials (flyers, screenings, photoshoots, events)
• Graphic Designer
• Marketing and PR Team
<div>

What You Get

For all of your generous help, here are some wonderful perks:
• Special ""Thank You"" from the cast and crew
• One on One coaching session with Rhavynn Drummer
• Walk on roles
• A digital or DVD copy of Season 1 and Season 2
• Invites to Premiere

• And much more!!

    • My Journey

column3:
/>

When people ask me, ""Why are you still single?"" I jokingly reply, ""God is just giving me more material for my show Good Girls!""  The past two years have been an incredible journey.  I still can't believe that I got in a bed, half-naked, with a man, and filmed it!! This process has made me a stronger person and has pulled out of me the artist that I have always longed to be.  Self-funding the first season was an act of faith, a lesson in trust, and taught me not to doubt myself.  Creating a crowd finding campaign is another act of faith! I'm the person that doesn't like to ask for help and it's taken me a year to build up the courage to create this campaign!
column7: >My goal is to build our audience and to pitch the show to television networks.  I believe in this project and I know it's ready to be on your TV screens!

column1: Even if you are unable to give money, please share this project with your friends! Watch Season 1, tweet about it, ""like"" it, and subscribe to our channel.  ANY assistance is GREATLY appreciated!!  Thank you for taking the time to watch our show and view the campaign!  Take flight!!
