Welcome to The Dark Rite world!

My name is Richard LeMay, the writer and director of The Dark Rite.  First off, I'd like to say thank you for reading this.  A few years ago, I got this crazy idea in my head after watching the news about a string of home invasions in Long Island.  Sadly, my brain went straight to ""What if you could capture the guys who broke into your home?  What if it was all a trap so you could use bad people for some sinister reason?""  This, of course, lead to...  Witches.
<span style=""background-color: initial
column2: >So I went into the forest and wrote a script.  A year later, I called my old producing partner Trevite Willis.  In 2010 we produced a beautiful film called
column6: > which we shot in the Bahamas. That movie went on to win 22 awards internationally and sell in 27 countries.  With Trevite on board and an amazing cast and crew, we made
column8: >.  Almost a year ago, we shot this weird, dark story in upstate New York.  Definitely one of my all time favorite experiences.  To be able to work with such talented people and make something so cool, was awesome.  The film is pretty awesome too.  I am very proud of it.

column2: >This is a movie about witches.  It's fun.  It's scary. And it's almost finished!

column1: Watch the trailer!

We are looking for finishing funds to complete the movie.  The edit is done, but we still need to do sound design, music, color correction and special effects.  I have been making movies for the last 15 years and this is by far my favorite. An avid fan of horror movies, I always wanted to direct one. I waited until I came up with a truly original idea to make this dream come true. Though by it's very nature, this film is dark,  there is also a very clear message: ""what you put out, you get back.""  Inspired by films like Rosemary's Baby and The Believers, the story starts off like a drama before the horror sets in.
Every 25 years a family of powerful witches must perform the unthinkable.  Human sacrifice.  They must take four human lives, one being a member of their own family.

At the center of this story, is Kerry (Eden Brolin) an eighteen year old girl who finds herself the target of the unimaginable.  As she frantically looks for a way out of her predicament, she realizes she will do anything to escape.  David (Ross Wellinger) the youngest family member, is chosen to perform the sacrifices but finds himself falling in love with Kerry and questioning his family's ancient tradition.  What follows is a story of conflicted characters, occult rituals and hair pin plot twists that will leave audiences gasping.

Contributing to this project will help us finish the film the way it is meant to be done. One of the cool things about shooting this movie was we did all practical special effects.  Dead World Effects came in and made everything look real. Literally.  We do want to include some digital visual effects as well.  That's one of the reasons we need more money.  This is not a typical horror movie.  I feel The Dark Rite is, at it's heart, a drama.  Character development and the performances are vital to this story, as is dismemberment and blood rituals.  If you like horror, you will love The Dark Rite!  Please Help Us.

What We Need &
<div>
We need a total of $50,000 to complete this film. This money will be put towards:
- Sound Design
- Color Correction
- Special Effects
- Music (original score and incidental)
- Festival/Delivery Costs
Please help us reach our goal!  Our perks include anything from the shooting script to Executive Producer credit in the film title.

If we do not reach our goal, the money raised will go towards the original score, as we have already begun to work on that.  Let me just say, what we have with this film right now is so good, that I'm excited to see it to completion and share it with you. We need your financial support.  No contribution is too small. THANK YOU!
The Team
RICHARD
LEMAY -
column5: >Director, Writer and Producer Richard LeMay has directed three (3) feature films, all

column1: of which, have sold internationally.  After the success of '200 American', LeMay directed the award winning 'Whirlwind.'  Most recently, Richard’s film, 'Naked As We
Came,' which he wrote, produced and directed, was distinguished as a Closing Night, Opening Night or Centerpiece film at festivals around the world. The winner
of multiple awards, 'Naked,' opened in theaters in 2013 to critical acclaim.  THE
NEW YORK TIMES calls 'Naked As We Came,' “a lovely surprise of a film.”  THE
HUFFINGTON POST calls the film “stunning...a class act.”  THE HOLLYWOOD
REPORTER calls it “a thoughtful, sensitive exploration of strained family
dynamics.” LeMay’s producing credits include 'Water' starring Michael Shannon
(Oscar nominee - 'Revolutionary Road,' 'Boardwalk Empire') and Idina Menzel ('Glee,' 'RENT'). He also produced the acclaimed 'Children of God' which won 21 awards
internationally and sold in 37 countries. The film opened in theaters in the
US, UK and the Netherlands in 2011 and is currently airing on SHOWTIME.
column8: >Producer, Trevite A. Willis is the owner of Southern Fried

column1: Filmworks.  Via her Southern Fried Filmworks production shingle, Ms. Willis is responsible for some of the finest and most innovative voices currently and quietly evolving contemporary world cinema.  Ms. Willis takes emerging filmmakers from conception  through distribution.  With an MBA in International
Business, Ms. Willis has been engaged in film
production since 1999.

Her feature films include the romantic comedy, 'What a Man Wouldn’t Do for a Woman,' and the critically acclaimed African American LGBT coming-of- age drama, 'Blueprint,' which enjoyed success at festivals around the world, including the London
Lesbian and Gay Film Festival, OutFest, NewFest, ""Best First Feature"" nominee at Frameline and a ""Best Picture"" nomination at FESPACO.  The 2008 Columbia University short film, 'Uncle
Killa,' she produced earned the director a DGA
Best Student Film.  “Uncle Killa” was also selected as an HBO finalist at
the American Black Film Festival and subsequently picked up by
HBO.  She produced the award-winning Bahamian drama, 'Children of God,' which is currently airing on
Showtime.  'Children of God' has had theatrical
releases in the US, UK and The Netherlands. The
film has won 21 awards, and has sold to 37 other territories.
column8: >Director of Photography, Vitaly Bokser, was born in Mink, Bellarussia.  At

column1: the age of three, Vitaly was transplanted to Brooklyn, NY
where he currently resides.
After more than fifteen years of developing his craft, he
has shot a formidable body of work that encompasses 14 feature
films, over 50 short narrative films, multiple documentary, TV and commercial work. Some of his most recent
projects include the feature film, 'Pizza Man.'  Bokser's TV and documentary work includes National
Geographic Channel series, 'Evacuate Earth' and 'How to Survive the End of the Earth.'
Eden Brolin (Kerry) - Manson's Lost Girls, I Dream Too Much
Eric Nelsen (Sean) - Emmy award winner - The Bay, A Walk Among The Tombstones with Liam Neeson
Ross Wellinger (David) - Long Distance
Justiin Davis (Brian) - Boardwalk Empire, Central Park
Gerald McCullouch (Martin) - played Bobby Dawson on CSI for 10 years as well as numerous movies and TV shows.

As a team, the Dark Rite crew and cast have been making movies for years. We have all seen success and overcome obstacles.  That's the nature of making movies.  Everyday is a series of obstacles but you learn to roll with the punches and get the job done.  There is no doubt that The Dark Rite will be completed. My personal track record as a director and producer allows me to say that openly.  Having support through this campaign will only help the process along.  Thank you so much for taking the time to read all of this!  Whatever your contribution, I thank you again for supporting this amazing process!    - Richard LeMay
Other Ways You Can Help
Even if you can't contribute, you can help by spreading the word about this campaign.  Tell all your friends and don't forget your indiegogo share tools!  And...

","Welcome to The Dark Rite world!

My name is Richard LeMay, the writer and director of The Dark Rite.  First off, I'd like to say thank you for reading this.  A few years ago, I got this crazy idea in my head after watching the news about a string of home invasions in Long Island.  Sadly, my brain went straight to ""What if you could capture the guys who broke into your home?  What if it was all a trap so you could use bad people for some sinister reason?""  This, of course, lead to...  Witches.

So I went into the forest and wrote a script.  A year later, I called my old producing partner Trevite Willis.  In 2010 we produced a beautiful film called Children Of God, which we shot in the Bahamas. That movie went on to win 22 awards internationally and sell in 27 countries.  With Trevite on board and an amazing cast and crew, we made The Dark Rite.  Almost a year ago, we shot this weird, dark story in upstate New York.  Definitely one of my all time favorite experiences.  To be able to work with such talented people and make something so cool, was awesome.  The film is pretty awesome too.  I am very proud of it.
This is a movie about witches.  It's fun.  It's scary. And it's almost finished!
Watch the trailer!

We are looking for finishing funds to complete the movie.  The edit is done, but we still need to do sound design, music, color correction and special effects.  I have been making movies for the last 15 years and this is by far my favorite. An avid fan of horror movies, I always wanted to direct one. I waited until I came up with a truly original idea to make this dream come true. Though by it's very nature, this film is dark,  there is also a very clear message: ""what you put out, you get back.""  Inspired by films like Rosemary's Baby and The Believers, the story starts off like a drama before the horror sets in.
Every 25 years a family of powerful witches must perform the unthinkable.  Human sacrifice.  They must take four human lives, one being a member of their own family.

At the center of this story, is Kerry (Eden Brolin) an eighteen year old girl who finds herself the target of the unimaginable.  As she frantically looks for a way out of her predicament, she realizes she will do anything to escape.  David (Ross Wellinger) the youngest family member, is chosen to perform the sacrifices but finds himself falling in love with Kerry and questioning his family's ancient tradition.  What follows is a story of conflicted characters, occult rituals and hair pin plot twists that will leave audiences gasping.

Contributing to this project will help us finish the film the way it is meant to be done. One of the cool things about shooting this movie was we did all practical special effects.  Dead World Effects came in and made everything look real. Literally.  We do want to include some digital visual effects as well.  That's one of the reasons we need more money.  This is not a typical horror movie.  I feel The Dark Rite is, at it's heart, a drama.  Character development and the performances are vital to this story, as is dismemberment and blood rituals.  If you like horror, you will love The Dark Rite!  Please Help Us.   What We Need & What You Get
We need a total of $50,000 to complete this film. This money will be put towards:
- Sound Design
- Color Correction
- Special Effects
- Music (original score and incidental)
- Festival/Delivery Costs
Please help us reach our goal!  Our perks include anything from the shooting script to Executive Producer credit in the film title.

If we do not reach our goal, the money raised will go towards the original score, as we have already begun to work on that.  Let me just say, what we have with this film right now is so good, that I'm excited to see it to completion and share it with you. We need your financial support.  No contribution is too small. THANK YOU!
The Team
RICHARD

“Una casa para Karen” el segundo reto que emprendemos en “Proyecto | Tierra de Esperanza”. Reto en el cual, nuestra intención es de recaudar dinero para poder ayudar a Karen, una joven madre hondureña y su hijo Mateo.

Nuestra intención es, con el dinero recaudado, el poder reconstruirle a Karen y a su hijo la casa en donde viven.

Realmente solo necesitamos 429,77€ , pero en Indiegogo el monto debe ser como mínimo de 500€.

Os damos las gracias de antemano por colaborar.

Diego Moya [Fotodocumentalista]
“Proyecto | Tierra de Esperanza”

====================================================


“Una casa para Karen” (""One home for Karen"") is the second challenge we take on ""Project | Land of Hope"". Challenge in which our intention is to collect money to help Karen, a young Honduran mother and her daughter Mateo.

Our intention is, with the money collected, to re-build to Karena and her daughter the home where they are living.

Really only we need 429,77€, but in Indiegogo the amount should be at least 500 €.

We thank you in advance for helping.

Diego Moya [Photodocumentalist]
""Project | Land of Hope""

To those of us at Finance of America Mortgage, community is
everything.  On top of doing everything we can to provide quality lending
services throughout the state of New Hampshire, we try to reach out to those in
need and do whatever we can.  This holiday season, we’re partnering up with
local churches for a gift drive.  Finance of America’s Focus on Family, creating memories by delivering joy, because everyone deserves a great Christmas.

Churches throughout the state are gathering wish lists from families in need.  Our job is to fulfill those wishes and we need your help to do so.  We’re hoping to
raise at least $2,000 in donations which, on top of our own and our co-sponsors
efforts, will enable us to make sure that all the families in need wake up
joyful on Christmas morning.
